column1: Clever - AAPPL Testing Window -  Screen/Menu label incorrectly limited to AAPPL

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Log in to Client Site via Clever

Navigate to the AAPPL Testing Window screen

*Obtained Result*

The screen is labeled “AAPPL Testing Window” even though users can access both AAPPL and ALIRA tests.

*Expected Result*

The screen/menu name should be updated to an accurate label that reflects access to multiple test types

Thank you very much,

Young-A

column1: Mass Email feature - Improvement
column28:
# When the excel file is uploaded if the Headers excepted are not found in the Excel file header, give an Error message showing: Headers in Excel file must match the required format. Set the Headers to "Name (required)" & "Email Address (required)" and reupload the file

# In case there are empty rows in the file, delete those rows. Users are facing challenge the find empty rows at the end of file in case any.
# System should accept email addresses with apostrophes in them.
column228:
# Excel file headers
## The Excel upload header validation has been relaxed to provide more flexibility to users.
The system now only checks that the first column header contains Name and the second column header contains Email, rather than requiring exact header text. The warning message is more generic as well. 
## If the user uploads an Excel file with invalid or unsupported headers, we are actively returning an alert indicating that the headers do not match the required format and need to be corrected before reuploading the file. 
!image-20251223-182726.png|width=616,alt="image-20251223-182726.png"!
!image-20251223-182732.png|width=616,alt="image-20251223-182732.png"!

# Empty Rows
## If both Name AND Email are empty, the row is now considered empty and will be skipped during processing, regardless of whether the empty row appears between valid data or at the end of the template. 
## If either the Name OR the Email field is missing (for example, the Name is empty but an Email is present), a warning message will still be returned to the user.
# Email Addresses
## The regex in charge of email validation in this functionality has been updated to allow apostrophes/spaces in email addresses, while still validating that the domain format is correct.

|*Allowed* |*Not Allowed* |
|[test@ecusd4.com|mailto:test@ecusd4.com]|test  @gmail.com |
|test     [1@gmail.es|mailto:1@gmail.es]|test@gmail    .com|
|test'OTest@gmail.com|test@@gmail.com |
|[test+test+test@blaineschools.org|mailto:test+test+test@blaineschools.org]|test@gmail|

!image-20251222-232040.png|width=478,alt="image-20251222-232040.png"!

!image-20251222-231951.png|width=682,alt="image-20251222-231951.png"!

# Excel - Sheet Name
## We are now returning a warning message if the user updates the sheet name in the Excel template, similar to the AAPPL Accommodations Batch Processing functionality.
!image-20251222-231730.png|width=634,alt="image-20251222-231730.png"!
column247: 22/Dec/25 7:15 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:712020:87f13a59-f3fb-4758-bd8f-8eef20a203a6] I added the update on the apostrophes. Thank you!
column248: 22/Dec/25 7:16 PM;712020:87f13a59-f3fb-4758-bd8f-8eef20a203a6;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc] Perfect! Thank you
column249:
22/Dec/25 7:28 PM;712020:87f13a59-f3fb-4758-bd8f-8eef20a203a6;[~accountid:557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f] , As a suggestion, we can update the error message shown when uploading the Excel template to the following:

"The headers in the uploaded Excel file do not match the required format. Please ensure the headers are "Name (required)" and "Email Address (required)" on separate lines, as shown in the downloadable template on this page, or "Name_(required)" and "Email Address_(required)" on a single line. Please correct the file and reupload it."

This would help prevent cases where users do something like "Name (required)" on a single line, which currently results in an exception.



--EDIT--

The current error error message is: 

!image-20251222-223018.png|width=622,alt="image-20251222-223018.png"!

!image-20251222-223039.png|width=622,alt="image-20251222-223039.png"!

column1: ASL Demo - II Component - Button text style is not aligned with the rest of the content
column28:
In the II component, the text style needs to be aligned. The button labeled “Let me adjust and try again” does not match the font style and size used in the rest of the component.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Navigate to the II component.

Locate the button labeled “Let me adjust and try again.”

Compare its font style and size with other buttons or text in the component.

*Obtained Result*

The “Let me adjust and try again” button uses a different font style and/or size compared to the rest of the component.

*Expected Result*

The button text should use the same font style and size as the other elements.

Open the accessibility options.

column1: ASL DEMO - RC Component - Pop-up message displayed after completing the last task
column28:
When finishing the last task of the RC component, a pop-up message appears briefly on the screen before the system redirects to the teacher video screen.

This pop-up message should not be displayed during this transition.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Navigate to the RC component

Complete all tasks until reaching the last task

*Obtained Result*

A pop-up message is displayed for a few seconds before the user is redirected to the teacher video screen.

*Expected Result*

No pop-up message should be displayed, and the user should be redirected directly to the teacher video screen.

column1: ASL Demo - RC Component - Video pop-up cannot be resized
column28:
In the RC component  it is not possible to change the size of the video tab. The video pop-up does not include the resize functionality in the corner, unlike the original test behavior

*Steps to Reproduce*

Navigate to the RC component.

Open a video within the component.

Attempt to resize the video pop-up.

*Obtained Result*

The video pop-up cannot be resized and does not display any resize control in the corner.

*Expected Result*

Videos should allow users to reduce and increase their size, matching the functionality available in the original test.

column1: CLONE - New DLI inquiry - display column in OARS identifying the rater whose form submission was released with the test
column28:
Yun Ju,

We have another request from DLI to hear about a new possible feature. Do you have a field that identifies the Rater ID associated with the form that releases with the OPI? If so, what would the effort be to flow that to OARS and then Vijay can add a column to the CSV? DLI wants to understand for each test which rater submitted the final rationale.

If that field doesn’t exist already, would it be a large effort to create it in the DB?

Thank you!

Annie



From DLI: 

Good afternoon, Annie and Kim,

 

I wanted to circle back on the request below from DLI, as well as the response we provided to them after consulting with you (copied below for convenience).

 

They reached out again today with the following: _“We would still like an additional column that explicitly identifies which rater provided the rationale, because the logic you provided only works for the first three examples, but the fourth one is an ACTFL internal decision which is not indicated in the data. Does this make sense?”_

 

Could you please look into this and let us know whether this is something that can be done? We look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank you,
Yesenia

 

------

*DLI Request: Since the rationale can be either from the 2*^*nd*^ *or 3*^*rd*^ *rater rating rationale, would it be possible to indicate that in a separate column as well, so that we could match the rationale to the corresponding rating?*

 

*ACTFL/LTI Response:*  

The rationale always comes from the last/latest rater whose rating matches the final rating. So, here are a few examples:
R1 (Tester) = 2, R2 = 2, rationale comes from R2

R1 (Tester) = 2, R2 = 2+, R3 = 2+, rationale comes from R3

R1 (Tester) = 2, R2 = 1+, R3 = 2, rationale comes from R3

R1 (Tester) = 3, R2 = 2+, R3 = 3+, rationale comes from the rationale that ACTFL recommends

column1: AAPPL Rater Utility - Unable to download Excel file in AAPPL Rater Utility
column28:
It is not possible to download the Excel file from the AAPPL Rater Utility screen. When clicking the “Download Data in Excel” button, the system displays a pop up message with the error “Sequence contains no elements” and the file is not generated.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Navigate to the AAPPL Rater Utility screen.

Click on the “Download Data in Excel” button.

*Obtained Result:*
A pop-up error message is displayed: “Sequence contains no elements”, and the Excel file is not downloaded.

*Expected Result:*
The system should successfully generate and download the Excel file containing the data displayed on the screen.

column1: AAPPL Rater Utility - Change Daily Fetching Limit action option is not correctly displayed in the menu
column28:
The system should display a dropdown menu with predefined options 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 100. Instead of a dropdown, a numeric input field is displayed. This field allows users to enter any value, including numbers outside the defined options.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Navigate to AAPPL Rater Utility screen

In the menu select Change Daily Fetching Limit 

Fill in the field 

*Obtained Result:*
A free numeric input field is displayed and allows any value to be entered.

*Expected Result:*
A dropdown menu should be displayed with only the following selectable options: 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 100.

column1: Estimation of Timeline and Budget for Enhance OPIc to Superior for Multicampus
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Chol Yoon

*What is your email address?:*
[cyoon@languagetesting.com|mailto:cyoon@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
Estimation of Timeline and Budget for Enhance OPIc to Superior for Multicampus

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
R&D

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
Unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
URGENT \- Must be completed within the next 2\-3 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
As an OPIc Tester, they can get tested on form 4 and form 5 so that they can get the score up to Superior

Rater can review from 4 and from 5 which were taken by OPIc testers in Korea, so that they can provide score double\-rated

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
OPIc test can receive up to Superior classification of the test

Form 4 and Form 5 can be tested by OPIc user

Raters can provide score under ACTFL scale for Form 4 and Form 5 from OPIc in Multicampus

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Multicampus Test Candidates
Testers/Raters

CLONE - Auto Remote Proctor Rate Increase
column28:
Hi, 

Finance has approved an increase to Auto Remote Proctoring (ARP) fees from *$17.50 to $20.00*. While Sales has already applied this updated fee to new accounts, several existing clients are still being billed at the lower rate.

Attached is a spreadsheet identifying all clients who continue to receive ARP at *$17.50* (clients with contracted pricing at $17.50 have been removed). Each tab represents a different test type.

*Request:*
Please update the ARP fee for *all clients listed on each tab* from *$17.50 to $20.00*.

*Notes for reference:*

* The spreadsheet includes the client’s current total test cost ($80.50 or $90.50).
* Column *M* shows the updated total cost needed for each client ($83.00 or $93.00), reflecting the $2.50 increase.
* This rate increase has already been communicated to clients and should take effect *January 1, 2026*.

Please let me know if you have any questions or need any additional information.

Thank you!

column1: FINANCE: Credit hold for past due clients
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Adina Calugaru

*What is your email address?:*
[acalugaru@languagetesting.com|mailto:acalugaru@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title - Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
FINANCE: Credit hold for past due clients

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
FINANCE

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
Near Future - Required within the next 6-12 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
From accounting perspective, we would need to be able to inactivate/block clients in TMS that are past due. This right should be granted to Jay, Adina, Jaclyn and Maritza.
A prompter should notify the clients their account is seriously past due and they should contact Finance to resolve the inactivation.
Clients should not be able to order more tests once blocked.
Accounting should be able to reactivate clients after nonpayment resolve,



Notes from 10/21/25 call:

* Will leverage existing Deactivation flow [[LTT-7279] INTK-570: OPS: TMS Account Deactivation and Improvements to Notes Fields|https://app.asana.com/1/16125004755173/project/1201964277215674/task/1208542304166371]
** Finance users will be given access to deactivate accounts and add notes
*** New selection between Operational Hold and Financial Hold
*** When TMS user indicates Financial Hold, a popup will be enabled on login to the Client Site explaining the account status and necessary steps to get it reactivated
*** Users on deactivated accounts will be completely blocked from the Client Site until access is restored by paying and getting the acct reactivated
*** When reactivated on TMS, access to Client Site is restored instantly
** Finance will ensure that every effort has been made outside of the system via email and in coordination with the sales rep to collect payment before deactivating accounts.
** Deactivation flows down the entire acct hierarchy and covers all users

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Finance has the rights to inactivate due to a reason that will be prompted on the past due client portal welcome page once they log in. 
Finance should have the rights to reactivate clients in TMS once situation resolved.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients

*Please explain any specific risks of non-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non-completion, please type N/A.:*
LTI will have cash collection issues and delinquent customers will be able to keep ordering tests.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: AAPPL ILS/PW Machine Scoring Opt Out
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Sabrina Sun

*What is your email address?:*
[ssun@languagetesting.com|mailto:ssun@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title - Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
AAPPL ILS/PW Machine Scoring Opt Out

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
R&D

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
When Prioritization Permits - Request can be prioritized against other projects during the monthly meeting.

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:* 

* As an AAPPL client (district or school admin), I want to be able to opt out of my learners’ tests being graded by the machine scoring pipeline so that my students’ tests will be scored only by a human grader.  

 

* As an AAPPL client (district or school admin), I want to be able to opt out of my learners’ tests being used as training data to improve or develop new features for the machine scoring pipeline so that I control my learners’ responses from being fed into a machine learning system.  

 

* As an LTI employee, I want there to be two separate options in the LTI TMS Account Setup page to track users opt-out options: one labelled “Opt out of Machine Scoring of AAPPLs” -- that, when checked, keeps the tests from flowing to the machine system during the rating process and the other -- and another labelled “Opt out of AI Training” -- that keeps tests from being used for training purposes, so that we can comply with clients’ requests.   

* As an LTI employee, I want to be able to see and manage tests flagged for either of the two options. For the first option (Opt out of machine scoring of AAPPLs), I want tests taken under this account to be redirected to a different scoring pipeline, where it will be graded by only human raters (a.k.a. those tests will never pass through the machine scoring pipeline). For the second option (Opt out of AI Training), I want those tests to be permanently flagged as opt out of training in the database so that when I pull the data to train or finetune the machine scoring model, I can easily filter out those flagged tests.  

* As an LTI employee, I want to be able to track opt out decisions on the TMS account level and the individual test level via Tableau. As such, please ensure these opt-out flags are available in DataMart so that we can pull reports with this information included. 

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:* 

* The opt out functionality will reside in TMS on the Client Set Up page. It will be a checkbox that is not visible to clients and only visible to select LTI employees with TMS authority access (i.e. Admin users like Mark Dulsky, Kim Sallee, Annie Wendel, Jennifer Quinlan). Each option (machine scoring and training data usage) will have its own box.  

* As needed, LTI employees (with TMS authority access) can mark tests from the requesting AAPPL account to be human rated by checking the box in TMS (which will remain invisible for clients).  

* As needed, LTI employees (with TMS authority access) can mark tests from the requesting AAPPL account as not to be used as training data by checking the box in TMS (which will remain invisible for clients). Tests that opt out of training data should also be permanently flagged in the database so that they are not accidentally selected as part of the training set at any point.  

* These two opt out choices should be separate and distinct. Opting out of one does not automatically mean opting out of the other.  

* All tests will need two additional columns for the two flags. Both options will need their own flag, and this flag must stay with the test throughout the pipeline and be passed to Datamart.  

* Opt out decisions are not retroactive to tests taken before a client’s decision is fully finalized in TMS (a.k.a. when LTI has checked the box on their behalf). This means that tests taken while LTI is communicating with the client on their decision to opt out will not be opted out of anything.  

* Users (student test takers and AAPPL account holders) will not have direct access to this flagging. These options will be controlled by LTI employees, and AAPPL account holders must send opt out requests through email.  

* This feature will follow the standard hierarchy functionality.  

* If an individual account (that may or not be a child account) selects opt out for either option, only that individual account is opted out.  

* If the top parent account selects opt out for either option, all child accounts under it will be opted out, as well.  

* Accounts with hierarchy over other accounts (i.e. a school district) will be contacted by LTI employees via email to further communicate how/if this decision will affect child accounts.  

* While we hope to expand this function to other tests in the future, this current development request is solely concerned with the AAPPL ILS and PW.  

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non-completion, please type N/A.:*
Customers have already raised questions and concerns about an opt-out option for machine scoring. These inquiries will likely only increase in the future, so we should prepare this system now in anticipation. 

Furthermore, future legislation may limit us from passing certain batches of tests through our pipeline. Having a flagging system in place at that time will help us be prepared for such developments. 

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
This request cannot be completed until the model is approved by ACTFL as the sole rater on the AAPPL ILS and PW.

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
We will need to add a disclaimer somewhere informing users of who to contact in order to opt out. 

———————————————

column1: Rater Site Announcements - Protocol selection reverses after saving message in message register
column28:
When creating a new message in the Message Register section of Rater Site, the system is not preserving the selected protocol upon saving. After selecting the OPI product, choosing either the ILR or ACTFL protocol, and entering a message, the user clicks the “Save” button. The message appears correctly in the list below and the protocol is reversed. Messages created under ILR are saved as ACTFL, and messages created under ACTFL are saved as ILR.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Go to Message Register in Rater Site.

Select the product OPI.

Choose either ILR or ACTFL protocol.

Enter a message in the text field.

Click the “Save” button.

*Expected Result:*
The message should be saved with the same protocol that was selected (ILR or ACTFL)

*Obtained Result:*
The system saves the message in the list but the protocol is inverted.

Navigate to either Rating Admin Site or Rater Site.

Enter a message using Chinese or Arabic characters.

Save or submit the message.

Observe the displayed text.

*Obtained Result:*

The system replaces all Chinese or Arabic characters with question marks

*Expected Result:*

Chinese and Arabic characters should be displayed correctly anywhere text entry is supported

column1: Rater Announcements -  System displays incorrect pop-ups and freezes when ‘Message Acknowledgement’ is clicked with no items selected
column28:
When clicking the “Message Acknowledgement” button without selecting any message checkbox, the system triggers an incorrect acknowledgement flow.
Instead of validating that no messages were selected, the system displays a confirmation pop-up stating:
“Message will be acknowledged. Are you going to proceed?”

After clicking “OK,” a second pop-up appears:
“Record saved successfully.”

Once the user clicks “OK” again, the system becomes stuck

*Obtained Result:*

The system displays an incorrect confirmation message even though no message was selected.

A second pop-up indicates a successful save that should not occur.

After closing both pop-ups, the system becomes stuck

*Expected Result:*

The system should display a clear validation message instructing the user to select at least one message before proceeding.

column1: Rater Announcements - Unable to register announcements for OPI tests
column28:
It is not possible to register an announcement for OPI tests under any protocol. After entering the language, selecting the protocol, writing the announcement text, and clicking the “Save” button, the system displays a pop-up message stating “Please select the required field.”

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Navigate to Rater Announcements Register in Rating Admin Site.

Select Language.

Select any OPI protocol.

Enter an announcement in the text field.

Click “Save”

*Obtained Result:*
A pop-up message appears: “Please select the required field.” The announcement cannot be saved.

*Expected Result:*
The announcement should be successfully saved when all required fields are completed. No error message should be displayed.

column1: Rater Site Announcements
Rater Site Announcements - Rating Admin Site - Pop-up message appears when opening Rater Announcements Register menu
column28:
When logging into the Rating Admin Site, the system automatically opens the “Rater Announcements Register” menu and displays a pop-up message stating “No matching result(s) found.”
This happens even though no action has been performed

Steps to Reproduce:

-Log in to the Rating Admin Site.

-Observe that the system navigates automatically to Rater Announcements Register.

-A pop-up window appears with the message “No matching result(s) found.”

Obtained Result:
A pop-up message saying “No matching result(s) found.” appears every time the Rater Announcements Register opens without any user action.

Expected Result:
No pop-up message should appear when accessing _Rater Announcements Register_ unless the user performs a search or triggers an action that could result in no results.

Good day, I am contacting you to please upload changes to rater accounts in TMS (TMS/Utilities/Testers). Please see the attached Excel spreadsheet Consent_to_text_TMS_numbers_11.21.2025.

For those raters indicating ‘NO’ in spreadsheet Column B, please: Match to Rater Site ID to TMS Log In, within rater profile enter NO in Consent to text? Field, do not edit cell phone field

column1: CLONE - Rating Priority --> test priority glitch
column28: Hello Rohan, Once we assign a test to one rater in the test priority queue, we cannot assign tests to other raters as they will not receive the email notification of the assignment. Every time we assign a test/s to a different rater in this queue, first we have to get out of this queue, and come back to assign tests.  Please click on this link to [Recap: Test priority issue Friday, October 17 | Meeting | Microsoft Teams|https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetingrecap?driveId=b%21RZfjIM3aREGg66mUlMFwfyaoU3Az0bdMmFB_ca0UVxgCTNFHDz9CQ4iVOjBnb7QZ&driveItemId=01O5OJB7OLYACSV7UQY5FY4YXPB6RCNVQJ&sitePath=https%3A%2F%2Fltiinc-my.sharepoint.com%2F%3Av%3A%2Fg%2Fpersonal%2Fddorado_languagetesting_com%2FEcvABSr-kMdLjmLvD6Im1gkBDBhJRVHefFl9ztVhg5C8sw&fileUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fltiinc-my.sharepoint.com%2Fpersonal%2Fddorado_languagetesting_com%2FDocuments%2FDocuments%2FRecordings%2FTest%2520priority%2520issue-20251017_173420-Meeting%2520Recording.mp4%3Fweb%3D1&iCalUid=040000008200E00074C5B7101A82E00800000000767A7705AD3FDC01000000000000000010000000F259439D407CCF41B2652A3D9B36F09E&threadId=19%3Ameeting_OWU4MDM2YzMtYWYwMS00OGExLWFjZTMtYWQ2N2U5ZGE3NWFh%40thread.v2&organizerId=e89b5ff9-1a01-459c-970a-a12f5feb7c47&tenantId=cb652d01-33e7-430d-a063-a753ef2258f3&callId=fd640c1e-c87a-48e1-b14e-803c5527a4ec&threadType=Meeting&meetingType=Scheduled&subType=RecapSharingLink_RecapCore] to view the issue. *What is your name?:*
Diane Archer

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
OPS: Update to Candidate Registration Site to include non\-OPI/non\-AAPPL tests

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
OPS

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
Unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Meeting a customer requirement
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
URGENT \- Must be completed within the next 2\-3 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
1.	For non\-OPIs/non\-AAPPL tests to also be displayed at the Candidate Registration Site \- [https://tms.languagetesting.com/Registration/] based on the client configuration (proctored/non\-proctored/remotely proctored)
2.	A list of accounts that are currently intended to be set up with the Candidate Registration Site, but candidates for some accounts are being routed to order their tests at the LTI Client Site so that the configuration set up needs to be corrected.
a.	Including the creation/implementation of a uniform/standard process to set up these users for the Candidate Registration Site as they are currently being created/named in different variations for each account by the sales rep. See examples below.  [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/diane_archer_languagetesting_com/EaMvIgCR8LZMp-uQgM8XHYcBrNOU0zuytbaR-nmMHpgYgw?e=gNuzR7]

Confirmation that non\-OPIs/non\-AAPPL tests are displayed at the Candidate Registration Site \- [https://tms.languagetesting.com/Registration/] based on the client configuration (proctored/non\-proctored/remotely proctored)

2.	A list of accounts that are currently intended to be set up with the Candidate Registration Site, but candidates for some accounts are being routed to order their tests at the LTI Client Site so that the configuration set up needs to be corrected.

a.	Including the creation/implementation of a uniform/standard process to set up these users for the Candidate Registration Site as they are currently being created/named in different variations for each account by the sales rep. See examples below.



*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Without this implementation, candidates will be unable to order their non\-OPI tests at the Candidate Registration Site and will be ordering them at the LTI Client Site which is a data privacy risk (among other risks) to LTI and the Client.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
n/a

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Diane Archer

*What is your email address?:*
[darcher@languagetesting.com|mailto:darcher@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
OPS: OPI Appt ID to be added to Tester Availability Calendar in TMS

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
OPS

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
Unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
Near Future \- Required within the next 6\-12 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
I’m requesting a new column to be added to left of Candidate column on the OPI tester calendar in TMS (Utility > Tester Availability Calendar) and labeled Appt ID
o	This new column will display the Appt ID for each scheduled OPI on the Tester Availability Calendar in TMS
o	Each appt ID listed for each OPI record will be an active link so that when OPS click on the appt ID it takes us directly to the OPI record in Follow Up page in TMS.  [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/diane_archer_languagetesting_com/Edzu4e8T0_1OgHplFcdEmXABLGH_rwqHuGNCqk3EZupeDQ?e=vIWsEg]


*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
A demo or snippet of the change will suffice.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
OPS receive requests from testers to reassign/reschedule OPIs. At times, a tester may also need our help to change their testing phone number at short notice if they are unable to do so themselves. 
•	We start by going to view the tester’s calendar in Utility > Tester Availability Calendar in TMS.
•	Then, we go back to the homepage in TMS to pull the OPI record
o	First, enter the candidate first name and last name
o	Locate that specific OPI record in Fast Lookup (this may take a few secs if there are numerous test records with that candidate name)
o	Then, click on the active appt ID for that OPI record in Fast Lookup page
o	Finally, we get to the candidate’s test record in Follow Up page and can act (i.e., reassign OPI, unmatch OPI to get it rescheduled, or change the tester’s phone number).

Benefit of this improvement will save OPS time and steps/clicks in locating test record in TMS to take the necessary action needed.


*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
n/a

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

———————————————

column1: 25. As a Client ordering AAPPL/ALIRA at the lowest level in the hierarchy, I need to see this messaging in the pop-up (in task)
column28:

To ensure compliance with the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), an authorized signatory from your organization must agree to and sign LTI’s Data Privacy Agreement (DPA) to order AAPPL or ALIRA tests through our Client Site.

We must receive the signed form by [date+21days] to process any new test requests.

Please use the link below to review and authorize the DPA to proceed with your request.

[LTI Student Data Privacy Agreement]

column1: Tech: Automations/TMS Improvements to Facilitate Clever Integrations
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
Tech: Automations/TMS Improvements to Facilitate Clever Integrations

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
TECH

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
ASAP \- Required within the next 3\-6 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
As LTI IT, I want to use a TMS feature available to select users to manage business rules configurations for customers integrated through Clever so that these can be managed by non\-developer members of the team.

As LTI IT, I want to automate the incremental pull of data coming through the Clever integration into the system so that manual effort is not required to process incremental requests.

As LTI IT, I want to automate the flow of the account's Clever ID into the system so that it doesn't have to be located and entered manually during setup.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Additional automations are established to facilitate Clever onboarding.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Ongoing work for developers to establish new Clever integrations that could be taken on by non\-developer personnel.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: As a school administrator or teacher, when I select the AAPPL High Score Report, I want to see a “Sub Module” with the text in this card.
column28:
This is a high school report that generates the highest score from tests taken in grades 9-12 that each learner earned on individual AAPPL components in the same language.  

This data includes only tests taken during the current and previous three academic years. As noted, this is limited to tests taken in grades 9-12 only. Academic year is defined as Aug. 1 to July 31.  

Once scores are finalized, please allow 2 business days for the report to update. You can export the data to excel; a full new file will generate every time you run the report.  

Generating this report may take some time. Please consider using filters to minimize the time required to create your report.  

Please note: if an individual has different names/spellings listed from different test administrations, please email [+aapplhelp@languagetesting.com+|mailto:aapplhelp@languagetesting.com].

column1: CLONE - Error msg when attempt to view Bofa OPIc score for appt ID 9537568 at Client Site (SF case 00909220)
column28:
Good morning!

*Please assist with the inquiry below from Rebecca Bryant at Bofa. Also, can you change the candidate’s ID to ZKYTH2O for OPIc appt IDs 9516443 and 9537568? I’ve attached a few images for reference.*



Reaching out about the situation below (see email trail). Here is a summary of the situation, as far as I can tell:

* LTI’s system seems to think that test taker Denise Flores has previously passed the assessment, as the system is blocking the LOB from registering her again.
* However, the LTI data being sent to Bank of America indicates that she has not completed the assessment.
* When I search LTI’s system for her name, two records come up – one with a UR and one with a Q.
* However, when I click on the record with the Q to confirm that it is, in fact, the same Denise Flores, I get a “No Records Found” message.

Can you please investigate?



Thanks,

Diane

column261: APM/MC: Stop autofinalization and releasing MC OPIcs with a final rating of A or IH

column1: APM/MC: Stop autofinalization and releasing MC OPIcs with a final rating of A or IH
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim Sallee

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
APM/MC: Stop autofinalization and releasing MC OPIcs with a final rating of A or IH

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
CAPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
URGENT \- Must be completed within the next 2\-3 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
As LTI/MC, we need all MC/Credu OPIcs that the system would autofinalize with an IH or A rating to flow to the Rate Pending queue so that the tests can be reviewed for RM, which has become a significant problem impacting the credibility of the OPIc in Korea despite explicit communication with raters. 

As LTI, we need this change to (hopefully!) be temporary and one that can return to undone easily so that we can return to using the autofinalization feature for these tests in the future once this cheating scandal has resolved. .

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Tests that have been rated IH or A by R1 and that would have otherwise been sent for autofinalization and release will flow to the Rate Pending queue.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees
Multicampus Test Candidates
Testers/Raters

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
We are facing an OPIc crisis led by an individual who has a large social media platform and is using it to drive widespread cheating on the OPIc which raters are inconsistently catching despite a multi\-faceted approach with them. We're finding that many of the auto\-released tests are coming back to us for a review and require an urgent rating change. We will never get ahead of this and build trust with MC without stopping these autofinalized tests that go out without us being able to do QA on them. 

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
None, just dev team time. 

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: Korean WPT - Server error after clicking “Next” button
column28:
After completing Step 2 of the Self Assessment on the Korea WPT site, clicking the “Next” button triggers a server error instead of moving to the next step

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to the Korea WPT site.
# Complete Step 2 of the Self Assessment.
# Click the “Next” button.

*Expected Result:*
The system should successfully proceed to Step 3

*Actual Result:*
A server error message appears after clicking “Next,” preventing progress to the next step.

column1: AAPPL ASL - II Component - Sample prompt video fails to upload completely
column28:
The video never finishes uploading and it cannot be played, and the test cannot be started.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to the sample prompt screen
# Record the video
# Wait for the video to upload
# Try to play the video.

*Expected Result:*
The video should upload completely and be playable so that the test can be started.

column1: CLONE - Metadata for Machine Scoring Project
column28:
Hi Jongman,

We still need the metadata for the MC OPIc machine scoring project for all tests starting in the year 2020. I tried pulling these data myself but datamart does not contain some of these fields in any of its tables.

The fields needed for the metadata are:

* Test Year
* Test ID
* Prompt ID
* PromptLevel
* Category
* SubCategory
* Script
* Folder ID

Please let me know if you have any questions..

Thanks,

Young-A
column247:
18/Nov/25 6:16 PM;557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8;[~accountid:712020:7e5638e1-5a56-4271-8981-fa152c8d62f1]  I confirmed that the data you are looking for, are available in the datamart. Please use the following query.

select year(a.[Test Complete Date]), a.[Multicampus ID], b.[Prompt ID], [Prompt Level], [Prompt Topic], [Prompt Sub Topic], [Prompt Text], a.[Folder ID]   From [dbo].[Test] a, OPIc_Test_Responses b
where len(a.[Multicampus ID]) > 0 and  [Test Complete Date] > '01/01/2020' and a.[Multicampus ID] = b.[Multicampus ID] and Product='OPIc'
order by 2

column1: APM: SOBL bundle for 2025/26 school year content updates
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim

*What is your email address?:*
[[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]]|mailto:[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]]]

*Brief Project Title - Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
APM: SOBL bundle for 204/25school year content updates 

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
SOBL bundle is a US only product

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Content Update: Requesting that test content or B2C/B2B Client-Facing content/wording be updated

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a client using the SOBL bundle product, I need to be able to order the new content available for me to order by DATES TBD.

As ACTFL, I need to review and finalize UAT on the SOBL bundle WPT content before the end of November so that it can go live to customers by DATE TBD.

As LTI, we need the SOBL Bundle to be available for customers to order by no later than DATE TBD (and until DATE TBD). Customers may take the WPT at any time once the product goes live and may submit OPI schedule requests to coordinate tests to be administered anytime on or after DATE TBD. No tests (WPT or OPI) will be rated until on/after DATE TBD, no matter how early they are submitted. 

Message from ACTFL:

The SOBL WPT 2025 prompts for 24 languages can be found in dropbox:  
[[[https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&st=s3de5clw&dl=0|https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT%5C_Form%5C-B%5C_2025%5C_AdminYR%5C_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&st=s3de5clw&dl=0]|[https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT\_Form\-B\_2025\_AdminYR\_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&st=s3de5clw&dl=0|https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&st=s3de5clw&dl=0]|[https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT\_Form\-B\_2025\_AdminYR\_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;dl=0|https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;dl=0]|[https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT\_Form\-B\_2025\_AdminYR\_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;dl=0|https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;dl=0]|[https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;amp;dl=0|https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/8jvdctjl9szvpykqysoxo/WPT_Form-B_2025_AdminYR_FINAL.xlsx?rlkey=c7dvk3ct2hlkzm5luiupmx71b&amp;amp;st=s3de5clw&amp;amp;dl=0]]]]
 
Please note that our review process resulted in some updates to the prompts which were previously administered as Form B. To maintain the integrity of the earlier form, internally we are calling this *Form F*.   
*NOTE:* We are retiring Form B, which was previously administered for: 
2020 -- DoDEA  
2021 – DoDEA 
2021 SOBL Online 
2022 SOBL Paper-and-Pencil.  
 
Below are the names of the Individual Target Language Forms for the different delivery methods. Please confirm that these names correspond to LTI’s nomenclature of the individual language forms.  
 

_⚠ This table cannot be viewed on Mobile. Please view it on Web. ⚠_

 
We will not be sending any content for DoDEA Turkish testing.  
 
Would you please let us know when to expect the UAT to be ready?  If possible, it would be great to receive it sooner rather than later, while the content is still “fresh” in our mind.   

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Customers will be able to order the SOBL bundle for their students, able to administer the WPT at any point on/after DATE TBD.

ACTFL will be able to finalize UAT on the WPT content by no later than the end of November.  

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
ACTFL Employees
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates
Testers/Raters

*Please explain any specific risks of non-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non-completion, please type N/A.:*
no SOBL update SOBL bundle content 

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
IT engineering time 

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
All SOBL bundle collateral should be updated to reflect 2024-25 dates, etc. No new languages are included, no changes to the ordering flow, etc, from last year. 

———————————————

column1: CLONE - SOBL Test Request - Update dates
column28:
As a member of APM, I need the dates for the text updated for the “Test Request Template” section of the *Test Request > all other tests > SOBL* module to show the ordering window for the 2025-2026 season while retaining the existing format and links. Please update to the following:

Ordering opens on December {color:#ff5630}8, 2025{color} for the {color:#ff5630}2025-26{color} school year.

Tests may be ordered through May {color:#ff5630}29, 2026{color} at 11:59pm CDT, and may be administered through June {color:#ff5630}12, 2026.{color} No orders will be accepted after May {color:#ff5630}29, 2026{color}.

+The Oral Proficiency Interview (OPI)+ portion is a live conversation with an ACTFL-certified tester and needs to be scheduled at least *10 (and preferably 14) business days* in advance of your preferred testing date(s).

* OPIs may be scheduled from {color:#ff5630}January 5 {color}until June {color:#ff5630}12, 2026{color}.
* For tests ordered in December, scheduling confirmation emails will begin to be sent out in mid to late December.
* All OPIs must be ordered by May {color:#ff5630}29, 2026{color}.

+The Writing Proficiency Test (WPT)+ may be taken online via the Internet Modality or handwritten via the Booklet Modality. The WPT is available once you order your test (or after the start date/time selected in the case of Computer Proctoring).

* *Computer Proctoring is NOT available for the Booklet Modality.*
* Please note that, while you may administer the WPT starting as early as December 9, {color:#ff5630}2025{color}, ratings will not start to become available until mid-January {color:#ff5630}2026{color}.

For specific information about the {color:#ff5630}2025-26{color} testing season, please review this [FAQ document|https://ltiinc.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/APMExternal/EVbjN5q6MZNHuF10IzS0uxkB3ByMsNqSZWUYUd-xKV-L1w?e=Au4mIW]. Other documentation on this test can be found [here|https://ltiinc.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/APMExternal/EaZnysF5y3lCqCc3xjH-95MBjezmFkyHlfymdNPKj9ceHw?e=ybbOhs].

column1: CLONE - AAPPL Upload Error message update
column28:
When a customer changes the tab name from “Sheet1” and tries to upload the file, the system gives them an error message. See attached message.  I think the message can be clearer to indicate that the error is the tab name, not the file name.

Proposed New message: Please separate it into 3 lines.

Your request could not be processed.

The first tab name can not be changed from +*Sheet1*+.  [insert actual name of tab] is not a valid name. Make sure the tab names do not include invalid characters, punctuation, or that the name is not too long.

After fixing the error, if the problem exists, please contact LTI by emailing aapplhelp@languagetesting.com.

column1: DLI - Tests with "5" rating are not finalizing in Rating Admin Site
column28:
I tested two scenarios:

1 Appointment ID:4759361

When selecting 5 as rating in the form and the Admin put 5 as the final rating, the test should be finalized and flows to Finalized queue but the obtained behavior is that the test flowed to DLI Review queue.

2 Appointment ID: 4759363

When the rater selects 5 as rating in the form and it's assigned to a 3rd rater that rated with 5 rating as well, in Rating Admin the test should be autofinalized and the obtained behavior is that the test flows to TA Review queue.

column247:
23/Oct/25 4:37 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;Appointmentid : 4759361

This test has 2 un-approved grids(UR rated) in the table. That’s why it stays in the DLI review queue.

Appointmentid: 4759363

This is official test and based on the finalization logic, it moved to TA review queue which is correct.

column1: Clever - Error message displayed when navigating back after accesing to the TDS
column28:
When logging into the TDS portal through Clever and enters a valid PIN code, the system correctly loads the TDS page. If the user clicks the back button in the browser an error message appears on screen “We’re sorry, something went wrong while attempting to log you in to the testing portal. Please try again from your Clever app.”

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in through Clever.

Enter a valid PIN code to access the TDS.

Once the TDS page is loaded, click the Back button in the browser.

Obtained Result: 

The error message is displayed.

The expected behavior when clicking “Back” should be defined.

Redirecting the user to the Clever dashboard or previous page without showing an error or preventing the navigation if it’s not supported.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column228: This is the expected behavioras candidate navigates through SSO and for security reasons we do not allow back button to work. So message appears to candidate to access their respective Clever App and connect again.

column1: Tech: Improvements to AAPPL Ordering to Eliminate Wait Times During Processing and Provide an Error Log for Failed Records
column28: *What is your name?:* Annie Wendel *What is your email address?:* [awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com] *Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:* Tech: Improvements to AAPPL Ordering to Eliminate Wait Times During Processing and Provide an Error Log for Failed Records *Which department is this work being requested for?:* TECH *What is the budget classification for this request?:* OPEX *What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:* Improved customer/external user experience Improved internal LTI user experience Process improvement/automation *Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:* Yes *What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:* Near Future \- Required within the next 6\-12 weeks *Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:* TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS *What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:* Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users. *What kind of estimate does this project require?:* Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization *Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:* As a Client Site user, I want to remove the pre\-validation step from the AAPPL upload process so that files of all sizes are immediately ingested into the system without a long wait/loading time. As a Client Site user, I want to see a confirmation of the number of successful records / out of the total attempted orders so that I know that all of my tests have been generated successfully. As a Client Site user, I want to receive an error log in the form of an Excel file that contains a new Column A and the records that failed with specific error messaging so that I can correct issues and complete my order. As a Client Site user, I want the errors in Column A to be specific and actionable so that I know what to do to correct and complete my order. Scenarios include duplicates, unallowed testing combinations that the system validates against (like PW for ASL or non\-permitted retests, etc.) *Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:* Refer to stories. *Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:* LTI Clients *Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:* Ongoing issues with AAPPL upload times and error handling. *Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:* N/A *Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:* Yes *Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:* Info about error handling and changes to Test Request History screen. ——————————————— This task was submitted through *Tech/CAPEX Intake* [https://form.asana.com/?k=YovRIU6aUEaa3xe683CzCw&d=16125004755173|https://form.asana.com/?k=YovRIU6aUEaa3xe683CzCw&d=16125004755173] Created from Asana: https://app.asana.com/0/0/1211676286814161/f

column248:
09/Jan/26 2:45 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c] Here are the details I mentioned:

Ash,

 

This work is in QA and will soon be ready to go to Prod. [https://app.asana.com/1/16125004755173/project/1201964277215674/task/1211676286814161?focus=true|https://app.asana.com/1/16125004755173/project/1201964277215674/task/1211676286814161?focus=true|smart-link] 

 

There will need to be a few updates to your documentation, so please let me know when you’re ready with those so we can plan the deployment. Things to note:

# <75 learner requests will still process immediately.
# >75 will ingest the file immediately but then be queued for processing, which is functionality you are already familiar with.
# Some small updates have been made to screen copy.
# Users will now see a CSV error log for all failures with reasons. Things to know:
## When more than one reason applies to a record, they will appear in the same cell separated by a colon.
## This is the list of possible errors that will be displayed in Column A, in case you want to document them somehow.

# The State field is blank

# The District field is blank

# The School field is blank

# The Teacher field is blank

# The Student ID field is blank

# The First Name field is blank

# The Last Name field is blank

# Gender must be Male or Female or Non-binary or Prefer not to say

# The Arabic content that directly addresses the test taker is provided in gender-specific language. Please select either Male or Female taking the Arabic AAPPL

10) The Chinese (Mandarin) language style must be Traditional or Simplified

11) The Test Forms available are A or B or E

12) The Grade Level field has an invalid value

13) The Grade field has an invalid value

14) The Year of Study field has an invalid value

15) The Type of Instruction field has an invalid value

16) The Student relationship to Target Language field has an invalid value

17) AAPPL component ILS or PW or IR/IL not selected

18) The Test Form B is only available for AAPPL-SP: IMMERSIVE SPANISH

19) Grades 5-12 are only allowed for AAPPL-SP: IMMERSIVE SPANISH

20) AAPPL-SP: Immersive Spanish is only available for At School and Computer Proctoring

21) The Test Form E is not available for Home Schooling

22) Test Form “E” is available ONLY for languages Spanish, English, Chinese (Mandarin), or French for Speaking (ILS) component in Grades 3 and 4

23) Grades 9-12 are only allowed for Computer Proctoring

24) AAPPL ASL is only available for In-School Proctoring

25) Presentational Writing (PW) component is not available for ASL

26) Grades 9-12 are only allowed for ASL

27) AAPPL ASL is only available for Secondary / High School and College / University level learners

Duplications

# Student in this row has already taken the Full AAPPL this testing season and is not auto-eligible for retesting. Please contact [ratings@languagetesting.com|mailto:ratings@languagetesting.com] with a rationale for the retest in order to request a retest waiver. column1: DLI form - On page 2 an asterisk appears on screen and disappears after clicking "Generate Rationale"
column28:
An asterisk appears on the screen and disappears when clicking the Generate Rationale button.

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to page 2 of the form.
# Observe that an asterisk appears at the bottom of the screen.
# Click on Generate Rationale.
# Notice that the asterisk disappears.

Expected Result:
The asterisk should not appear on the screen at any time.

Obtained Result:
An asterisk is displayed initially and disappears after generating the rationale.

column1: BoA Report: Wording changes missing in Client Site.
column28:
The requested wording changes are missing in Client Site.

*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Log into Client Site with an account with permissions to the BoA Reports.
2) Navigate to “BOA Report”

*Actual result:*
The text in the screen is:
“Please click on download button and we'll export the data to Excel for you. Exported information includes the LOB, Job Title, Job Code, Assessment Type and Language Name.”

*Expected result:*
The text in the screen is:
”Click *Download* to export the data in Excel. The export will include the LOB, Job Title, Job Code, Assessment Type, and Language Name.”

column1: Create a batch process to only enable the Test Request History module for users that have the Test Request module enabled - AAPPL
column28: Check if for AAPPL accounts, when "Test request" menu is enabled for a user, only then add/remove "Test Request History". The reason is for AAPPL integration clients, users do not have "Test Request" but we have added "Test Request History" by default to all AAPPL accounts/users. This will also take care of cases if "Test request" menu has been added manually but missed to add "Test Request History"
column228:
The AAPPL batch process for setting up the Test Request and Test Request History modules has been completed and implemented as required.

The process takes into consideration the environment (UAT/PROD) as well as the DB. It automatically identifies the current environment and applies the appropriate module IDs to prevent confusion and reduce the number of constants across the application.

It also provides a detailed summary of all steps performed during the batch, including the list of client IDs being processed.

The batch process was designed with modularity in mind, allowing for easy future inclusion or removal of modules within the automation process, minimizing development time for any future requirements.

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Diane Archer

*What is your email address?:*
[darcher@languagetesting.com|mailto:darcher@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
OPS: Certificate correction request (cleared cache)

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
OPS

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
Unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
Near Future \- Required within the next 6\-12 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Academic Individual (B2C)/Magento Website

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
In the Reports> Certificate queue in TMS, under Action column, add a button which upon clicking can remove the cache stored in TMS for test certificate, so OPS members no longer have to raise a HD request for this whenever a candidate’s name is corrected in TMS in order for the certificate to display the changed made. [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/diane_archer_languagetesting_com/ESb9zxJVNEBNv0-mwj3KGEABnWJ-vvxU6DUiPEnPVVToDA?e=ZsDgYF]

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
In the Reports> Certificate queue in TMS, under Action column, add a button which upon clicking can remove the cache stored in TMS for test certificate, so OPS members no longer have to raise a HD request for this whenever a candidate’s name is corrected in TMS in order for the certificate to display the changed made.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
OPS will continue to have to submit a ticket to IT when a candidate's name is corrected in TMS so that IT can assist and clear the cache in order for the correction to be displayed on the certificate.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: 9. As LTI, I want to generate an e-mail template to contact clients that have 3 or more hierarchy levels in their account so that I can collect signatures from authorized users. Email content to come, but it must include the unique link.
column28:
Email content:

We would like to inform you of an important update regarding the LTI Client Site.  

To ensure compliance with the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), an authorized signatory for your organization must agree to and sign LTI’s Data Privacy Agreement (DPA). 

Beginning December 2, 2025, upon logging into the Client Site, all users will be prompted to review and sign the DPA *within 21 days* before proceeding with any orders. This agreement will only need to be +signed once by an authorized signer+ for your organization. Once signed, the agreement will be applied to all Client Site users for your School or District, and you (and all other users) will be given access automatically.  

You are receiving this email as an authorized user, and we ask that you please use the link below to complete the agreement ahead of December 2, 2025.  

[Click to Review & Sign the DPA] 

After 21 days, if there is no signature on file, users will retain client site functionality, including administration of previously ordered tests, but +new test orders+ will be blocked.  

If you have any questions or require assistance, please do not hesitate to contact our support team: 

800-486-8444 Option 1 {{ }}
(Outside the US: +1 914-963-7110 Option 1) {{ }}

If you are not authorized to sign on behalf of your organization, please copy the link above and send it to an authorized signatory (campus or district administrator) for an electronic signature.

column1: Clever - AAPPL Testing Window - Page refresh replicates previous actions and displays “Confirm Form Resubmission” message
column28:
When refreshing the page, a pop-up message appears “Confirm Form Resubmission”. After clicking Continue, previous actions are repeated automatically, generating the same PIN again or creating the same testing window multiple times.

Steps to Reproduce:

Create a testing window or generate a PIN

Click the browser’s Refresh button 

Observe the pop-up message “Confirm Form Resubmission.”

Click Continue button

Obtained Result:
The system repeats previous actions 

Expected Result:

No actions should be repeated after refreshing the page.

The “Confirm Form Resubmission” pop-up message should not appear when refreshing.

column1: Clever - AAPPL Testing Window - System allows generating new PINs for expired testing windows
column28:
The system allows generating a new PIN code for a testing window that has already passed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Go to AAPPL Testing Window Menu 
# Locate a testing window with a past date 
# Attempt to generate a new PIN for that window

*Obtained Result:*
The system generates a new PIN code for testing windows that have already expired.

*Expected Result:*
The system should only allow generating new PINs for upcoming or active testing windows, not for those created in the past.

column1: Clever - AAPPL Testing Window - Inconsistent number of digits in generated PIN codes
column28:
When generating a new PIN, the system sometimes creates a 6-digit PIN and other times a 4-digit PIN

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Create a new test window
# Click on generate PIN button
# Observe the number of digits in the generated PIN
# Repeat the process several times

*Obtained Result:*
The generated PIN can have different number of digits as 4 or 6

*Expected Result:*
The number of digits should be consistent, all generated PINs should have the same length.
