column1: APM: DPA Pop-Up on Client Site
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Ash Britton

*What is your email address?:*
[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
APM: DPA Pop\-Up on Client Site

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
Unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
URGENT \- Must be completed within the next 2\-3 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
1.	As an AAPPL/ALIRA client accessing TMS, I need to see a pop\-up prompting me to complete the DPA (via formstack) when logging in if there is not one on file so that I can give consent to share learner data. 
2.	As a client accessing TMS, I need to be able to dismiss this DPA requirement so that I can access the site without intervention from an authorized signer. 
3.	As a client accessing TMS, for the first 21 days I want to maintain access to all Client Site features but see a pop\-up on login with information about the required signature and deadline so that I know how long it will be until I am blocked from ordering AAPPL/ALIRA. Pop up text to come.
4.	As a client accessing TMS, I need the DPA pop\-up to have a button to copy the link so that I can easily send it to an authorized signer if I am not one. 
5.	As a client accessing TMS, on the 22nd day after seeing the pop\-up for the first time, I want to see a new message on attempting to access the “Test Requests” feature telling me that I can no longer order new tests until the DPA is signed so that I act on securing a signature.
6.	As a Client Site user, on the 22nd day after seeing the pop\-up for the first time, I want to retain access to the client site even if my DPA is not signed so that I can access scores, reports, logins, etc. even though I cannot order new tests.
7.	As LTI, I want to enable a pop\-up on AAPPL/ALIRA configured accounts with 1\-2 levels in the hierarchy prompting clients to sign a DPA so that I can ensure compliance with PRIVO. 
8.	As LTI, I want the system to generate a dynamic link that interfaces with TMS and shows the user ID of the client site user and the TMS ID of the account so that when a client signs their DPA it flows to their account. 
9.	As LTI, I want to generate an e\-mail template to contact clients that have 3 or more hierarchy levels in their account so that I can collect signatures from authorized users. Email content to come, but it must include the unique link.
10.	As LTI, I want the signature authorization on the DPA to flow up one account level so that I do not collect signatures from unauthorized users. 
11.	As LTI, I want the signature authorization on the DPA to flow down in the hierarchy so that I do not collect unnecessary signatures once the DPA is acknowledged by an authorized user. 
12.	As LTI, I want the DPA links to expire after 21 days and generate a new one so that I do not collect signatures from unauthorized users. 
13.	As LTI, I want the system to block AAPPL/ALIRA ordering after 21 days if the DPA is not signed so that I can ensure that we meet PRIVO requirements for data collection. Error handling to come.
14.	As LTI, I want to ensure that other error handling is in place so that users understand what is required of them. Additional messaging to come.
15.	As LTI, I want users that connect to the Client Site through SSO to accept the Client Site TOU agreement like non\-SSO users so that we collect their consent to the terms as required.
16.	As LTI, I want the DPA pop up to display for users whether they connect via SSO or not so that we can collect the required signatures for all accounts.


*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Clients accessing TMS can use the unique link to sign the DPA, or forward it to an authorized signer, and receive a confirmation email once it's complete.
Clients accessing TMS are prohibited from ordering AAPPL/ALIRA if the DPA is not signed within 21 days.



*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Compliance with PRIVO

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
none

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: CLONE - Users getting error message at Client Site when attempting to access Test Request module
column28:
Good afternoon!

The OPS team is getting an abnormal amount of calls today from the clients below getting an error message when attempting to submit a non-AAPPL test at their client site (Test Request page). The message the client is getting is *_Your request can not be processed, please contact LTI._* 

Some are getting this message after clicking on *Test Request* module, while others when they are attempting to click ‘+submit+’ button on the Test Request page.

The OPS team is advising client to clear cache/cookies and refresh browser, which appears to help the client. Please take a look further. I’ve also attached a message received from admin at *Canadian Foreign Service Institute* encountering similar issues.



* Arkansas Administrative Office of the Courts (client ID 2035)
* International Center for Language Studies, Inc. (client ID 2529)
* Children's Hospital of Wisconsin-HR (client ID 9926)
* Marion County Public Schools HR (client ID 20495)
* City of Freeport (client ID 15655)
* Mount Vernon School District HR (client ID 23924)
* Claro Interpreting Services, Inc. (client ID 490)
* International Center for Language Studies, Inc (client ID 2529)
* Children's Hospital of Wisconsin-HR (client ID 9926)
* Canadian Foreign Service Institute (client ID 552)

 

Thanks,

Diane

[~accountid:5d518e6b92705e0c1c5e5700]
column228:

Error logging feature added to “Select Product”, “Select Test”, “Test Request” pages on clientsite through which it navigates. Below screen snap is a sample of log generated in case of any exception error.

column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Login to the Client Site with an account that is configured to not be exempted in TMS
2) Once the agreement is prompted, check the box “I confirm my consent, agreement, and acknowledgement to the points described above.”
3) Click on “Confirm”
4) Logout
5) Login again with the same account

*Actual result:*
The agreement is prompted in every login

*Expected result:*
Once signed, the agreement no longer appears

As an MTA user, I want the system to do a date format validation when processing my order upload so that downstream issues don't occur when LTI test results are later uploaded into our system

Yes this change can be added in the logic, where we can look for a date\-format data in the field of Effective Date for MTA uploads, if they accidentally enter data in the field which is not in date format, then it would reject the upload.

The effort would be roughly 3\-5 SP, including testing. Since this is a change required at code level. We would need an Asana request.

Test order upload is rejected when there is a date format issue in the order upload (3//05/2025, for example, instead of 03/05/2025).

column1: ALIRA - Font sizes and styles are inconsistent across the site
column28:
The font size and style used for the task questions are inconsistent across the site. In some tasks, the question text appears smaller than the standard size and also the content has different font style compared to other tasks.

Steps: 

* Navigate to different tasks/questions.
* Compare the font size and style of the question text across multiple tasks.
* Observe that in certain tasks, the question text looks smaller and the content has a different font compared to the standard.

Obtained Result

The font size and style of question text vary depending on the task.

Some tasks display smaller font size and different font family.

Expected Result:

Font size and style must be consistent across the entire site.

All tasks should use the same standard font family and font size for question text.

column1: DLI - Test rated UR/NR are finalized without Formstack approval
column28:
When assigning UR/NR as rating in the form, the test flows correctly into the UR Follow Up queue. However, once the Admin finalizes the test with UR or NR in that queue, the system automatically finalizes the test without requiring Formstack approval and without passing through the DLI Review queue.

Steps to Reproduce:

Open the form and assign UR or NR as the rating.

Confirm the test flows into the UR Follow Up queue.

From the UR Follow Up queue, as an Admin, finalize the test with UR or NR.

Actual Result:

The test is automatically finalized.

No approval is required from Formstack.

The test does not flow into the DLI Review queue.

Expected Result:

A test rated as UR/NR should not be finalized automatically.

It must require approval in Formstack.

It should pass through the DLI Review queue before being finalized.

column1: DLI - "Continue to Rationale" question appears for UR/NR ratings
column28:
When a test is rated UR or NR the "Continue to Rationale" question should not be displayed. Instead, a problem report should be automatically selected by default, and the rater should be taken directly to page 2 to type in their rationale.

Steps to Reproduce:

Select UR or NR as the rating.

Observe that the "Continue to Rationale" question is still displayed.

Expected Result:

The "Continue to Rationale" question should not appear when UR/NR is selected.

A problem report should be automatically set by default.

The system should advance the rater to page 2 to provide the rationale.

Actual Result:

The "Continue to Rationale" question still appears, even when UR/NR is selected
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column247: 22/Sep/25 1:55 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;[~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c]  This is a new request that raters can move to the 2nd page if they want to continue to rationale. Could you confirm [~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc]?
column248: 22/Sep/25 5:26 AM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb] it’s a clarification of the UR/NR requirements from ACTFL. I tagged you in a comment about it last week but think that maybe you didn’t see it. The desired behavior is that for a UR/NR rating the question about going to page 2 to generate the rationale is not displayed and that the rater is sent to page 2 by default to type something in. Makes sense? FYI [~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c]
column249: 22/Sep/25 8:16 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc] Oh, so for UR/NR, the question doesn’t need to be displayed and a rater always needs to move to the 2nd page by default. I will work on it. Thank you for the clarification.

column1: DLI - Incorrect error message displayed when ACTFL alert is deselected after choosing "No" for warm up/wind down
column28:
When the user selects "No" for the questions "Was a warm up conducted?" and "Was a wind down conducted?", the alert to ACTFL checkbox is automatically selected as expected. However, if the user manually deselects the ACTFL alert and tries to proceed to page 2, the form displays the following error message:

"Please check the appropriate box to alert either LTI or ACTFL since you recommended retest" retest 

Even if the retest option was never selected

Steps to Reproduce:

For the questions "Was a warm up conducted?" and/or "Was a wind down conducted?", select "No"

Observe that the ACTFL alert is automatically selected.

Manually deselect the ACTFL alert checkbox.

Attempt to proceed to page 2.

Actual Result:
The form blocks navigation and shows the error message:
"Please check the appropriate box to alert either LTI or ACTFL since you recommended retest", even though retest was never selected.

Expected Result:
The form should display an appropriate error message for this case, clarifying that deselecting the ACTFL alert is not allowed when "No" is chosen for warm up/wind down, instead of referencing the retest option.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.

column1: DLI - Wind Conducted Question - ACTFL alert checkbox is deselected after completing ILR level justification section
column28:
When selecting "No" for the question "Was a wind down conducted?", the alert to ACTFL is correctly triggered. However, after completing the section related to the example of why the examinee does not meet the next higher ILR level, the ACTFL alert checkbox is deselected.

Steps to Reproduce:

Navigate to the question "Was a wind down conducted?"

Select "No"

Observe that the alert to ACTFL is selected

Fill in the section explaining why the examinee does not meet the next higher ILR level

Actual Result:
The ACTFL alert checkbox is deselected after completing the ILR justification section

Expected Result:
Once the ACTFL alert is triggered, subsequent changes in the form should not affect that selection

column1: DLI - Warm Conducted Question - ACTFL alert checkbox is deselected after filling "response level" field
column28:
In the question "Was a warm up conducted?" when the user clicks the checkbox "No", the alert to ACTFL is automatically activated as expected. Once the user fills in the field "response level" for the first task the ACTFL alert becomes deselected.

Steps to Reproduce:

Navigate to the question "Was a warm up conducted?"

Select the checkbox "No"

Observe that the ACTFL alert is activated.

Fill in the field "response level"

Actual Result:
The ACTFL alert checkbox is deselected after filling in the "response level" field

Expected Result:
Once the ACTFL alert is activated (by selecting "No"), no other selection or input in the form should deselect it.

column1: DLI - Warm Conducted Question - Alert checkbox for ACTFL remains selected after switching answer from "No" to "Yes"
column28:
In the question "Was a warm up conducted?" by selecting the checkbox "No", the alert to ACTFL is automatically activated as expected. But when the user later changes the selection to "Yes", the alert to ACTFL remains selected instead of being deselected.

Steps to Reproduce:

Navigate to the form question "Was a warm up conducted?"

Click the checkbox "No"

Observe that the alert to ACTFL is activated

Change the selection by clicking the checkbox "Yes"

Actual Result:
The alert to ACTFL checkbox remains selected even after choosing "Yes"

Expected Result:
If the user selects "No", the alert to ACTFL should be activated
If the user then changes the selection to "Yes", the alert to ACTFL should automatically be deselected

column1: Font color and spacing issue on the Honor Code and Test Completion Screen
[AAPPL Accommodations] Trying to upload an excel file with less columns than the required does not prompt the user to a friendly error message
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Prepare an excel file where there is at least one column less than the expected.
2) Go to TMS / Utility / AAPPL Accommodations / AAPPL Accommodations batch process/view / Upload 
3) Select a client
4) Select the file
5) Click on “upload”

*Actual result:*
The user is redirected to an error page without any useful information. 

*Expected result:*
The user is notified that the excel file does not meet the requirements to be uploaded.

column1: Handle remote proctored test scenario (excludes prometric): If selected datetime is in past, then add 15 days to current date
column228:
For cases where the selected date is already in the past and the proctor type is remote, the system adds +15 days to the original date.

!image-20250930-215559.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215559.png"!

!image-20250930-215605.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215605.png"!

!image-20250930-215610.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215610.png"!

!image-20250930-215615.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215615.png"!

Every test order within an order is processed individually, and changes are applied to each test order separately. If even a single test order fails, the entire Magento order will not be updated. Only the missing or failed test orders will be reprocessed during the next automatic run, and once the entire order has been updated, Magento’s order ID will be updated as well.

column261: As LTI Support, I want an automated daily process to pull failed transaction data from Magento and create the test record in TMS so that I don't have to manually do so.

column1: Handle remote proctored test scenario (excludes prometric): if push to remote proctor fails then add 15 days to current date and invoke create again
column228:
If the order fails and comes in as a pending failed transaction from Magento, the system checks if the site is remote. If so, it updates the candidate’s selected date using UTC server time and adds +15 days from when the order is processed by the API.

!image-20250930-215423.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215423.png"!

!image-20250930-215444.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215444.png"!

!image-20250930-215449.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215449.png"!

!image-20250930-215453.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215453.png"!

!image-20250930-215501.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215501.png"!

Every test order within an order is processed individually, and changes are applied to each test order separately. If even a single test order fails, the entire Magento order will not be updated. Only the missing or failed test orders will be reprocessed during the next automatic run, and once the entire order has been updated, Magento’s order ID will be updated as well.

column1: Handle case whereby previous order information is in TMS but payment status is not updated
column228:
For cases where the order is already in TMS but payment status isn’t updated, the system recognizes the order as pending  and updates the payment information using the data from Magento  without creating a new order. The status of the order in Magento is then updated.

column1: Handle cases whereby previous through actual workflow transaction/order is created but link to Magento failed whereby it still remains pending on Magento and then gets pulled again from Failed API
column228:
When the transaction succeeds in our system but fails to update Magento, the logic verifies the order in our DB and updates Magento directly if payment info is present.

This avoids creating a new transaction.

column1: DLI - Inconsistent validation on rationale checkbox between numerical ratings and UR/NR ratings
column28:
When selecting a numerical rating and adding an alert to ACTFL or LTI, if the rationale checkbox is not marked, the form doesn’t allow to move forward to page 2 by clicking the “Next” button.

When selecting UR or NR as rating and leaving the rationale question unchecked after adding an alert to ACTFL or LTI, by clicking “Next” button the form allows to proceed to page 2.

Steps to reproduce:

-Select a numerical rating and add an alert to ACTFL or LTI.

-Do not select any rationale checkbox.

-Click the Next button.

-Observe that the form does not allow moving forward.

-Now, select UR or NR as the rating instead.

-Do not select any rationale checkbox.

-Click the Next button.

Expected Result:
The form should enforce the rationale checkbox selection consistently for both numerical ratings and UR/NR ratings before allowing progression to Page 2.

Obtained Result:

With numerical ratings + alert, the form blocks progression without a rationale checkbox.

With UR/NR ratings, the form allows progression even without a rationale checkbox.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.

column1: DLI - When UR/NR rating is selected, the form allows to submit it without completing the rationale
column28:

-Make an alert to ACTFL or LTI

A form with UR/NR rating can be submitted without rationale.

column247: 16/Sep/25 10:18 AM;557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8;We decided not to support Firefox.
column250:
23/Sep/25 2:20 PM;557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8;As it became priority, it has been resolved.

ASL uses Video.js and sets the disablePictureInPicture attribute to true to disable it. However, this doesn't work correctly in Firefox or Edge.

The solution is to set the attribute to true before Video.js is initialized and then set it again once Video.js is ready

column1: DLI - Rating Admin Site - When a form is denied in Formstack, the test appears in the DLI review queue as denied by two previous raters
column28:
When rater1 rates a test and sends an alert to ACTFL, and then denies the form in Formstack, the test appears as Not Approved for both raters (rater1 and the previous one, jrater) in the DLI  queue.

Steps:

# Log in as *rater1*.
# Rate a test that already has a previous rater associated.
# Select an alert for ACTFL or LTI.
# In Formstack, choose Deny for the form submission.
# Go to the DLI review queue and check the status for both raters.

Obtained behavior: 

* The test shows up as Not Approved on the queue for both raters (rater1 and  jrater)

Is needed to confirm if this behavior is correct.

column1: ASL AAPPL Demo build
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Jennifer Quinlan

*What is your email address?:*
[jquinlan@languagetesting.com|mailto:jquinlan@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
ASL AAPPL Demo build

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
Near Future \- Required within the next 6\-12 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.
Content Update: Requesting that test content or B2C/B2B Client\-Facing content/wording be updated

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
As a K\-12 learner preparing to have their ASL ability assessed, I want to be able to access a demo for the RC component, Forms A and B, and for the II component, Forms A and B. I do not want a score report or my responses to be stored. As with other AAPPL Demos, I do not need a specific login to take ASL demo.

As someone interested in learning what to expect on the ASL AAPPL, I want to access a demo for Form A and B of the ASL AAPPL, all components, on the standard AAPPL demo page. 

As someone interested in learning what to expect on the ASL AAPPL, when I access the AAPPL demo page ([https://www.languagetesting.com/aappl2-demo]), I want to see accurate/relevant system requirements and a link for the ASL AAPPL system check. 

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Learners being assessed for ASL ability can take a demo test for II and RC components, in both Form A and Form B.  As with other AAPPL demos, they do not need a login to access the demo, do not receive a score report, and no responses are stored. 

Someone interested in learning what to expect on the ASL AAPPL can access information about the system requirements for ASL AAPPL, a link to the ASL system check page, and test demos of the ASL RC and II components (Form A and B) on the standard AAPPL Demo Page ([https://www.languagetesting.com/aappl2-demo]).

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Non compliance will result in violating the terms of the ACTFL/LTI contract, which stipulates LTI is responsible for creating test demos.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
This request requires pulling content from Learnosity which ACTFL has prepared for demo tests.

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
The AAPPL Demo page will need to be updated. See screenshots here: [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/jquinlan_languagetesting_com/ER6aj76MXHNHieN2btHdt1MBBUE7H32V3X-WcCM173zcvA?e=QQzld2]

———————————————

[https://form.asana.com/?k=YovRIU6aUEaa3xe683CzCw&d=16125004755173|https://form.asana.com/?k=YovRIU6aUEaa3xe683CzCw&d=16125004755173]

Created from Asana: https://app.asana.com/0/0/1211297356552411/f

The priority on this is high. Thank you so much!

column1: DLI - Retest checkbox does not enforce completion of the Problem Report section
column28:
When selecting _“_Is a retest recommended?_”_ as “Yes” the system must require the _Problem Report section_ to be completed before going to next page. Currently, this validation does not occur.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Locate the _“Is a retest recommended?”_ field.
# Select “Yes”
# Leave the _Problem Report section_ empty.
# Click on Next Button

*Obtained Result:*
The form can be saved/submitted without completing the Problem Report section.

*Expected Result:*
If “Is a retest recommended?” is set to “Yes” the system must enforce completion of the Problem Report section before the form can be submitted.

column261: APM: BofA retest logic for all testing back to 2013

column1: APM: BofA retest logic for all testing back to 2013
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim Sallee

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
APM: BofA retest logic for all testing back to 2013

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
ASAP \- Required within the next 3\-6 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
As a BofA manager, I need the LTI system to identify and block candidates for whom a test is being ordered if the candidate has taken the same test under any BofA account since 2013 and has received a rating that qualifies them for the role the test is being ordered for. 

As a BofA recruiter, I need the LTI system to identify and block candidates for whom a test is being ordered if the candidate has taken the same test under any BofA account since 2013 and has received a rating that qualifies them for the role the test is being ordered for. 

As a BofA admin, I need all retest checks to be looking at a match of the same data fields, namely employee ID (not email, as is used in some cases), first name, last name, and language so that all records are searched consistently. 

As a BofA user, when the system blocks an order because the candidate already has tested and earned a qualifying rating for the role a test is being ordered for, the system should display a unique message to clarify why the test order is being blocked. (Exact verbiage to come, but likely something like "This employee has already met the NEL requirement for this role in this language and does not need to retest.")

Note: With this addition, the system will now have three unique reasons to block a retest: 1) an NQ rating <6 months ago, 2) prior rating that qualifies them for the role the assessment is being ordered for now and 3) a duplicate test order exists for this user. We need unique error messages to be displayed to the user for each of these situations. The first situation's message is already in the system satisfactorily with this: The employee has not met the 6 month re\-assessment period. He/She is due for a re\-assessment after MM/DD/YYYY. The 2nd scenario's message should read something like this: "This employee has already met the NEL requirement for this role in this language and does not need to retest." I'm not sure what language is displayed to the user for the 3rd situation. Please provide and I'll confirm if it's okay as is or if it needs to be changed. 



*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
User attempting to order a test for a candidate through the Manager Portal, when the candidate (with the same first name, last name, language, and employee ID) has a test record on file that qualifies them for the role being tested for will be messaged that the order is blocked and will see the appropriate message related to this circumstance. 

User attempting to order a test for a candidate through the Recruiting Portal, when the candidate ( with the same first name, last name, language, and employee ID) has a test record on file that qualifies them for the role being tested for will be messaged that the order is blocked and will see the appropriate message related to this circumstance. 

User attempting to order a test for a candidate through the Manager Portal, when the candidate has an already\-open (untaken) test on file will be messaged that the order is blocked and will see the appropriate message related to this circumstance. 

User attempting to order a test for a candidate through the Recruiting Portal, when the candidate has an already\-open (untaken) test on file will be messaged that the order is blocked and will see the appropriate message related to this circumstance. 



*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
frustration by the Bank

column1: APM: In Rater Admin, Filter raters by language
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Patrick Green

*What is your email address?:*
[pgreen@languagetesting.com|mailto:pgreen@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
APM: In Rater Admin, Filter raters by language

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
When Prioritization Permits \- Request can be prioritized against other projects during the monthly meeting.

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
In Rating Admin for OPIc, when clicking on Rating Priority → Test Priority and selecting a language filter (let's say Spanish), clicking Search and then when attempting to manually assign an Off Loop QA to Rater,
could the list of raters displayed in that drop down be limited to just the Spanish raters (in this example). In other words, could that Off Loop QA to Rater drop down be dynamic if/when the language was
selected to a single language? Currently, the dropdown menu includes all OPIc raters.

So, as a Rater Admin, I would like to see appear only the raters that correspond to the selected language in the "Assign Off loop QA to Rater" drop down window to facilitate assigning tests to the appropriate rater based on their language of certification.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
When selecting a language under OPI  Rating Priority → Test Priority in Rater Admin, only those OPIc raters certified in the searched language will appear in the "Assign Off loop QA to Rater" drop down window.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Inadvertently assigning an OPIc test to the wrong rater, which can cause a test to be derived late to client.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
NA

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column261: INTK-709: Request to correct the error in Rating Start Date and Rating End Date

column1: Allow for Column C in uploaded Excel to be Student ID; system should validate that either ID or Username is present, both should not be required.
column228:
The feature for adding Student ID in Column C has been completed. The following updates were made:

* Interface and Server-Side Updates
** Updated the interface, server-side code, stored procedures, and tables to accommodate Student ID.
** Implemented validation and error messages to ensure that either Student ID or AAPPL Username must be present.
** If both are blank, the interface triggers a pop-up message identifying the row with the issue before the data reaches the database.
** !image-20250828-152823.png|width=1100,height=548,alt="image-20250828-152823.png"!

* UI Enhancements
** Student ID has been added to the Excel upload preview.
** Student ID also appears in the AAPPL Batch Processing Details pop-up window, with adjustments made to ensure data fits neatly into the tables.
** !image-20250828-152930.png|width=998,height=606,alt="image-20250828-152930.png"!
!image-20250828-152959.png|width=1008,height=538,alt="image-20250828-152959.png"!

* Database Scheduler
** Updated the scheduler logic to support searching and accommodating students by either Student ID or AAPPL Username, with priority given to the username.
* Cases Tested
** Invalid Student ID, blank AAPPL Username => Invalid 
** Blank Student ID, valid AAPPL Username => Valid
** Valid Student ID, blank AAPPL Username => Valid
** Invalid Student ID, valid AAPPL Username => Valid
** Invalid Student ID, invalid AAPPL Username => Invalid
* Note
** The expectation is that if both AAPPL Username and Student ID are present, the record will be considered invalid if the AAPPL Username is invalid, even when the Student ID is valid. This is enforced for security purposes.

column1: Set up daily email notification containing summary of bulk accommodations requests ingested during that day
column28:
Email should be sent at 5pm daily

Should go into the workflow emails tool

Should be sent to accommodations@languagetesting.com
column228:
We have implemented automated email notifications that trigger once a batch process has been completed for the given day (the execution time can be updated based on business requirements). These notifications ensure that all errors are tracked throughout the process and reported back to the user at completion.

 This email is fully customizable in the Mass Email Templates menu in TMS.

column1: APM: Evaluate adding LPT/RPT test ordering to the BofA Manager Portal
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim Sallee

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department. If this project already has a CAPEX budget code, please add it to the title and use the name of the project as listed in the budget.:*
APM: Evaluate adding LPT/RPT test ordering to the BofA Manager Portal

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*What is the budget classification for this request?:*
OPEX

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
When Prioritization Permits \- Request can be prioritized against other projects during the monthly meeting.

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project as stories, following the format described below.:*
When the Bank requested adding LPTs/RPTs to some roles' NEL testing last year, we were drowning in the BofA WPT roll out (among other things) and we expected the ordering of LPTs/RPTs to be a very rare thing. So, we proposed a manual approach to ordering that has been managed by Kim (and is being transferred to Diane/Support moving forward) by which the Bank completes an Excel template and emails it via secure email to LTI. We then submit the order request to IT via HD ticket and once ordered, manually update the login details in an email template and email that out to the employee and their manager. Since the initial request, we have received a request from the Bank approximately every 2 months.

Since the current flow is very manual (and introduces a delay between the manager requesting the test and the candidate getting the login instructions) and has the potential for error, and because it's happening more often than initially thought it would be, we'd like to explore the possibility of automating the ordering flow. 

Requirements:
Available on the Manager Portal only for roles with a minimum proficiency level set for LPT/RPT. 
This document contains all emails anticipated to be needed. (Note: the exact copy of each email is still pending approval from the Bank, but minimal text edits are expected.): [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/ksallee_languagetesting_com/ER-3TC_S-btKlRKwDbIgmuwBo9Dpy_RgSwhsCbUzJ6g9wQ?e=OsdpJ5]

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Managers will be able to order RPT/LPT test results for BofA candidates in roles that require listening & reading skills.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
a manual process for APM/Support and IT and possible room for delays and errors to be made.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
IT availability

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

———————————————

column1: Pull the new AAPPL content listed in the UAT sheet into the TDS.
column28:
[~accountid:557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8] Your gmail already has access to this sheet: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_TgkjZ-tMShffy3dP4g64pEpu9WU0z1Q/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=105951072719820485714&rtpof=true&sd=true|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_TgkjZ-tMShffy3dP4g64pEpu9WU0z1Q/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=105951072719820485714&rtpof=true&sd=true|smart-link] 



Dear LTI Team,

 

We are excited to announce that the AAPPL content for 2025-26 administration is now ready to be pulled from our ACTFL authoring platform (451).

 

We had intended to mirror/copy the content over to the ACTFL-LTI shared platform (525), but were experiencing some technical issues with our programming script to copy the content. We just granted Jongman permissions to our platform.

 

The UAT Sheet is in our Google drive here: [+AAPPL 2025-26 UAT Form+|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_TgkjZ-tMShffy3dP4g64pEpu9WU0z1Q/edit?usp=drive_link&ouid=106819264784261355156&rtpof=true&sd=true].  

NOTE: There are special instructions for RU ILS 001 Form. 

Please note that the delivery includes the following test forms and languages for the 2025-26 administration:   

|*AAPPL 001 Form*  |*AAPPL 005 Form*  |
|Arabic  |Chinese   |
|German  |English  |
|Italian  |French  |
|Japanese  |Spanish  |
|Korean  |  |
|Portuguese  |  |
|Russian  |  |

 

We'll be happy to address any questions you may have on Monday.  

Have a nice weekend.  

Best, 

Reuben & Camelot

column1: INTK-728: APM: Bring the L&Rcat into WCAG compliance
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
APM: Bring the L&Rcat into WCAG compliance

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*Will this request require CFO, CEO, and/or Multicampus approval based on the definitions below?:*
Yes

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
Bringing our test suite into compliance with WCAG requirements

*Which type of request is this?:*
CAPEX Project Requiring Internal Labor

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This product is available on both the US and MC platforms

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
By an External Due Date \- Select this if there is a fixed due date set by an external client.

*What is the due date required by an external party?:*
Dec 31, 2025

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a test provider, I need the L&Rcat to be brought into alignment with the requirements for WCAG compliance so that all our test products are WCAG compliant for all our clients and customers. 

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
A VPAT produced for the test demonstrates WCAG compliance on all required accessibility features. 

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates
Multicampus Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
non\-compliance with WCAG requirements

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
none

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
updates to our marketing and user guides to highlight this test's WCAG compliance

column1: DLI Slab codes update (and request for a new AP Slab Code, too) - for 9/1 go-live
column28:
We need to update the slab codes, {color:#bf2600}*effective 9/1/2025*{color}, for the following DLI tests. Mark asked that I refer you to THD-10385 as a reminder relating to a recent issue you had with the Dual Modality slab codes when we did the last update.

(More details below the table.) 

|*Tier*|*Existing Price*|*New Price effective 9/1/2025*|
|Tier 1 OPI|$190.17|$199.17 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_199.17              |
|Tier 2 OPI|$192.34|$201.34 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_201.34|
|Tier 3 OPI|$195.60|$204.60 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_204.60|
|Tier 1 Dual Modality (OPI + Participatory Listening)|$196.69|$205.69 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_205.69|
|Tier 2 Dual Modality (OPI + Participatory Listening)|$198.86|$207.86 -OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_207.86|
|Tier 3 Dual Modality (OPI + Participatory Listening)|$202.12|$209.12 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_209.12|
|Alternate OPI|$195.60|$204.60 - OPI_US_GOVT_OFF_209.12|

Also, Denise has confirmed that we need a new AP slab code, since the DLI OPI rater fees will be unique and separate from the other ILR OPI rater fees charged for other government OPIs. She needs a DLI-specific slab code for $30. This will enable her to pay the ILR raters their higher rate for DLI OPI rating activity and keep their rates at the lower amount when rating ILR OPIs for any other client and in a way that aligns to how the tests will be reflected in the new Rater Activity Reports/invoices coming from the Rater Site (screenshot attached). She will need this code in early September to ensure that Finance has time to make all the updates they need when processing the Sept 1st invoices (for payment on Oct 1st).

column1: Deidentify TMS UAT data
column228:
The de-identification of UAT TMS data has been completed across the following tables:

# tblAAPPL_Longitudinal
# tblAppointment
# tblClientOrder
# tblClientRequests
# tblClients
# tblClientUser

The current script verifies the email from the related table (when available). Any records containing the languagetesting domain were excluded from modification.

!image-20251010-213155.png|width=689,alt="image-20251010-213155.png"!

!image-20251010-213220.png|width=689,alt="image-20251010-213220.png"!

To maintain data integrity, we’re using unique identifiers such as parent usernames, appointment IDs, and other identity columns to distinguish records while making sure no personal/identifiable information  remains. Ensuring that the behavior of existing applications remains unaffected.

Additionally, the algorithm intelligently skips updates for any languagetesting  test data, meaning future iterations will run significantly faster when processing new records that require de-identification.



MTE has also been validated following the de-identification process, and the data is being encrypted as expected without any issues.

!image-20251010-215246.png|width=689,alt="image-20251010-215246.png"!

!image-20251010-215330.png|width=689,alt="image-20251010-215330.png"!

column247: 20/Aug/25 4:56 PM;557058:f58131cb-b67d-43c7-b30d-6b58d40bd077;This project has been estimated and is ready for approval.
column248:
11/Sep/25 5:52 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Hello [~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc],

When a candidate’s first name or last name is changed in OARS, the call candidate form email is triggered to the tester. This has been tested and the stored procedure has been modified accordingly in Prod. No deployment needed.

Currently for DLI OPIs, a TMS user cannot change the candidate’s firstname or lastname from TMS. They get blocked by the system, I have confirmed this with Diane. So no changes needed here.

Thank you
-Rohan

column1: [Rater Site Angular Upgrade] In the daily/weekly view of the calendar the availabilities are overlapped
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Log in to Rater Site
2) Go to “View/Update Calendar - Your Availability to Test”
3) Click on “Post Availability” 
4) Add any availability (at least one hour) 
5) Click on “Post Availability for Conducting OPIs”
6) Change the iew to Week and/or Day.

*Actual result:*
The 15min slots are overlapped over each other.

*Expected result:*
The row height is bigger so that the slots do not overlap

column28:
We will need to indicate test type (OPI, OPIc, AAPPL) (but do not need Samsung Rater, BOA Rater, MTA Rater), protocol (ILR, ACTFL), and language, with the ability to select all/none/some for each. 

Test Type should be defaulted to OPI with the ability to deselect OPI and select all/some of the other test types

Protocol should not be defaulted to any protocol so that the user can select ILR or ACTFL (or both).

Language should be defaulted to "all" with the ability to deselect all and select one/some of the languages.

It looks like we’re missing protocol (no default), defaulting Product to OPI, defaulting Language to All, and options for Select All/None. Does that sound right?

column261: INTK-616: ACTFL: Develop updates/reminders/announcements in Rater Site that block raters from rating until they've been acknowledged

column1: INTK-616: ACTFL: Develop updates/reminders/announcements in Rater Site that block raters from rating until they've been acknowledged
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
An external party is covering some or all of the cost of this project.

*Which external party is covering some or all of the cost? What percentage of the cost are they covering?:*
ACTFL would cover this cost 100%, presumably

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This is a new feature request from ACTFL that will presumably be charged to them. 

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Meeting a customer requirement
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Formal estimate/price quote for an external party

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As an ACTFL QA program admin, I need a way to post text\-based announcements (of up to a few sentences in length) to testers/raters that cannot be cleared without an acknowledgement and that block me from rating any tests until they've been acknowledged so that I can enforce raters' application of the information contained in those announcements with raters.

As an ACTFL QA program admin, I need a way to log in and post these messages without gaining access to all areas of the LTI Rating Admin site so that I can post messages independently of LTI staff. (If this would cause a huge effort, we could work to have this functionality available for all Rating Admins, create a login that would post/display as having come from ACTFL, and LTI staff could use that account to post the messages on ACTFL's behalf.)

As an ACTFL QA program admin, I need the date, time, and name of the individual user who posted the announcement to be displayed along with the announcement so that raters know when the announcement was posted and who posted it. 

As an tester/raters, I need the ability to acknowledge receipt of an announcement so that I can clear it and move on to complete my tasks on the LTI Rater Site. 

As an ACTFL QA program admin, I need a way to indicate the audience to whom I'm sending these announcements (ILR OPI testers of all (or some) languages, ACTFL OPI testers of all (or some) languages), so that the messages are posted only to their directed recipients so as not to cause confusion for other testers and raters. 

As an ACTFL QA program admin, I need the announcements to remain visible (and continue to block a rater from advancing into the site) until such time as the announcement has been cleared so that even if a rater doesn't log in often, they will see all announcements posted since their last login. (This requires the ability to display numerous announcements for acknowledge, either simultaneously (and one "acknowledge" action is tracked for all announcements simultaneously upon scrolling through them all) or sequentially, from oldest to newest (with the rater having to acknowledge each so that the next announcement is then displayed).

As an ACTFL Admin, I need a way to view a report log of acknowledgements made by raters so that I can follow up with raters, as needed. (I imagine this would be a TMS\-like report (or one available in the Rating Admin site that is developed for ACTFL to post these messages) whereby they can select a rater (or select all), and/or select a language (or select all) and a provide  a date range, and the results will display the message posted, the date it was posted, who posted it, and the date/timestamp the rater acknowledged the message.)




*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
ACTFL admin can post an announcement (or an LTI Admin can on their behalf) that is displayed only to the subset of raters selected and not to any other raters.

The message displayed to raters includes the date, time, and user who posted the message.

An ACTFL rater cannot advance past the message/announcement without logging their acknowledgement of the message.

If multiple messages have been posted since a rater's last login, all messages will appear for the rater to review and acknowledge (either one by one, or after scrolling through to the last message).

Admin can pull a report using the selected criteria (single or multiple raters, single or multiple languages, date range) and see the time stamp of the raters' acknowledge for each announcement posted.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
ACTFL Employees
Testers/Raters

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
An inability to hold raters accountable for applying information provided to them by ACTFL in their testing and rating activities. 

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
ACTFL's approval of the budget and timeline, LTI resource availability

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: INTK-637: Prevent email notice from being sent to the tester to grab when the assigned remote proctor is not available
column28:
Original HD ticket: We have received several complaints from different testers being unable to grab/capture OPIs online when they receive the email notification to do so. When they attempt to capture the OPI slot, even with other proposed dates/times for that request, they get a message that the \+\*remote proctor is not available\*\+. Then, they contact OPS and we switch remote proctors and ask the tester to try again, which then works.

I’m requesting a feature to improve this process. Is there a way for the TMS to flag OPIs that have choice dates/times that the assigned remote proctor is not available to prevent the email notice from being sent to the tester to grab (automatically sent as well as manually sent) and alert OPS of it so that we can proactively switch remote proctors before releasing the email notice to the tester to grab the OPI? See images attached.

Here is a recent comment received from a tester (Chantal): \*\_Also when we get urgent scheduling requests, more often than not, no matter which time you click on, it says the proctor is not available.  So why does the system suggest those times if no proctor is available?\_\*




From IT:
Time slots at remote proctor keeps changing, so even if an email is sent considering availability as as of now, after couple of hours it may change and we will have the same issue.

High level thought to handle it
1) Pull remote proctor availability for next 15 days every 30 minutes in a holding area in TMS. Over 15 days we assume availability will exists with remote proctor. 2) Email Tester only if availability is found in remote proctoring TMS availability area. Ops notified if not available. 3) Still scenarios will happen so improve the messaging on Tester Grab portal. 4) We also need to see the ROI by adding this new process to have remote proctor availability pulled in our system frequently with the number of cases that lands with this scenario.

Another option is to consider that for remote proctor, scheduling will be available on Tester Grab only if the date requested is beyond say 5 days. I have seen that for Prometric for the next 2 days there are hardly any slots available. We need to get some proper data on availabilities before a solution is concluded.


Link to HD ticket:
[https://languagetesting.atlassian.net/browse/THD-9217]

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
Tech: Remediate Rating Admin Site SSO through TMS (uses query strings)

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
Enhancing system security, protecting data from unauthorized access

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
The ratings systems support both LTI and MC testing.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved internal LTI user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Tech Infrastructure / Networking

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Maintenance/Troubleshooting: Regular system upkeep items and requests to address issues with platform performance, stability, or security 

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*

As a TMS user, I want to SSO into the Admin Site in a way that does not utilize query strings so that the sensitive data housed in the Admin Site is secure.

As a TMS user, I want to SSO into the Rater Site in a way that does not utilize query strings so that the sensitive data housed in the Rater Site is secure.

During the discovery phase we will need to discuss and decide whether this should be handled in tandem with MFA for both sites or kept as a separate effort.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
SSO to Rater Site through TMS no longer uses vulnerable query strings.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
The connection uses query strings which are known to be exploitable and could lead to a security risk.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: As LTI, I want to update on-screen wording for all MFA messaging so that it is clear and consistent.
column28:
!image-20250801-122325.png|width=471,height=379,alt="image-20250801-122325.png"!

|*Step 1:* Open your preferred authenticator app, such as Microsoft, Google, or Salesforce.
* If you haven't yet installed one of the apps listed above, you can download one for free on the Apple App Store or Google Play Store on your mobile device.
* If you prefer not to use a mobile app, you can add/use a browser extension like Google Authenticator on your computer.
*Step 2:* Link your device to your account using one of the two methods explained below.
* *Scan a QR Code:* You will see a QR code on your computer screen. From within your authenticator app, tap the plus sign to add a new site for authentication and then choose the option to scan a QA code. Your QR code reader will open (if you don't have one you will be prompted to install one). Capture the QR code on your mobile device. Doing so will load your register your Client Site account to the authenticator app.
* *Use a Secret Key:* Within your chosen authenticator, select the option to enter a key. On your computer screen, you will see the key displayed. Enter it into your authenticator app and complete the steps to register your account with the key.
*Step 3*: Enter the code displayed in your authenticator app for this account and click *Validate* to complete the login process. 
\\
Please enter the code displayed in your authenticator app.|

|·        |

column1: [Rater Site] When fetching a test and do not enter a rating to it, after the session expires and the user logs back, it is prompted again to the rating screen which generates an error due to no test being fetched
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Fetch a test (Tested with OPIc)
2) Do not rate the test and wait for the session to expire (1 hour)
3) Log back to the Rater Site
4) Click on “Fetch and Rate OPIc” option to move to the fetching page

*Actual result:*
The user is redirected to the page but with the screen of a fetched test which is all blank due to not having anything fetched.

*Expected result:*
The user is moved to the fetch and rate page as usual
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.

column1: [OPIc Admin Site] Searching for a Test in Rating Management / Search after a reload throws a message that the test was not found
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*

1 - Get a Test ID of any OPIc test.
2 - Go to “Rating Management / Search”.
3 - Enter the Test ID in the field and click “Search”.
4 - Reload the page
5 - Repeat step 3.

*Actual result:*
The test is not found the second time the test is searched after a reload

*Expected result:*
The test is always found after searching for it

column1: Rating Admin Site - 504 Error When Using Filters on OPIC TA Review Screen
column28:
When navigating to the OPIC TA Review screen and applying search filters, the system returns a 504 error

*Steps:*

# Navigate to the OPIC TA Review screen.
# Use any of the available search filters 
# Click on the Search button.

*Expected Result:*

The system should return the filtered list of results based on the selected criteria.

*Obtained Result:*
The system displays a 504 error after applying the filters

Error Code:504 Message:Http failure response for [https://dbc8omscr8.execute-api.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/uat/api/Rating/SearchRatingInformationByRatePendingFilter?PrmI32Distributor=-1&PrmI32Group=-1&PrmI32Company=-1&PrmI32Status=21&PrmI32FinalRating=-1&PrmI32Language=-1&PrmI32RatingProtocol=-1&PrmI32IsRCPEligible=-1&PrmI32AgingParam=-1&PrmI32TestType2=-1&PrmStrDateFrom=&PrmStrDateTo=:|https://dbc8omscr8.execute-api.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/uat/api/Rating/SearchRatingInformationByRatePendingFilter?PrmI32Distributor=-1&PrmI32Group=-1&PrmI32Company=-1&PrmI32Status=21&PrmI32FinalRating=-1&PrmI32Language=-1&PrmI32RatingProtocol=-1&PrmI32IsRCPEligible=-1&PrmI32AgingParam=-1&PrmI32TestType2=-1&PrmStrDateFrom=&PrmStrDateTo=:] 504 OK

column1: Rating Admin Site - The system gets stuck when trying to finalize a test
column28:
When attempting to finalize a test, the system consistently freezes after displaying the confirmation pop-up "Do you want to finalize the rating?" By clicking the OK button, the system does not proceed with the finalization. 

This issue occurs across all screens where the finalize test functionality is available

*Steps:*

Log into Rating Admin Site 

Go to Dashboard of any type of test 

Select a queue 

Select a test 

Put the rating 

Click on Finalize button 

*Expected Result:*

The test should be finalized successfully

*Obtained Result:*

After clicking OK the system freezes

column1: Research open source date picker that allows users to select multiple dates in different months and not only a single date or date range
column228:
Angular Material’s (mat-calendar) has been selected to replace the previously used ejs-calendar (Syncfusion).
The new open-source calendar has been fully integrated into the project and customized to meet the same functional requirements as the Syncfusion version. Additionally, it has been styled to maintain a consistent look and feel with the original design.

Some of the highlights are: 

* Non-sequential date selection to support flexible availability input
* Availability posting and persistence across views
* Dynamic calendar highlighting based on user input and database records
* UI enhancements to ensure compatibility with the existing design system



!image-20250731-202033.png|width=980,height=604,alt="image-20250731-202033.png"!

!image-20250731-202207.png|width=881,height=547,alt="image-20250731-202207.png"!

Some of the buttons and interactions have been fully developed from scratch to match the same level of functionality as before.

column1: [WPT] Verify that clicking the "Rate" button in an assigned test opens the rating pop up window that allows the rater to rate the test.
[WPT] Verify that the "Assigned Tests" table display all the assigned WPT test to the rater.
[WPT] Verify that the "Assigned Tests" table displays "No data to display" when there isn't any test assigned to the rater.
[WPT] Verify that the system displays an error message "No test is available for this rater." if the rater attempts to fetch a WPT test when none are available.
[WPT] Verify that a rater receives a notification email when a new WPT test is assigned.
[WPT] Verify that selecting a language and clicking the "Fetch the test and rate" button fetches a test of the selected language and displays the popup rate window.
[WPT] Verify that a rater can successfully fetch an available WPT test when no other WPT test is assigned to them.
[WPT] Verify that the "Language" dropdown in the "Fetch & rate WPT" page in the rater site only contains as options the rater assigned languages
[WPT] Verify that the "Fetch the test and rate" button is enabled again once the assigned test are rated without needing a page refresh
[WPT] Verify that the "Fetch the test and rate" button is disabled if an OPIc test is currently assigned.
[WPT] Verify that the "Fetch the test and rate" button is enabled if no OPIc test is currently assigned.
[AAPPL] Verify that the "Assigned Tests" table display all the assigned AAPPL test to the rater.
[OPIc] Verify that selecting a language and clicking the "Fetch the test and rate" button fetches a test of the selected language and displays the popup rate window.
[AAPPL] Verify that a rater receives a notification email when a new AAPPL test is assigned.
[OPIc] Verify that the "Language" dropdown in the "Fetch and rate OPIc" page in the rater site only contains as options the rater assigned languages
[AAPPL] Verify that the system displays an error message "No test is available for this rater." if the rater attempts to fetch an AAPPL test when none are available.
[AAPPL] Verify that the "Fetch the test and rate" button is enabled again once the assigned test are rated without needing a page refresh

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Create a client account in TMS.
# The system assigns a complex password automatically.
# Click on the Save button to finalize the creation.
# A temporary password is sent to the client's registered email address.

*Expected Result:*
The temporary password sent to the client should be the same as the one displayed in TMS before saving.

*Actual Result:*
The password sent via email does not match the one that was displayed in TMS prior to clicking Save.

column1: AAPPL Batch Process - Pop Up message for request an AAPPL test needs to be updated
column28:
The Pop Up message that appears before requesting an AAPPLtest  needs to be updated to the correct wording to be aligned with the AAPPL Test Request History feature 

Current Wording: 

“The system will begin to process your request when you click *OK* below. This may take some time, so please be patient. Do NOT reupload the same file if the request appears to time out as this may create duplicate test orders.

* You may check the *AAPPL Test Status* menu after 20 minutes to confirm your tests have been ordered successfully.
* If you do not see the ordered tests, email [aapplhelp@languagetesting.com|mailto:aapplhelp@languagetesting.com] and advise you have an upload issue. Be sure to include this information from your upload file:
** The student ID of the first learner in the file
** The student ID of the last learner in the file
** Please do not send learners' names in order to protect their Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

This will allow us to investigate and confirm if the complete file has been accepted.”
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column228: Closing this ticket as this popup is being discontinued.
column247: 13/Aug/25 4:26 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f] and [~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c] APM confirmed that they want to skip this popup completely. After the user submits their request, they will go straight to the new Test Request History screen, which has all of the information. Sounds good?
column248:
13/Aug/25 4:41 PM;557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc] Some messaging still has to be there as it is based on cut-off. So it will have 2 messages

E.g. say the cut-off is 50 students. 

# If I upload a file of 49 students then a message which can more or less be the same like current.
# If it is over 50 then another message something like “Click *OK* below, this may take some time for validating your upload, so please be patient”
column249: 13/Aug/25 5:27 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f] Is it possible to set it up so that there is no cut-off and all requests just go to the history screen by default?
column250: 18/Sep/25 10:08 AM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f] Could you please take a look at this question when you have a chance? APM wants to completely do away with this pop up for all orders. Can we make that happen?
column251:
18/Sep/25 11:51 AM;557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc] As we had discussed on it, I plan to set the Batch process cut-off count to 75 or 100 (TBD), so if there are less than equal to 75/100 records, system will process it like it is today and after processing will go to the View AAPPL Request summary page. However if the students in file are more than 75/100, it will do front end validation on accuracy of the file and then set it in queue for batch processing.

So I think the above message still holds valid as for Batch process route based on records, front end validation may take a min or so and then lands on “View AAPPL Request summary” page that provides more information. What do you say?
column252: 19/Sep/25 5:42 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:45776c31-ebc7-436f-a923-cd16afa4b76f] Closing this ticket as this popup is being discontinued.

column1: As LTI, I want to ensure that accounts created <2yrs ago are not affected by this process by implementing logic as explained in this ticket so that newer accounts are not considered dormant.
column28:
This is the logic that Support would like to implement:

IF Last Test Completed date = >2yrs/NULL AND Account Creation Date <2yrs THEN SKIP

IF Last Test Completed Date = >2yrs/NULL AND Account Creation Date >2yrs THEN Deactivate

Please let me know if that doesn’t make sense or if there are questions. Thanks!
