column261: OPS: Prometric not handling WPT in non roman characters

column1: OPS: Prometric not handling WPT in non roman characters
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Mark Dulsky

*What is your email address?:*
[Mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:Mdulsky@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
this will be for tests purchased on the US platform through Magento and B2B accounts flowing through to Prometric.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved customer/external user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Academic Individual (B2C)/Magento Website

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
I am taking a WPT test that is remotely proctored through Prometric, the default setup for my account, and my test is in a language that requires I use a different installed keyboard but the ProProctor lockdown browser does not allow me to change my keyboard.  The languages are Arabic, Chinese\-Cantonese, Chinese\-Mandarin, Greek, Hindi, Japanese, Korean, Persian, Russian, and Vietnamese.  If I am testing in one of these languages I want my test to flow automatically to ProctorU and I receive the correct emails to ProctorU.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
I purchase or a WPT test is ordered for me if B2B is one of the languages like Hindi with the default remote proctor of Proemtric and it seamlessly flows to ProctorU and I get the correct emails.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
currently, LTI is not aware that one of the language WPT tests a set to Prometric and the test taker can not complete the test.  We become aware after the fact and have to manually switch them to ProctorU which is a bad customer experience and eats up support time.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
None

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
Need to review ProctorU emails to ensure we do not need special WPT Prometric to ProctorU emails.

column261: INTK-646: OPS-Dormant accounts inactivated

column1: As the account users, admin, and alternate admin I want to receive periodic emails letting me know my account will be deactivated so that I can take action to prevent that from happening. Details in ticket.
column28:
Outbound Messages - Messages should be sent from TMS to the users, admin, and alternate admin of the parent account.  2 messages.  The first message is sent 60 days in advance.  2nd and final message happens at 15 days.  (message to be provided later).  The sales rep and  should be copied as cc on the outbound email so the customer knows who to respond to.

Recipients:

Account users, admin, alternate admin, cc: LTI Sales Rep

This is the template for the first email, to be sent at *60 days*:

Subject: Dormant account notice

 

Dear [insert first name],

During a routine review, we noted that your account has not been used to complete any tests in the past two years. In line with Language Testing International’s (LTI) policy, accounts that have been inactive for this length of time are marked as dormant.

As a result, your access to the Client Site Portal will be deactivated 60 days from today on +*XXX.*+

If you wish to have your account remain active, contact your account representative [insert from Sales Rep 2] (copied) or email [sales@languagetesting.com|mailto:sales@languagetesting.com].

We look forward to the opportunity to reintroduce you to the value of ACTFL’s Language Proficiency tests delivered exclusively by LTI. 

Sincerely,

Language Testing International



Final email at 15 days:

Subject: Dormant account final notice

 

Dear [insert first name],

During a routine review, we noted that your account has not been used to complete any tests in the past two years. In line with Language Testing International’s (LTI) policy, accounts that have been inactive for this length of time are marked as dormant.

As a result, your access to the Client Site Portal will be deactivated 15 days from today on +*XXX.*+

If you wish to have your account remain active, contact your account representative [insert from Sales Rep 2] (copied) or email [sales@languagetesting.com|mailto:sales@languagetesting.com].

We look forward to the opportunity to reintroduce you to the value of ACTFL’s Language Proficiency tests delivered exclusively by LTI.

Sincerely,

Language Testing International

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Mark Dulsky

*What is your email address?:*
[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This project is for accounts on TMS which is the US platform (assessments only)

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Datamart / Tableau Reports

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Report Request: Requesting Data from the System for Analytical Purposes
Maintenance/Troubleshooting: Regular system upkeep items and requests to address issues with platform performance, stability, or security 

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
LTI wants to automate the deactivation of TMS accounts (including all sub\-accounts) for those that have not completed a test in 2 years.  The process will run the first of every month looking back 2 years at each account (must include sub\-accounts) to see if they have tested within the time frame.  If they have not tested in 24 months then the account, sub\-account, and all users will be made inactive.  These accounts should have the ability to be made active again through a help desk ticket if sales can revive them.

Outbound Messages \- Messages should be sent from TMS to the users, admin, and alternate admin of the parent account.  2 messages.  The first message is sent 60 days in advance and repeated at 30 days if no tests have been completed.  2nd and final message happens at 15 days.  (message to be provided later).  The sales rep should be copied as cc on the outbound email so the customer knows who to respond to.

TMS wording: Accounts that have been inactive by this process should have it listed on the Client Information tab in BOLD Red letters "Dormant Account".  The preferred location is top right near Client status.

Reports: In addition, LTI needs to have a report to track these inactivations.  The Tableau report should include: Parent account name, Parent account TMS \#, Secondary sales rep, client Type, creation date, secondary sales rep, deactivation date, admin name, admin email, alternative admin name, alternative admin email

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
When an account has not tested in over 2 years I can see that the account has been properly labeled "Dormant Account" and that it will appear in the Tableau report.  In addition, the secondary sales rep was copied on the 3 emails sent from the system.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
If accounts are not being used and still active it increases the changes that the data can be compromised.  In addition, this removes a blind spot for organizations that have left LTI allowing us to win them back.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
none

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: Request to make APPT.ID column active in the Expired Tests queue to reactive DLI OPIs in Follow UP queue to get them scheduled
column28:
Requesting for the *Appt. ID* column in the *Expired Tests* queue in TMS (Queues>Expired Tests) for DLI OPIs to become active (hyperlink) so that I can easily and quickly be directed to the Follow Up page reactivate the OPI (change test status from expired to unmatched) to get them scheduled. 

Currently, I would go to the Expired Tests queue, copy the [Appt.ID|http://Appt.ID] for each OPI, paste it in the Quick Look Up page, search, then click on [Appt.ID|http://Appt.ID] to be taken to the Follow Up page to reset test status from expired to unmatched to schedule. It’s just way too many steps.

See image attached. 

Thanks,

Diane

column1: Tech: Implement a process that automatically deidentifies PII after 10 years
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
APM: Implement a process that automatically deidentifies PII after a certain period of time

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.
Data Deidentification/Destruction

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Please elaborate on the desired outcomes for the project by explaining the business benefits. A few sentences is enough.:*
The COPPA Review has caused us to identify the need for an automated process of deidentifying data. 

During the discovery phase for this project, the following questions will need to be addressed with IT, Sales, and the leadership team.

After what period of time should records automatically be deidentified?
Should this be implemented for K\-12 testing only, or for all test types?
How will this impact reporting? What about the AAPPL Longitudinal Report?

Additionally, we need to implement automatic deletion of data entered through the AAPPL student registration flow if the student signs up and puts in their information but never enters the code provided by their teacher to complete the process of requesting a test. That data doesn't correspond to a test record and should be automatically deleted on a frequent basis, to be determined during the discovery phase of this project. 


*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Academic Individual (B2C)/Magento Website
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site
Datamart / Tableau Reports

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees
LTI Test Candidates

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As an organization, LTI wants to be COPPA compliant so that we can be competitive in a market that increasingly values data privacy and protection.

As an LTI Client, I want my PII to be deidentified automatically in a predictable way that is outlined publicly in our Privacy Policy so that I know how my data will be handled.

As an LTI employee, I want PII to be deidentified automatically in a predictable way that is outlined publicly in our Privacy Policy so that requests for deidentification will be less frequent and less time consuming.

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Inability to comply with COPPA
Inability to meet the same standards met by our competitors in the K\-12 market
Possible data breaches would be on a larger scale than if data were automatically deidentified after a certain amount of time.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Data is automatically deidentified in the system per the specifications decided upon as this project is developed.

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
This will need to be outlined in the Privacy Policy.

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This affects client data for K\-12 testing, primarily.

———————————————

column1: INTK-607: OPS: B2C candidate created as a Salesforce contact
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Mark Dulsky

*What is your email address?:*
[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
This is an efficiency request for customer support.  Having the full name and email of our individual test candidates pushed into Salesforce under the correct account will save time in closing a Salesforce.  A case must be closed with an account and a contact.

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
Magento purchases and Salesforce flow to the US platform.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Academic Individual (B2C)/Magento Website

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
When an individual test taker calls or emails support with an inquiry, support must record this interaction in Salesforce.  All Salesforce cases require a contact and account to be associated with them.
When an individual purchases a test from LTI through Magento from General Application, General Application \- ILR Rating, General Proficiency \- ACTFL, ACTFL Test of English Proficiency (TEP) Candidates, I want to see their full name and email associated with the correct account

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
I buy a test from General Application as a first time user and my name and email flows to Salesforce in the account General Application.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
none

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
none

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: (7) Functional Ability at the Plus Level
column28:
h2. What changed:

On page 2, a new category named “Main” has been added with the main statement for the level for that column. Also, there is no functional ability for plus levels, with the exception of 0+. It should look like page 3 of the attached Word document, noting that this example does not have the right text for main.



----

As noted in our previous feedback, the +Plus level does not include a 'Functional Ability'+ section. Instead, please use the *'Main Statement'* [[AS1]|] [[AS2]|] [[KS3]|] [[FS4]|] [[YO5]|] [[AS6]|] [[KS7]|] [[YO8]|] for the Plus level and ensure that its title remains *'Main Statement'*—it should not be changed to 'Functional Ability.' 

----

 [[AS1]|]If we create a new category, either the right column or the left will always be blank while the other side has content, and the functional category will always be the opposite. Is that acceptable?

 [[AS2]|]It would look better to simply not include a functional ability for plus levels.

 [[KS3]|]ACTFL please outlined desired approach and LTI will implement accordingly (or notify you if the communicated approach introduces any complications).

 [[FS4]|]This may require further discussion.

In my view, if it is not possible to include the “Main Statement” for the Plus level under the same column without adding a third column, we should leave the Functional Ability section for the Plus level blank. Currently, the Functional Ability of the floor (left column) repeats in the right column, which is inaccurate.

 [[YO5]|]The use of “Main Statement” was initially brought up via email communication in March, and we provided additional information in April. The suggestion was to use the “Main Statement” for the plus level as the Functional Ability, and name the title accordingly.

 [[AS6]|]We may need to discuss this one.

 [[KS7]|]Let's schedule a meeting to discuss.

 [[YO8]|]Would it be possible to get your questions about this point in advance in case we need input from our facilitators who are doing the testing?

----

See page 3 of the attached document for the agreed upon format.

column1: (12) Rationale Titles
column28:
h2. What changed:

The titles over the rationale boxes on page 2 should be:

·       *Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

·      *Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

Where the ___ is replaced with the rated level for the first and the next higher level for the 2nd.

----

# *Comment*: *Rating Rationale*: Please name the boxes [[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[FS3]|] [[AS4]|] [[KS5]|] [[YO6]|] [[AS7]|] on the rating rationale section of the form [page 2-screnshot below] according to what we suggested earlier:

·       *Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

·      *Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

Instead of Rationale_meets and Rationale_not_meets.  



----

 [[AS1]|]My miss

 [[KS2]|]LTI will correct this.

 [[FS3]|]Thank you!

 [[AS4]|]I noticed that #6 and #12 suggest different wording for the same titles

 [[KS5]|]ACTFL will provide a final determination on the labels/titles to use.

 [[YO6]|]This suggestion: 
-Left col: “This sample exhibits the following (L1) features:”

-Right col: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:”

 

Was only for the two columns (SLDs).

 

The suggestion on comment 12:

*-Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

*-Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

 

Was only for the rationale.

 

If it is not possible to have two different titles, we would like to use the following in both areas:

 

* This sample exhibits the following (L-)  features:

-This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L-) features:

 [[AS7]|]LTI will correct this

column261: ACTFL: Update DLI Rater Comment/Rationale Forms to FormStack

column1: (11) Negative Rationale
column28:
h2. What changed:

This one is essentially a duplicate of both #6 and #12. The titles over the top of the statement lists should be:

-Left col: “This sample exhibits the following (L__) features:”

-Right col: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L__) features:”



The titles over the rationale boxes should be:

*Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level L____*

 and

*Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level L____*



----

# *Comment*: The resulting rationale seems inaccurate [[AS1]|] as automatically populated. For example, this is a test rated 2+. I selected “Able to produce cohesive discourse…” under Precision of Forms and Meanings. I checked this because this is something the examinee can NOT do.[[AS2]|] [[KS3]|] [[FS4]|] [[YO5]|] [[AS6]|] [[YO7]|] [[AS8]|] 



However, when the rationale is created it says:



Even though the heading is “not meets” the text is phrased in the affirmative, and seems to indicate that the examinee can do this.

*Suggested Action*: Although raters can edit the text, is it possible for the form to be programmed to recognize any selection made in the right column (ceiling/breakdown) as indicating what the examinee is *not* able to do. If this is not possible, we will provide the required training to our testers/raters.

----

 [[AS1]|]It was very clear to us that you wanted the exact wording of the SLD’s on both sides and the raters would change it to match the examinee’s performance.

 [[AS2]|]This is as-designed according to ACTFL instructions. We received clear instructions that we were not to modify any content and use the exact SLDs, as provided by ACTFL. If ACTFL would like to provide separate SLDs for can do vs cannot do, this can be done as a new request. However it will probably be simpler to train raters that they can modify the rationale to what they want it to say.

 [[KS3]|]ACTFL please see my email, dated 3/11/2025 where the positive and negative statements were requested from ACTFL for this purpose, and ACTFL's deliver to LTI on 3/19/2025, which did not include any negative statements.

 

ACTFL please advise if you wish to have this handled as a change request. If you do, we'll need you to provide the statements and then we'll determine the costs and timeline for this request. Otherwise, raters should be trained to update the statements, as you had indicated would be the flow to be followed when we last discussed these.

 [[FS4]|]Alan and Kim are correct. Our original intent—and current expectation—is for the exact SLDs to be listed in the rationale sections so that raters can read and edit them as needed.

Please ensure the following:

·       The *sustained performance SLDs* (left column) should appear in the *first section* of the rationale “Rattionale_Meets”.

·       The *breakdown-related SLDs* (right column) should appear in the *second section* under “Rationale_Not_Meet.”

This distinction is important so raters clearly understand that, although the statements are phrased as Can-Do, those listed under the “Not Meet” section represent performance breakdowns.

 

We will also inform our raters how to complete the rationale.

 [[YO5]|]I agree.

 

Additionally, “Rationale_meets” and “Rationale_not_meet”, should be replaced with:

*Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

 

*Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

 

 [[AS6]|]This wording matches #12 below, but does not match #6 above. We have agreed to make the change in #12, but we need a final confirmation on which wording to use.

 [[YO7]|]As mentioned in comment #6: 

This suggestion: 
-Left col: “This sample exhibits the following (L1) features:”

-Right col: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:”

 

Was only for the two columns (SLDs).

 

The suggestion on comment 12:

*-Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

*-Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

 

Was only for the rationale.

 

If it is not possible to have two different titles, we would like to use the following in both areas:

 

* This sample exhibits the following (L-)  features:

-This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L-) features:







 [[AS8]|]LTI will update the 4 titles to the text above.

column1: (10) Rating of 2+ for L3 Format
column28:
h2. What changed:

On page 1, in all of the task drop downs a new option named “Not Clear” has been added. Selecting this option should not cause any validation issues. When “Not Clear” is selected, you should not need to select any other options on that row.

----

# *Comment*: I cannot submit a rating of 2+ for a test that uses an L3 format, i.e., examinee was over-tested. Get the message below[[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[YO3]|] [[AS4]|] [[YO5]|] :



*Suggested Action*: The form should allow the rater to proceed even if some required tasks were not elicited. Raters should not enter 'dummy' tasks just to move forward with completing the form. Missing tasks is an issue, and rater can report them to ACTFL.

----

 [[AS1]|]Allowing for any rating to have any number of tasks contradicts prior instructions. ACTFL specifically requested this check. If we want to change this, if the number of tasks is not correct, the rater will need to mark that it requires ACTFL review and enter the reason. Since this had been there since the first release and not included in the change request, this is considered a new request.

 [[KS2]|]ACTFL please advise if you wish to have this handled as a change request. If you do, we'll determine the costs and timeline for this request.

 [[YO3]|]We will address this issue through training. However, please add “Not Clear” in the drop menu of the Task & Level, which is currently missing from the form. 

This is not a new request. Please see screenshot below from the mockup form that was previously approved. 

 

 



 [[AS4]|]LTI will add “Not Clear” to the bottom of all 12 of the task lists.

 [[YO5]|]Thank you!

column261: ACTFL: Update DLI Rater Comment/Rationale Forms to FormStack

column1: (8) Duplicate Statements
column28:
h3. What Changed:

Previously on page 2, in the statements, on the left side we listed statements for both the rated level and the next higher level. They don’t want the next higher level on the left side, so the left side should now only show the rated level.

----

# *Comment*: If a sample is rated L1, the second page lists the SLDs for L1+ under both the L1 and L1+ sections[[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[YO3]|] [[KS4]|] [[YO5]|] [[AS6]|] .

 

*Suggested Action*: The SLDs should not be listed in both columns. The SLDs for the rating level should be listed in the left column; the SLDs for the next higher level in the right column. There should not be SLDs for more than one sub-level in either column.

----

 [[AS1]|]This can be done. This has been in the form since the first release. This was not outlined in the changes for the current release and would be considered a new request.

 [[KS2]|]ACTFL please advise if you wish to have this handled as a change request. If you do, we'll determine the costs and timeline for this request.

 [[YO3]|]Response missing.

 [[KS4]|]LTI doesn't understand your response, Yesenia. Could you please clarify?

 [[YO5]|]Sorry for missing this part.

 

This is not a new request. From the beginning it was clear that the SLDs related to the Floor would be listed on the left column and the SLD’s related to Ceiling would be listed on the right column. In other words, one SLD would not be listed in both places. Currently the form mixes the SLDs.

 [[AS6]|]LTI will remove the duplicates

column261: ACTFL: Update DLI Rater Comment/Rationale Forms to FormStack

column1: (7) Functional Ability at the Plus Level
column28:
h2. What changed:

On page 2, if the either column shows a plus level (i.e. 2+, 3+, etc.), then the functional cell should be empty for that column, with the exception of 0+, which does have a functional value.



----

# Currently, if the OPI is rated L1, the Functional Ability description for L1 is also being listed under L1+. If the OPI is rated L2, the Functional Ability description for L2 is also being listed under L2+. This is probably the case for all plus levels. [[YO1]|] [[AS2]|] [[YO3]|] 

 



 

*Suggested Action*:

As noted in our previous feedback, the +Plus level does not include a 'Functional Ability'+ section. Instead, please use the *'Main Statement'*[[AS4]|] [[AS5]|] [[KS6]|] [[FS7]|] [[YO8]|] [[AS9]|] [[KS10]|] [[YO11]|] for the Plus level and ensure that its title remains *'Main Statement'*—it should not be changed to 'Functional Ability.'

Note: Page 3 in the attached options file was the approved approach by ACTFL.

----

 [[YO1]|]Since this is coded orange, we assume that it will be resolved.

 

We should keep the descriptors related to sustained performance (left column) separate from those indicating breakdown (right column).

 [[AS2]|]Yes, it will be resolved.

 [[YO3]|]Thank you!

 [[AS4]|]If we create a new category, either the right column or the left will always be blank while the other side has content, and the functional category will always be the opposite. Is that acceptable?

 [[AS5]|]It would look better to simply not include a functional ability for plus levels.

 [[KS6]|]ACTFL please outlined desired approach and LTI will implement accordingly (or notify you if the communicated approach introduces any complications).

 [[FS7]|]This may require further discussion.

 

In my view, if it is not possible to include the “Main Statement” for the Plus level under the same column without adding a third column, we should leave the Functional Ability section for the Plus level blank. Currently, the Functional Ability of the floor (left column) repeats in the right column, which is inaccurate.

 [[YO8]|]The use of “Main Statement” was initially brought up via email communication in March, and we provided additional information in April. The suggestion was to use the “Main Statement” for the plus level as the Functional Ability, and name the title accordingly.

 [[AS9]|]We may need to discuss this one.

 [[KS10]|]Let's schedule a meeting to discuss.

 [[YO11]|]Would it be possible to get your questions about this point in advance in case we need input from our facilitators who are doing the testing?

column261: ACTFL: Update DLI Rater Comment/Rationale Forms to FormStack

column1: (6) Statement Title Wording
column28:
h2. What changed:

On page 2, the column headings have changed above the two columns of statements. They are now:

* Left column: “This sample exhibits the following (L1) features:”
* Right column: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:”

----

# *Comment*: I understand the left column, but the right column is not clear to me. Should raters click the descriptors that *_don’t match the sample_*[[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[FS3]|] [[YO4]|] [[AS5]|] [[KS6]|] [[YO7]|] [[AS8]|] ? If that is the intention, it is not clear.

 

Also, when I click one descriptor in L1, the corresponding 1+ descriptor disappears. This would make sense if we were selecting the items that match either L1 +or+ L1+. But if I click L1 for a feature, it would make sense that I also would click L1+ for that same feature as +not+ having been met. My suggestion would be to revise the headings.

*Suggested Action*:

·      Left col: “This sample exhibits the following (L1) features:”

·      Right col: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:”



Then, I don’t think we need descriptors to disappear when their counterpart is selected for the reasons explained above. 

----

 [[AS1]|]This is something that has existed or a long time and should be a one-time training issue.

 [[KS2]|]ACTFL please address through training.

 [[FS3]|]If renaming the column titles according to the Suggested Action is not feasible, we can address this through training. However, it may appear illogical or unclear to users.

 

This aspect may require further discussion.

 [[YO4]|]To the extent possible, the titles should reflect the true nature of the content. For example, if the content is related to breakdown, then title should be something along what is proposed in the suggested action (eg., This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:)

 

LTI: What would be required to change the names of the columns?

 [[AS5]|]#6 and #12 are suggesting different column titles.

 [[KS6]|]ACTFL, within this document comment #6 and comment #12 both make requests to change the names of these columns and the two requests are not in alignment. Please review and provide one consolidated label/title option and kindly provide it in all the pertinent areas of this document's comments to ensure it's captured and documented everywhere as we move forward. Thank you!

 [[YO7]|]This suggestion: 
-Left col: “This sample exhibits the following (L1) features:”

-Right col: “This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L1+) features:”

 

Was only for the two columns (SLDs).

 

The suggestion on comment 12:

*-Evidence to support rating of ILR Scale Level____*

*-Evidence of why the examinee does not meet ILR Scale Level ____*

 

Was only for the rationale.

 

If it is not possible to have two different titles, we would like to use the following in both areas:

 

* This sample exhibits the following (L-)  features:

-This sample does NOT exhibit the following (L-) features:

 [[AS8]|]LTI will implement the 4 separate titles.

column1: (4) The language below can be improved

*Suggested Action*: Suggest changing language to read: Additional example of why the examinee does not meet the next higher ILR level (optional).

Then the next line of direction: Please complete the following sentence to share as an example:

Alternately, could there be a box to click to add an example and then this section appears if needed? [[FS1]|] [[AS2]|] [[KS3]|] [[FS4]|] 

----

 [[FS1]|]LTI, please advise.

 [[AS2]|]The language can be changed. The checkbox to make the 2nd example appear would require a little development, which can be done.

 [[KS3]|]LTI will address.

 [[FS4]|]Thank you!

column1: QA Shadowing
column28:
As an APM analyst I want the ILS machine scoring system to calculate ILS prompt scores real-time, using the proposed architecture, so that we can monitor the ILS machine scoring to ensure accuracy and so that we do not have any surprises when going live in production.

This will require that candidate audio be sent real-time to the scoring system and prompt scores calculated by the machine scoring be stored in a database accessible by Tableau for reporting.

The goal is to ensure the ILS machine scoring is performing as expected before going live in production.

That way we can minimize the effort. If it has to be done before the integration, it would require more effort. Could you please confirm? 



[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc] , I don’t think Rohan can handle it.

column1: (2) Page 2 – Rating a test at L0
column28:
h2. What Changed:


If you rate a test as L0 on page 1, there is a statement on page 2 to select from now.


----

*Comment*: If you happen to rate someone a straight L0, nothing comes up on Page 2.

*Suggested Action*: The SLDs for L0 should be listed[[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[FS3]|] [[YO4]|] [[AS5]|] [[AS6]|] [[YO7]|] .

----

 [[AS1]|]The SLD’s for L0 were not provided on ACTFL’s document

 [[KS2]|]ACTFL, please provide.

 [[FS3]|]L0 is the first proficiency level. It is listed under the Response Level section on the QA form provided by ACTFL. It is also included in the 2021 SLDs, a copy of which has been shared.

 [[YO4]|]Additionally, L0 is listed under the Response Level section of the mockup form that was initially created by LTI provided to ACTFL and approved by DLI a while back.

 [[AS5]|]It appeared that there were no L0 descriptors in the “2021 ILR Speaking Descriptors Matrix.xlsx” file you provided. However, I just realized that there is a hidden column C that does contain two SLDs for L0. We did not recognize it because the column was hidden.

 [[AS6]|]We will add those 2

 [[YO7]|]Thank you!

column261: ACTFL: Update DLI Rater Comment/Rationale Forms to FormStack

column1: (1) Page 1 – Response levels for Level 4/5 tasks
column28:
h2. What Changed?

On page 1, if you select an L4 task, then the Response Level options should include 4+ and 5

----

*Comment*: The maximum response level for the L4 tasks is 4. Response levels of 4+ or 5 are only available for the L5 tasks, which do not appear in the current ILR OPI protocol.

*Suggested Action*: For L4 topics, the response level must have L4, 4+, and L5 options[[AS1]|] [[KS2]|] [[FS3]|] [[YO4]|] [[AS5]|] [[YO6]|] .

----

 [[AS1]|]This contradicts the comment that “The maximum response level for the L4 tasks is 4. Response levels of 4+ or 5 are only available for the L5 tasks ”

 [[KS2]|]ACTFL, please clarify the request.

 [[FS3]|]I believe this matter has been previously discussed and is not a new request. Currently, there are no designated topics for Level 5. However, the examinee’s proficiency is evaluated using Level 4 tasks. Therefore, when L4 tasks are selected, all  response level options must include *L4, L4+, and L5* to allow for an accurate assessment of higher-level performance.

 [[YO4]|]As far as we know, this is not a new request. Please see email from 2/27/2025. We also discussed this during a meeting.  Let us know if there are any further questions.

 [[AS5]|]We thought this was resolved last release due to the addition of 3 L5 tasks. It appears that is not the case. We will fix this.

 [[YO6]|]Thank you!

column1: As LTI, I want to update the wording on the History screen as documented in this ticket so that it is clear to users how to navigate the screen.
column28:
!image-20250612-141452.png|width=981,height=384,alt="image-20250612-141452.png"!



*AAPPL Test Request History* Page 

# Navigation Module: *Test Request History* 

# Heading: *AAPPL Test Request History* 

* Sub-Heading: Track the status of AAPPL requests made in the last 10 days, view processing progress, and confirm test orders.” so that the purpose of the landing page is clear.  

# Update to: Review the status of your recently received AAPPL Test Requests below. For large uploads, please allow up to 4 hours for processing. Once “Completed,” ordered tests are available to administer in AAPPL Test Status.  

# Update to: Processing Status is Updated Hourly 

# Update Column Heading to: Username 

# Update Column 

* Heading: Duplicates 

* Contents: Total number of rejected records 

# Add additional text: If a request is not Completed after 4 hours, please email [+aapplhelp@languagetesting.com+|mailto:aapplhelp@languagetesting.com] and advise that you have an upload issue. Your email should reference the Student ID Number from Column E for the first learner in the file [Row 2] and the last learner in the file. To protect their Personally Identifiable Information, please *do not* include any learners’ names.

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Mark Dulsky

*What is your email address?:*
[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
The database lives in TMS

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Academic Individual (B2C)/Magento Website

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.
Maintenance/Troubleshooting: Regular system upkeep items and requests to address issues with platform performance, stability, or security 

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
Please update the database of coutnries per the attached so we can have a list the reflects current reality

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
I will see Serbia as a country list and not Yugoslavia

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Not having a current country list in the database can prevent people from purchasing tests from Magento 

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
none

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*

column1: As a TMS user, I want to see the status of requests uploaded in batches so that I know what actions are required of me.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column228:
Summary Page: 

* Default Navigation
** By default, when loading the AAPPL Batch Processing page, the user will be directed to the Status tab.
** After successfully uploading a batch process in the Upload Process tab, the user will also be redirected to the Status tab.
* Upload Redirect
** After uploading a batch process successfully, the user will be sent to the Status tab.

!image-20250815-212001.png|width=1014,height=552,alt="image-20250815-212001.png"!

* Status Tab Features
** Start Date and To Date
i. By default, the current date will be selected as the To Date, and 3 months prior to the current date will be selected as the Start Date.
ii. When clicking on this control, a calendar will pop up for the user to select a valid date.
iii. Only numeric inputs are allowed; no other characters are permitted in the text boxes.
iv. After selecting a valid date, the status grid will be updated.
** Status Grid
i. Displays summary information about batch processing, ordered by the date requested.
ii. Contains dynamic hyperlinks for the status:
*** Based on the current status in the database, the links are updated automatically.
*** Clicking a link opens a pop-up in the same page, directing the user to the AAPPL Batch Processing Details Page.
*** !image-20250815-212131.png|width=1042,height=1126,alt="image-20250815-212131.png"!

* AAPPL Batch Processing Details Page
** Displays detailed information about the batch process.
**  Shows the status of each row in the Excel document uploaded for the selected batch.
** The grid is dynamic and supports:
*** Pagination
*** Sorting on any column
** Each row has a dedicated Notes section:
*** Any server generated notes will be displayed automatically and opened for the corresponding row.
*** This helps users receive additional information about where a process may have failed and track the status of past processes.
** !image-20250815-212415.png|width=1018,height=558,alt="image-20250815-212415.png"!

column1: As the system, I want to ingest batch requests and queue them up for processing so that performance is optimized.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column228:
The scheduler settings, SP, functions and transactions for executing the batch process have been completed. The system not only executes new and pending transactions, but also updates the Processed Count to indicate how many transactions were executed within a batch. In addition, it provides detailed error messages when a batch process fails, whether due to user error, duplicate records, non-existent records, or system errors.

The process updates records accordingly, marking transactions as either Completed, Failed or Pending for reprocessing. Pending transactions are automatically retried during the next execution. Failed transactions, however, must be addressed by the requestor, either by submitting a support ticket to reprocess the failed transaction or by creating a new batch process request.

When the batch executes successfully, the requested accommodations are made available both in AAPPL Batch Processing Details site and on the client site Accommodation Status menu.



!image-20250821-205826.png|width=2128,height=1318,alt="image-20250821-205826.png"!

*Test Results QA 09/18/2025*

Added to the queue for it to be processed

!6.png|width=657%,alt="6.png"!

*What is your name?:*
Kim

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
Currently, AAPPL Accommodation setups take more than 1 minute each to process and ~25 seconds of that is the TMS wait time to get a learner's Username to load their test details in the TMS AAPPL Accommodations tool. Given the volume of accommodation requests we receive these days, we need a more efficient flow so that APM team members can do their value\-add work and not spend the day processing these accommodations. 

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
AAPPL is a US\-only product

Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Improved internal LTI user experience

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization

See attached document with the project request details.

This will be produced once the project scope and approach is finalized. 

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
continued use of an inefficient process with a growing volume of requests being submitted

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
resources

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
Update details on the Accommodations request intake form to clarify for customers what to expect once their request is approved and processed and update Client Site resources to explain the new AAPPL Accommodations module and what it displays

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
Tech: MFA for Clientsite w/ required password complexity CAPEX2025\_TECH\_08

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
TECH

*Will this request require CFO, CEO, and/or Multicampus approval based on the definitions below?:*
Yes

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
TBD

*Which type of request is this?:*
CAPEX Project Requiring Internal Labor

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
Client Site is used for US\-based testing.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
Near Future \- Required within the next 6\-12 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a Client Site user, I want to choose between receiving an OTP via email or using an authenticator app during my first login, so that I can select my preferred method of MFA.

As a Client Site user, I want to use any standard authenticator app (like Google Authenticator), so that I am not restricted to a single tool.

As a system, I want the selected MFA method to be visible in the TMS client search results, so that admins can easily see each user’s chosen method.

As a user, I want to receive an OTP via email from noreply@lti, so that I can verify my identity securely.

As a system, I want OTPs to expire after 10 minutes by default, so that unused codes become invalid and reduce risk.

As a system, I want MFA to be enabled by default for users created through the Client Site user maintenance process, so that new users are secured immediately.

As a TMS admin, I want the ability to reset a user’s MFA method in TMS, so that changes can be made if a user loses access or needs to switch.

As a TMS admin, I want the ability to override MFA temporarily (e.g., 3 logins or 72 hours) for a limited set of users, so that urgent client needs can still be met.

As an admin, I want enable MFA options at the client level once the feature is rolled out, so that flexibility is allowed for early in the process.

As an admin, I want users’ MFA settings to be visible in the TMS client search/user setup interface, so that support and auditability are improved.

As a system, I want to automatically generate a complex password when a new user is created in TMS, so that accounts begin with secure credentials.

As a user, I want the system to enforce Bank of America (BoA) standard password complexity rules, so that our organization meets required security standards.

As a system, I want to enforce password complexity checks during reset/change operations, so that legacy users transition to stronger passwords without disrupting current compliant users.

As an admin, I want the “uncheck” option for password complexity in TMS to be removed, so that password policies are always enforced uniformly.

As a system, I want to provide user\-friendly error handling during password updates, so that users understand what they need to fix.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
TBD

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
System is not secure and up to date according to current standards and data could be at risk.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
Sales/support will need documentation
Email notifications to users

column261: INTK-624: APM: Handling tests when candidate proceeds with unsupported browser

column1: As LTI, when an NR is issued for an ALIRA taken with an unsupported browser, I want a reason code to flow to the Client Site explaining the rating. Details in ticket.

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Young\-A Son

*What is your email address?:*
[yson@languagetesting.com|mailto:yson@languagetesting.com]

*Brief Project Title \- Please provide a descriptive title, starting with the name of your department.:*
Including the fields Prompt Listen Count and Total Prompt Count into Datamart

*Which department is this work being requested for?:*
APM

*Will this request require CFO, CEO, and/or Multicampus approval based on the definitions below?:*
No

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
I don't know. If this option is selected, the Head for the department making the request will be required to provide this information.

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
N/A

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*What is the anticipated timeline for this request?:*
ASAP \- Required within the next 3\-6 weeks

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Datamart / Tableau Reports

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.
Report Request: Requesting Data from the System for Analytical Purposes

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a Data Analytics Specialist, I will be able to analyze how many prompts a rater has clicked when rating OPIs

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
I will be able to see the two fields available in datamart (potentially in the Rating table)

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
If these data are not available it will be difficult to accurately track whether a rater is actually listening to all the prompts when rating OPIc tests.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
There are no dependencies.

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: Configure pricing in TMS and add to all active AAPPL accounts
column28:
Dear All:

 

As we discussed during the meeting on what Mark mentioned, we can follow the same process of setup that is currently being done for AAPPL full measure having discount. In that way it will be the same workflow, and no change required.

 

Examples:

# AAPPL full measure with discount, as shown in screen snap below II/RC is set for discounted price i.e. 12.00 & 12.50 respectively. In this case request ordered from clientsite with II/RC will have these prices.

!image-20250603-214435.png|width=492,height=323,alt="image-20250603-214435.png"!



 

# If Client orders ASL for II only, then system will apply the below price to the test i.e. 14.00 as shown in screen snap below.

 

!image-20250603-214447.png|width=520,height=224,alt="image-20250603-214447.png"!



 

# If the client orders ASL for RC only, then system will apply below shown price to test i.e. 12.50



 

!image-20250603-214501.png|width=493,height=189,alt="image-20250603-214501.png"!

# If there is a bundle configuration of ILS & IR/IL and if price for II/RC is set to discounted as shown in screen snap below, system will apply discounted price to II and RC

!image-20250603-214513.png|width=492,height=133,alt="image-20250603-214513.png"!



 

Let me know if you have any questions.

 

Thank you.

 

Regards

Vijay

column1: After running the batch process to uncapture an OPI test after one hour of no rating it. I was still able to rate it.
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:
*1) Fetch an OPI test using UATRater.
2) Wait for more than an hour while keeping the fetched test tab open.
3) Run batch process in the TMS db.
4) Submit a rating for the test.

*Actual result:
*The rating was successfully submitted.

*Expected result:
*The rater can’t submit a rating anymore and a pop up message is displayed explaining the reason.

+*New Text to go on all screens:*+ 

 

*Important Notes:* 

* You must submit your invoice for a payment to be processed. 

* The *Submit Invoice* button is active on the 1^st^, 2^nd^, and 3^rd^ and the 16^th^, 17^th^, and 18^th^ of each month so that you can submit invoices to LTI Accounting for your rating activity during the last half and the first half of the month, respectively.  

* You will receive your payment approximately 30 days from the date of invoice submission.  

* For any questions or issues related to payments, please reach out to [+Accounting@languagetesting.com+|mailto:Accounting@languagetesting.com].

column1: INTK-686: APM: Update Rater Activity Report page for all test types on Rater Site
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Kim

*What is your email address?:*
[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
impacts all raters

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved customer/external user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Content Update: Requesting that test content or B2C/B2B Client\-Facing content/wording be updated

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a rater using the LTI Rater Site, I need clearer instructions on the Activity Report page so that I don't need to reach out to Support, Accounting, or APM for help. 

See this document for specific details of the changes requested: [https://ltiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/ksallee_languagetesting_com/EUQ4HkyfNP5GlzOJRvn2YLcBnq7RSToikH1kh5t8rke66g?e=bWnJeu]

The update should be made to all "tabs" (i.e. all test types: OPIc, WPT, OPI, AAPPL ILS, and AAPPL PW) within this module. 

Also, while completing this work, would you also suppress the “View/Update Calendar” module for AAPPL users? This is not functionality that is used with AAPPL.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
The requested text will appear on all tabs (i.e. all test type screens) within the Activity Report module on the Rater Site. 

The Availability Calendar module will also no longer be visible for AAPPL users. 

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Testers/Raters

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
continued confusion

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
n/a

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
update rater resources

column1: After running the batch process to uncapture an aappl test after one hour of no rating it. I was still able to rate it.
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1) Fetch an aappl test using UATRater. The fetched test was Test ID: 2915375
2) Wait for more than an hour while keeping the fetched test tab open.
3) Run batch process in the aappl db.
4) Submit a rating for the test.

*Actual result:*
The rating was successfully submitted.

*Expected result:*
The rater can’t submit a rating anymore and a pop up message is displayed explaining the reason.

WCAG compliance is a company priority that will improve our standing in the market and make our tests accessible.

column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:*
There are no financial feasibility details because this is a required infrastructure upgrade that must be completed for our systems to stay up and running and supported. The benefits are system stability, security, and long term maintenance.

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This affects both systems.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Meeting a customer requirement
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Maintenance/Troubleshooting: Regular system upkeep items and requests to address issues with platform performance, stability, or security 

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As LTI, I want to complete the required periodic upgrades to the Laravel framework so that our systems operate on a supported and secure version and stay stable for the long term.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Laravel is upgraded from version 9 to 12, QA tested, and implemented on Prod.

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees
LTI Test Candidates
Multicampus Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
If Laravel is not kept up to date, the system will be functioning on outdated infrastructure that is not supported.

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

No

1.	AAPPL increase
i.	AAPPL Full Measure $22.50
ii.	ILS: $11.00
iii.	PW: $6.00
iv.	IL/IR: $5.50

vi.	IL $2.75 – need slab code

3.	Computer proctoring  \- $5 for AAPPL & ALIRA (including wording on teh client ordering tab of the client site)

column1: As a Client Site user, I want to see a revised description for tests rated UR- Technical Issue so that II tests are handled inclusively. New description in task.
column28: *UR- Technical Issue* - The test is UR because there was a technical problem that prevents raters from reviewing the learner's responses. When a component is rated, the following day, the system will automatically generate a new test component for the learner to retest with new credentials; the new login information can be accessed within the AAPPL Test Status Menu.

column1: As a Client Site user, I want to see a revised description for tests rated NR - Poor Recording Quality so that II tests are handled inclusively. Revised description in task.
column28: *NR – Poor Recording Quality* - This test is NR because the recording quality does not allow the learner’s language production to be accurately assessed. Either the media was recorded at a resolution too low to provide detail or background noise prevents an accurate rating. If you wish to retest this learner, please do so in a distraction-free environment. Test the media capture (audio or video) in advance by using the AAPPL Demo or System Check.

column28:
!image-20250603-171452.png|width=892,height=554,alt="image-20250603-171452.png"!

# Title: *Accommodations Status* 

# Subtitle: Review the status of accommodation requests for your learners 

# Under the subtitle, in standard text, add the additional content: This page provides a summary of all submitted accommodation requests, including their status and relevant details. For guidance on understanding the process, refer to the [+LTI Test Accommodations page+|https://www.languagetesting.com/k-12-test-accommodations].  

# Add Button *Submit New Request* 

# Date Column: “Request Date” 















*What is your name?:*
Ash Britton

*What is your email address?:*
[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
I don't know. If this option is selected, the Head for the department making the request will be required to provide this information.

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
unknown

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Improved customer/external user experience
Process improvement/automation

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As a TMS Admin, I want the Accommodations Status module to be improved and reenabled for all AAPPL configured accounts, so that users can clearly view the status of accommodation requests and easily access the request form without confusion about the module’s functionality.

As a Client Site User, I want a clear view of the status of my learners’ accommodation requests, so that I can easily track what’s been submitted and processed and know exactly where to go to request new accommodations.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Module Content Updates
1. The Accommodations Status screen displays a clearly worded statement indicating its purpose is to view the status of requested accommodations only.
2. A clearly labeled link to the Test Accommodations Page is present and leads directly to the LTI website ([https://www.languagetesting.com/k-12-test-accommodations|https://www.languagetesting.com/k-12-test-accommodations])
3. A clearly labeled button* "Submit New Request" is present and leads directly to the Request Form ([https://form.asana.com/?k=bHSSwcRPsgEwRTfUu9r_6w&d=16125004755173|https://form.asana.com/?k=bHSSwcRPsgEwRTfUu9r_6w&d=16125004755173])
Account Configuration
1. The Accommodations Status module is enabled for all existing AAPPL configured accounts.
2. The module is added to the default set of modules enabled during AAPPL account creation. 
3. The TMS description is updated to “View the status of requested accommodations “
4. Please remove “-only for USBE/DoDEA”

See attached document (edit link at top of page1)

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients

*Please explain any specific risks of non-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non-completion, please type N/A.:*
N/A

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer-facing documents or collateral?:*
Yes

*Please list/describe the documentation or client-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:*
website pages - K-12 Test Accommodations
documentation - request form, client site navigation,

Thanks,

Young-A

column1: INTK-685: Tech: Updates to eliminate PII from the TDMS DB
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Annie Wendel

*What is your email address?:*
[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This affects US\-based testing data.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Compliance

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Maintenance/Troubleshooting: Regular system upkeep items and requests to address issues with platform performance, stability, or security 
Data Deidentification/Destruction

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As LTI, I want to stop passing candidate PII to the TDMS and maintain it only in TMS so that we are compliant with our privacy policy and data deletion/deidentification requirements.

As WPT, I want the Admin Site search functions to pull candidate name from the TMS database instead of the TDMS DB so that PII can be eliminated there.

As WPT, I want the Admin Site Retest Review feature to pull candidate from the TMS database instead of the TDMS DB so that PII can be eliminated there.

As AAPPL/OPIc, I want the DC/RR features that generate reports through Formstack to pull candidate name data from the TMS DB instead of the TDMS so that all PII can be eliminated there.

As LPT, RPT, LNR, I want to stop sending PII into the TDMS DB so that PII does not flow to locations where it is not needed.

As LTI, I want to change name data to Appt ID in all locations in the TDMS once these processes have been updated so that we are compliant with our PP and PII is not stored outside of the TMS DB.

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
PII is no longer sent to the TDMS DB for any product
All existing PII in the TDMS DB is changed to Appt ID

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Test Candidates

*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:*
Failure to comply with our PP
Inability to complete data deidentification/deletions

*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:*
N/A

*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:*
No

column1: INTK-684: Diagnostic Grid API for Univ of Utah
column28:
*What is your name?:*
Jennifer Quinlan

*What is your email address?:*
[jquinlan@languagetesting.com|mailto:jquinlan@languagetesting.com]

*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:*
This project is estimated at approximately 5 SPs or 10 Hrs.

*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Improved customer/external user experience
Meeting a customer requirement

*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:*
Yes

*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:*
Price quote: Need formal  pricing for an external party.

*What kind of estimate does this project require?:*
Formal estimate/price quote for an external party

*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::*
As an administrator over Bridge programs at University of Utah L2TREC, I want to receive Diagnostic Grid data for my learners via an API with LTI, so that I have fast and simple access to grid data/results (OPI, OPIc, WPT) which I can analyze in a similar fashion to what BYU has been doing. I want the API to function as the the Diagnostic Grid API built for BYU functions. 

As an administrator of Bridge programs, I would like a formal quote from LTI for the development of this custom API for diagnostic grids. 

*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:*
Bridge program administrators receive a formal quote from LTI for the development of a custom API for diagnostic grids.  

Bridge program administrator can access diagnostic grid data in a fashion similar to what BYU is currently able to do with the custom API that LTI built for them. 

*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:*
LTI Clients
LTI Employees

column1: CLONE - duplicate Credu OPI request scheduled --- access code 1110667 vs. 1110668
column28:
Lumiere at Credu (Multicampus) called to report duplicate OPI request scheduled for access code 1110667 and 1110668. Can you check how this request was duplicated? Was it on requestor’s end or glitch in our system?

Thanks,

Diane
column247:
27/May/25 10:42 AM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Response from Multicampus about the issue:

----

Dear Kim,

Hope this email finds you well.



Sorry for the late response.

Of the total 4 candidates below, in the case of KYUNGHYUN, this was not an system error because the candidate intentionally registered both tests.
However, the other 3 cases, there were errors when candidates were paying by credit card through PG(Payment Gateway).

Now our developer has revised if PG payment has not been completed like this, so that no information can be transferred to LTI.

and we expect the same case to no longer happen.

In addition, we also cross-check the registered test data from LTI Client and MC TMS on a daily basis.

If you have any other questions, please feel free to let me know.
Thank you.
column248:
29/May/25 11:40 AM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Multicampus has fixed it, I am not seeing duplicate orders for the past week.

Thank you
-Rohan
