column1: CLONE - Vulnerability Disclosure (Security) - Salesforce case 00839435
column28:
The from email is [wajahathadi4@gmail.com|mailto:wajahathadi4@gmail.com]

Greetings Team,

Hope you are doing well. I am a security researcher and bug bounty hunter and I have discovered a very high priority vulnerability on your website that can be used to perform Server Side Request Forgery Request, Denial Of Service attacks and also used to take over the blog admin accounts. I am hoping to receive a bug bounty reward for this once its validated at your end.

Please find the detailed report below.

*URL: https://languagetesting.com/blog/xmlrpc.php*

*CVSS*:7.5 (High)

 

*Description*:The website [https://languagetesting.com/blog|https://languagetesting.com/blog|smart-link]  has the xmlrpc.php file enabled and could thus be potentially used for such an attack against other victim hosts. WordPress that has xmlrpc.php enabled for pingbacks, trackbacks, etc. can be made as a part of a huge botnet causing a major DDOS. Attackers can exploit the XMLRPC API to perform denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, brute-force attacks, and in some cases, even remote code execution. This vulnerability occurs when the XMLRPC API is enabled on a WordPress site, allowing attackers to exploit the feature, which is designed to allow remote publishing, or syndication of posts, and is commonly used by blogging tools and mobile applications.

 

*Screenshot:*

 

*Impact:*
The xmlrpc.php vulnerability has a significant impact on WordPress sites, allowing attackers to perform brute-force attacks, denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, and even execute remote code. These attacks can lead to compromised website security, data breaches, and complete website takeover. Additionally, this vulnerability can impact website speed and performance, causing website downtime and affecting website visitors.

*Remediation:*
There are several ways to mitigate the xmlrpc.php vulnerability, including disabling the XMLRPC API if it is not needed, restricting access to the xmlrpc.php file using IP-based access controls, using a plugin to limit brute-force attack attempts, and implementing two-factor authentication. Additionally, keeping WordPress and all installed plugins up-to-date can help ensure that any known vulnerabilities are patched quickly.

*References:*
[https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2020-28036/|https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2020-28036/|smart-link] 
[https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-28036|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-28036|smart-link] 

 

 

*Further, I am expecting compensation for a responsible disclosure and please address the issue. It will be helpful for your website's security and if you wish we can discuss this further through Via Linkedin, Signal, Telegram , Zoom, Skype or Google meet .* 

 

Let me know if you are interested in more vulnerability reports and if you need any help from my end regarding the reported vulnerability :)

 

Looking forward to your positive response.

 

*Thanks & Best regards*

Wajahat Hadi

This issue was also reproduced by Annie and Kim. 
Now, the test has the status “Rating Status: Finalized” and is no longer in the Retest queue.

column253:
27/May/25 10:01 AM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;[~accountid:557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb] and [~accountid:712020:2106d34b-0331-4a39-b8ba-7c975d935c29] I looked into this with Kim and she shared that she had reported a similar issue back in September of last year to [~accountid:557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8]. Apparently, when an Admin Site user tries to finalize a test at IM from any of the queues mentioned on this ticket (Retest/RCP/UR followup/TA review queue) the expected behavior is for it to not save any change to the IM delineation score and to flow to the IM Delineation queue for further handling. From that queue, the rating can be finalized and the IM delineation score adjusted to override the automatic one assigned based on back end logic when needed. So is is possible, based on this information, that this is not actually a bug but is instead expected behavior?

column261: INTK-600: GeoFence Magento Part 2

column1: As a TMS user, I want to see an error message if I try to create/edit a TMS account where the country field in the address or the billing country is Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria so that I understand that I can't proceed due to geofencing.
column28:
Error message: 

Due to contract/compliance requirements, we are not able to do business with entities in Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria. If you have a business reason for doing so, please seek approval from the Director Operations and submit a Help Desk ticket to have the system override put in place.
column164:
Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.

Approved for release on {{now}}.

Deployed to production on {{now}}.
column247:
28/Aug/25 1:28 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Hello [~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc],

When a TMS user tries to modify an existing account, if they change the country or billing country to one of the Geo-fence countries (Syria, Cuba or Iran), when they try to save the page, the error message pops up (attached screenshot 1).

When a TMS user creates a new account, if they select one of the Geo-fence countries (Syria, Cuba or Iran) for the Country or Billing country then the same error message pops up (attached screenshot 1).

The request had North Korea as one of the Geo-fence country as well, however I have observed that we only have Korea in the dropdown list of countries, it is mainly used for accounts like Credu, Seoul Foreign School and other accounts which have address of South Korea. If I were to add Korea to the geo-fence list then it would not let the user make changes to any of these existing accounts.

Additionally this functionality is created in a way that we can add/remove the countries from this Geo-fence list and modify the error message at the DB level (so no deployment is required).

Thank you
-Rohan
column249: 29/Aug/25 10:18 AM;712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c;Working as expected for all countries.

column261: APM: System should ask for confirmation when finalizing a rating outside the rating range of the test form taken

column1: As the system, I want to apply logic to each WPT and OPIc form and rating range so that the Admin Site can then alert users when finalizing a test with a rating outside of the range.
column247:
19/May/25 12:03 PM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;As a Rating Admin, when manually finalizing an ACTFL (not ILR) test rating with a rating that falls outside of the rating range for a test, system should pop up an alert: "The rating entered for Test ID [1234567] is outside the rating range for the test form taken. Are you sure you want to finalize with this rating?" A "Yes" and "No" option button should appear in the pop-up. If user selects "Yes" the rating is finalized. If they select "No", the pop up should disappear and the user should be brought back to the previous screen where they can adjust the final rating.



These are the product-specific rating ranges: 

For survey-based and semi-fixed form WPTs, the rating ranges are as follow:

Form 1: NL-IM

Form 2: NL-AM

Form 3: NL-S



For survey-based and semi-fixed form OPIcs, the rating ranges are as follow:

Form 1: NL-IL

Form 2: NL-IH

Form 3: NL-AL

Form 4: IH-AH

Form 5: AL-S



Attached to the epic are specific details on forms/ranges to which this logic should be applied.

* An admin select multiple tests(3 tests for example) to finalize.
* Two ratings for two tests are inside of the rating range, so, two ratings will go through.

column1: Rater Site - Unable to Assign Rating to WPT Tests
column28:
By entering a rating and clicking submit button the system displays an error message not appropriate

*Steps to reproduce:*

Log in to Rater Site

Click on Fetch & Rate WPT

Select a test and click on Rate button

Enter Rating and Final Rating 

Click on Submit button

*Expected behavior:*

The test can be correctly submitted 

*Obtained behavior:*

The system displays a pop up message: “Because you became inactive while rating this test, it has been unfetched from your rating queue. This occurs when an hour passes without you entering a rating on a task within the test. Please click OK and fetch another test if you’d like to continue rating.”
column247: 19/May/25 9:00 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;[~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c] I fixed this case. Could you try to submit? I deployed the front end code. If you don’t see the change, please clear the cache and open a new browser. And I think you assign this test to ‘Rater1’. If so could you also try to fetch a test and submit a rating to see if it works fine? Let me know if you have any questions. Thanks.
column248: 19/May/25 1:51 PM;712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c;Now it is working as expected [~accountid:557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb]

column251:
21/May/25 8:58 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;[~accountid:712020:3f21e66d-8a5a-4017-9b64-b4bc8d67473c] What I meant was the rater needs to fetch a test from the Rater site(See the screenshot blow) and need to submit a rating. You don’t need to assign a test from the Rater admin site. But currently there is no WPT test that can be fetched. I will check WPT data and let you know once rater can fetch a WPT test.

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As an LTI Tester/Rater, I want my login credentials to be sent to me in a slightly more secure manner so that they're not sent in a single email that could easily be intercepted.

The email body currently displays this:

Dear \[Kim Sallee (Admin)\]

Here is your username and password for the LTI RaterSite

User Id : \[kSallee\] 
Password : \[PASSWORD\]

column1: APM: System should ask for confirmation when finalizing a rating outside the rating range of the test form taken
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
This is an issue that impacts US platform tests mainly

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved internal LTI user experience

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As a Rating Admin, when manually finalizing an ACTFL (not ILR) test rating with a rating that falls outside of the rating range for a test, system should pop up an alert: "The rating entered for Test ID \[1234567\] is outside the rating range for the test form taken. Are you sure you want to finalize with this rating?" A "Yes" and "No" option button should appear in the pop\-up. If user selects "Yes" the rating is finalized. If they select "No", the pop up should disappear and the user should be brought back to the previous screen where they can adjust the final rating.

System should NOT block the ability to finalize with a rating outside of the rating range but it should ask for confirmation from the Admin before accepting a rating that's outside the range. 

For survey\-based and semi\-fixed form WPTs, the rating ranges are as follow:
Form 1: NL\-IM
Form 2: NL\-AM
Form 3: NL\-S

For survey\-based and semi\-fixed form OPIcs, the rating ranges are as follow:
Form 1: NL\-IL
Form 2: NL\-IH
Form 3: NL\-AL
Form 4: IH\-AH
Form 5: AL\-S

If we don't have a rating range set in the system for FF tests, those tests could/should be excluded (or a list of those forms could be provided to APM for us to set a rating range so that they can be included).

Display a pop up but do not block. May need to split into two phases doing the FFs later.

\*Different queues where OPIc are finalized that need this functionality:\*
Rate Pending
Retest
Rating Management → Search
TA Review

\*Different queues where WPTs are finalized that need this functionality:\*
WPT TA Review
Rate Pending
Rating Management → Search


Phase I = OPIc
Phase II = WPT

If multiple tests are being finalized at once, an error popup should explain which Test ID(s) are being attempted to be finalized outside of the range and allow the Admin to select "proceed" or "go back". If they select "proceed", the system should finalize with the ratings assigned. If they select "go back", system should retain all the selections made by the admin, but allow them to go back to the test(s) in question and adjust the final rating before the admin attempts to "save" the final ratings again. 

Same applies to WPT except that many originate in the old WPT system so can't pull the content easily. Need to ID which ones we don't have Form IDed then associate.

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
When attempting to finalize tests with ratings outside the rating range, a pop up confirmation message will appear. When the user selects "Yes" in that popup, the test should be finalized with the rating previously entered. When the user selects "No" in that popup, the test rating should not be finalized and the user should be brough back to the previous page so that the final rating can be adjusted.

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Human error will continue to cause these tests to be finalized in an inconsistent manner

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
resources

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

———————————————

column1: INTK-624: APM: Handling tests when candidate proceeds with unsupported browser
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:\*
a) fewer tests would be taken/submitted using unsupported browsers, which should result in fewer UR ratings.
b) tests that are taken/submitted using unsupported browsers would be billable to the candidate/client by changing any URs to NR ratings

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
impacts all tests, all platforms, all locations

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Improved customer/external user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As a test candidate (for any ACTFL test type), when accessing the test login page using an unsupported web browser, system should display a pop\-up message informing the candidate of the compliance issue along with a warning that are proceeding at their own risk (with exact verbiage to come) so that candidates understand when they're taking a risk by taking the test with their current setup and can acknowledge that they will not receive an unbillable UR if a technical issue occurs. Message should read \*\-\[ANNIE TO CONFIRM FINALIZE THIS WORDING —>\]:\-\* \-"You are using an unsupported browser, which may impact your testing experience and final rating. It is recommended that you NOT proceed with taking your test until you can do so with a supported web browser. (See System Check page for the list of supported browsers for this test.)" and offer two option: "Proceed at my own risk" or "I'll come back on a supported browser."\-

\*FINAL WORDING:\*
"You are using an unsupported browser. This may cause issues while testing that could affect your final rating. Please do not log in to the test until you are using a supported browser, as listed on our \[System Check|\[[https://www.link.com]\]\] page."

\* Needs to link to Sys Check page for each product
\* Buttons below: 
\*\* "Proceed at my own risk"> Allow user to log into the test.
\*\* "I'll come back on a supported browser."> Close the pop\-up 



As testing company, when a test is finalized with a UR rating due to technical reasons and the system identifies that the candidate completed the test using an unsupported browser, the system should change the rating to an NR with the reason code of "Test was taken using an unsupported browser, which caused technical issues. The test taker chose to proceed to test even though a warning was displayed." so that LTI is paid for a test where a candidate chose to proceed when a technical issue was likely to happen.

As an Admin Site user, I want to select this reason code from a dropdown when finalizing human\-rated tests with this rating so that tests are released with the correct reason code.

As all machine\-rated tests, I want to finalize based on the existing finalization logic and have my results flow to Client Site with the reason code wording above so that users understand the reason behind the rating.

As a testing company, when a test is finalized with a UR due to a technical issue caused by taking the test with an unsupported browser, the Reason Code should display on the TMS Follow up Page and in the TMS SSRS Test Detail report under the UR/NR Reason Codes column.

OPIc, WPT, ILS, and PW should all still flow to the rating systems for rating as normal; even if an unsupported browser is used, so that a rating can be assigned if possible. YES, BUT WITH THE FACT THAT THEY USED AN UNSUPPORTED BROWSER FLAGGED IN SOME WAY SO THAT THE ADMIN IS AWARE.

On the Admin Site, APM should see a flag or indicator that a test was taken with an unsupported browser. YES, AND IDEALLY BY DEFAULT THIS SHOULD BE TO THE RIGHT OF THE COLUMN WHERE A REASON CODE IS PROVIDED SO THAT IT'S VERY CLEAR TO THE ADMIN WHEN FINALIZING A RATING.

On the Admin Site, there should be a new dropdown option when finalizing all of the human\-rated tests: UR\-Unsupported browser. YES

That way, when APM is finalizing a test where a rater selected UR/NR Technical issue (in whatever version that appears for each product) for OPIc, WPT, ILS, or PW, they will be able to see the "unsupported browser" flag on the test and finalize it with "UR\-Unsupported browser" YES

Then, we will need to pass that Reason/Sub\-Reason to TMS where it will appear as NR: Test was taken using an unsupported browser, which caused technical issues. The test taker chose to proceed to test even though a warning was displayed." The test will be billable. YES

We do not need to implement this for Proficiency Screener. CORRECT 

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
a candidate arriving at the test login page with a known browser incompatibility will receive a message alerting them to this issue before they proceed with the test.
a test finalized as a UR that was taken with on an unsupported browser will be released as an NR with the appropriate reason code. 
a TMS user will see the UR Reason Code in the Follow Up screen and on the TMS SSRS Test Detail report in the UR/NR Reason Code field

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates
Multicampus Test Candidates

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
N/A

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
none

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
Yes

\*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:\*
updated client messaging

———————————————

column228:
We are currently leveraging the existing automated messaging system to handle emails automatically whenever there is an issue during the Magento Failed Transactions process. All exceptions, issues, and related information are being logged into a dedicated database table, which serves as the source for these notifications. This allows the system to automatically send emails to the appropriate users.

column261: INTK-632: Tech: Develop an automated API call to pull failed transactions from Magento and run a once daily process to create the record in TMS

column1: As LTI Support, I want an automated daily process to pull failed transaction data from Magento and create the test record in TMS so that I don't have to manually do so.
column228:
The system checks if an order already exists with the same order and payment details. If it doesn't. Then create a new order in our systems.

!image-20250930-215002.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215002.png"!

!image-20250930-215008.png|width=459,alt="image-20250930-215008.png"!

!image-20250930-215013.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215013.png"!

!image-20250930-215018.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215018.png"!

!image-20250930-215022.png|width=676,alt="image-20250930-215022.png"!

Every test order within an order is processed individually, and changes are applied to each test order separately. If even a single test order fails, the entire Magento order will not be updated. Only the missing or failed test orders will be reprocessed during the next automatic run, and once the entire order has been updated, Magento’s order ID will be updated as well.

column1: INTK-638: 2nd Rating Auto-Finalization & 3rd Rate Fetching - CAPEX2025_APM_022_03
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Ash Britton
\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com]|mailto:\[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com\]\]|mailto:\[\[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com\]|mailto:\[abritton@languagetesting.com|mailto:abritton@languagetesting.com\]\]\]
\*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:\*
\- Reduce manual intervention for Rating Admins especially during high\-volume periods.  
\- Increase rating consistency by applying automated logic for finalizing ratings.  
\- Improve efficiency by allowing Mentor Raters to self\-serve (i.e., fetch) tests needing a third rating without admin assignment.  
\- Streamline management queue to ensure smoother test processing.  
\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)
\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
AAPPL tests are only administered in the US
\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Process improvement/automation
\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes
\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site
\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.
\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 
\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As an AAPPL Rating Admin, I need enhancements to the rating logic and queue management system to automate the finalization of test ratings that currently flow to the “Review” queue, where either R1 or R2 rated the test “Below N1” or “Below N4” and the two ratings are not in agreement. This improvement will streamline the rating process and enhance overall test processing accuracy.  The attached logic includes rules for these tests now so that they can be handled in a more streamlined way. 
 As an AAPPL Rating Admin, I need the ability to enable Mentor Raters to fetch tests needing a third rating without Admin intervention in the Rate Pending queues. This improvement will improve workflow efficiency by eliminating Admin intervention.   The attached logic includes rules for these tests now so that they can be handled in a more streamlined way. 
As an AAPPL Rating Admin, I need to optimize the queue management system behavior by refining finalization logic to reduce reliance manual assignments of tests in the “Final Ratings Held” queue. The attached logic includes a smaller subset of tests that will need to flow to this queue for Rating Admin manual assignment or for manual These improvements will streamline the rating process.  
The attached “New 2nd rating logic for non\-Spanish PW tests” document outlines the use cases and rating logic for all AAPPL tests identified as needing a 2nd rating. It does NOT propose any changes to criteria for determining when a test requires a 2nd rating; the existing logic allowing most tests to be finalized with a single rating remains unchanged. This logic focuses on the flows and finalization rules for tests that are routed for a 2nd rating only. 
Auto\-Finalization Logic:
\- Implement auto\-finalization for tests receiving specific ratings:  
\{color:\#006644\}\-\-Form A: Two ratings of "Below N1" → Auto\-finalize as “Below N1.”  \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\-\-Form A: One "N1" rating and one "Below N1" rating → Auto\-finalize as “N1.”  \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\-\-Form B: Two ratings of "Below N4" → Auto\-finalize as “Below N4.”  \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\-\-Form B: One "N4" and one "Below N4" → Auto\-finalize as “N4.” \{color\} 
\- Apply an adapted Spanish PW machine scoring logic to automate final rating decisions across all languages  
\{color:\#006644\}\- A 3rd rating is required for scores that are not “adjacent” or two levels apart (i.e., that are three sublevels apart or more)   \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}Fetching for Third Ratings by Mentor Raters in the “Rate Pending” queue:\{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\- Allow all Mentor Raters to fetch tests requiring a third rating from the “Rate Pending” queue. \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\- Ensure tests needing a third rating no longer require manual assignment by Admins.  Now, only tests requiring a 4th rating will be manually handled by Rating Admins.  \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\- Maintain existing assign/unassign functionality for Admins but enable Mentor Raters to self\-serve.  \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\- Maintain the display of the timestamp (date and time) when the rater fetched (or was assigned) each test. \{color\}
Queue Behavior & Routing Adjustments :
\{color:\#006644\}\- Route all tests needing a second or third rating to the “Rate Pending” queue \{color\}
\- Reduce reliance on the “Final Ratings Held” queue by allowing most tests to be finalized through automated logic.  
\- Only tests requiring a 4th rating will flow to the “Final Ratings Held” queue for manual intervention by a Rating Admin.   
\{color:\#006644\}\- Maintain existing assign/unassign functionality for Admins in the “Final Ratings Held” queue. \{color\}
\{color:\#006644\}\- Maintain a 24\-hour hold in the “Pending One\-Day Hold” queue after a test’s rating is finalized.  \{color\}
\- Do not make any changes to the auto\-submit functionality; auto\-submitted tests should continue to be finalized as a UR if too many responses are left undone. Otherwise, they should flow to the Unrated/Rate Pending queues, as normal.  
\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
\- Auto\-finalization occurs for Below N1/N4 ratings according to predefined logic.  
\- Tests are routed and finalized based on the attached AAPPL Rating Finalization logic (which follows many similarities as the Spanish PW finalization logic).   
\- Tests Requiring a third rating route to the “Rate Pending” queue.  
Mentor Raters can fetch third\-rating tests from the “Rate Pending” queue without admin intervention.  
\- The “Final Ratings Held” queue will only contain tests for which no rating finalization logic exists and will be handled manually by the Rating Admin team to either assign an additional rater or finalize with one of the existing ratings.   
\- Timestamp info is displayed for R3’s tests in “Rate Pending queue” showing when the test was fetched or assigned 
\- All finalized tests will continue to remain in the “Pending One\-day Hold” queue until the next scheduled release. (Current logic says this is at 10pm ET the next day.)  
\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters
\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
N/A
\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
N/A
\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*

As an AAPPL test\-taker, I want the subnavigation for Novice and Int tasks in the IL/IR components to work in the demos as it does in the real test so that I understand the functionality while practicing to take the real test. Users should not be able to navigate forward and backward.

As an AAPPL test\-taker, I want the error messaging in the ILS when there is an issue with audio quality to work just like it does in the real test so that users have a clear understanding of the test experience.

As an AAPPL test\-taker, I want the buttons on the Choose an English Test screen to say Start instead of Continue when I access the demo so that I am not confused by the button text.

column1: INTK-670: APM: Increase PW Machine Scoring Frequency
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Alan Stoddard

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[astoddard@languagetesting.com|mailto:astoddard@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[astoddard@languagetesting.com|mailto:astoddard@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[astoddard@languagetesting.com|mailto:astoddard@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[astoddard@languagetesting.com|mailto:astoddard@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:\*
We need the PW tests to flow in at more frequent intervals so that the raters who are only allowed to 2nd rate get a mixture of test types (PWs and ILSs) and have some tests available at other times of the day. Raters move from 2nd rating only position (when they're new or are returning after a hiatus or a period of lower performance) into 1st rating position when they've rated enough tests to prove their performance is strong. These raters are only getting PW tests and only if they're early birds. Otherwise, they are not able to engage with our rater site hardly at all and then aren't experienced raters of both test types when the high volume testing periods occur. 

It's possible that other approaches to changing this could be explored besides how the machine rates them. Perhaps tests could be "held" for 2\-3 "drops" into the Rater Site at something like 3pm and 8pm instead of all being dropped in at 6am. There could be other solutions we could explore. 

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
AAPPL PW tests are US Only.

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved customer/external user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Some or part of the work for this project will be completed by an external vendor that has already been identified.

\*Please provide the name of the vendor.:\*
Cloudacio

\*Please provide a contact name and email address for the vendor.:\*
\[\[[jpolivera@languagetesting.com|mailto:jpolivera@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[jpolivera@languagetesting.com|mailto:jpolivera@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[jpolivera@languagetesting.com|mailto:jpolivera@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[jpolivera@languagetesting.com|mailto:jpolivera@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*How will this vendor participate in the project?:\*
LTI engineers will complete most of the development work with some support from the vendor.

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As a rater I want to be able to rate PW tests so that I can return/move to the first rating position

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
PW tests become available to raters 3 times per day (proposed 3pm, 8pm, and 6am)

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Testers/Raters

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Non\-completion can result in rater dissatisfaction and require recruiting new raters.

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
None

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

column1: INTK-636: TECH: Block duplicate AAPPL uploads and queue large uploads up for processing
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Annie Wendel

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[awendel@languagetesting.com|mailto:awendel@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
AAPPL is US\-based

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As a Client Site user, I want to submit my AAPPL test request for <100 tests and have it processed immediately so that I can access the logins under AAPPL Test Status right away and use them.

As a Client Site user, I want to submit my AAPPL test request for ≥ 100 tests and have it sent to a queue for processing within 4 hours and have wording on the screen inform me of this process so that I can place larger orders and come back later to access the logins rather than waiting indefinitely for uploads that seem to time out and cause frustration and tax system resources.

As a Client Site user, I want to see a module where I can view my "AAPPL Test Request History" and see the status of queued uploads so that I have confirmation that the upload was received and is being handled and can keep track of previous orders placed under my user. 

As LTI, I want to prevent Client Site users from re\-uploading the same file when an identical upload is already in progress so that duplicate tests are not generated in the system that later must be manually deleted.

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
User submits AAPPL order for < 100 tests and it processes immediately.
User submits order for ≥ 100 tests and it flows to queue with appropriate on screen wording.
Orders are listed in the new AAPPL Test Request History module along with statuses that stay accurate and up to date.
If an order is in progress the system blocks an additional upload of the same order template with appropriate error handling.

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Clients

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Frustration for users when they don't know if their order has completed and attempt to re\-upload multiple times and end up with duplicate tests. IT/Ops resources are required to resolve these issues.

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
Needs to go into place after the surge.

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
Yes

\*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:\*
Major updates to AAPPL ordering documentation

They are using the Safari browser. They are also making sure the microphone setting in Safari is set to "always allow." 

They’ve tried Chrome; however, they get a message that the browser is not supported in the AAPPL System Check.

This is the AAPPL System Check that they are using:

column1: CLONE - SOBL Upload Error message - needs clarity
column28:
The SOBL file attached created an error message that did not make sense. The file did not provide 10 BUSINESS days lead time for column O, as they tried this on the 4th. In addition, the times in column P, S, and V are off.

Diane and I responded to the client so we are good but can the error message be changed?

looking for it to say. The first choice date is not 10 business days from today, and your start time is not valid; please use the drop down choices.



[https://languagetesting.atlassian.net/browse/THD-10038|https://languagetesting.atlassian.net/browse/THD-10038|smart-link]
column247:
29/Apr/25 12:50 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;*Current Logic:*

I have done some testing in Vijay comm account to confirm the error messages.

# When trying to order on (04/24/2025), if the date selected for 04/30/2025, the error message for 7 days comes up.
# When trying to order on (04/24/2025), if the date selected for 05/01/2025, the order goes through. 

So, the system is accepting orders that have first choice date 7 days from the ordering date.

The error message and the system behavior is in-tune of each other. 

*Request Logic change:*

Request to IT to change the validation and error message to be 10 business days per the documentation.

In your example:

# When trying to order on (04/24/2025), if the date selected is less than 05/7/2025, the error message should pop up.
# When trying to order on (04/24/2025), the valid date is 05/07/2025 or later and the order should go through = 10 business days

Error message: *Row x column Y: The ‘1*^*st*^ *choice date” must be 10 business days beyond current date. Please provide a new date that is 10 business days from today.*
column248:
29/Apr/25 1:43 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Hello [~accountid:5d518e6b92705e0c1c5e5700],

The Logic has been changed to accept SOBL test orders that 10 days out in the future. The validation and error message both reflects 10 days (not business days).

* If I order the test on 04/29/2025, the system will accept for orders for 05/09/2025 or after.

Thank you
-Rohan

column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
WPT is a global test

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As an LTI Rating Admin, I need all WPTs that are rated NR or UR by a rater to be moved to the UR/NR Follow up queue for review by a member of the Admin team so that another rater doesn't fetch the test and bill us for an unratable test. 

As an LTI Rating Admin, with this change, I need the the UR Followup queue to be renamed to the UR/NR Follow up queue.

As an LTI Rating Admin, I need the existing functionality in the UR Followup queue to remain (the ability to assign another rater, to finalize a test from here, etc) so that I can continue to manage tests efficiently and effectively from this queue.

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
Tests rated NR by any rater, in any position, will flow to the UR/NR Followup queue, from which no rater can fetch a test, but from which an Admin can assign another rater, if needed, or finalize a test rating. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
We will continue to pay raters for extra and unnecessary ratings

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
none

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

———————————————

column1: INTK-667: APM: Update Tester Utility and Rating flows to accommodate Limited Cert OPIc raters vs Full Cert OPIc raters
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
KIm

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*What are the expected non\-financial business benefits of this request?:\*
minimize errors, ensure raters are rating only tests they're qualified to rate, minimize inefficiencies when a rater fetches a test they cannot rate (and have to wait for an Admin to take it back from them before they can continue rating).

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
will impact all clients

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Compliance
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
TMS / B2B Client Site / DLI OARS
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As an LTI Admin, I need the ability to indicate in the tester utility page if an OPIc rater has full or limited certification and for that information to flow into the Rater/Rating Admin sites and to the tests that raters can fetch and rate. 

Limited certification means raters can fetch and rate test forms 1\-3 and full certification means that raters and fetch and rate test forms 1\-5.

Currently there are boxes for ACTFL OPI Limited Rater and ACTFL WPT Limited Rater in TMS, but to my knowledge, these are never used and have no functional purpose. Perhaps we can remove them or repurpose one of them for this need.

Discovery is needed to understand and determine requirements for all aspects of this project but we need IT's help to understand the flow and the decisions needing to be made. 

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
OPIc raters marked as Limited Certification OPIc raters will only be able to fetch test forms 1\-3 while Full Certification OPIc raters will be able to fetch any level test. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
n/a

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
n/a

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

Do we need to enlarge the comment box? I’m asking because we have bigger one for OPIc and AAPPL. See the screenshot and let me know. Also let me know regarding the visual limitation display is needed for all product so I can work on it. Thanks!

column253:
29/Apr/25 8:50 AM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;Hello, [~accountid:557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb]! Kim got back to me on these questions yesterday. This was the conversation we had. What do you think?

Visual display of character limits:

*Annie:* We’re blocking submission of comments that exceed the limit for each product (300 for OPIc, 1000 for WPT, 4000 for OPI/AAPPL) with a popup error message. I also added this as a requirement for each product: *As a rater, I want to see the number of characters allowed in a Rater Comment and how many characters I have entered so that I can edit my comment to within the limit ie ###/1,000 characters as I am typing.* I’m hearing from Yun Ju that this increases the effort by a good bit. What do you think? Is the visual display piece described in the user story above a necessity or a nice to have? 

*Kim:* It’s definitely something I’d like to have but it’s not 100% required. However, here’s the rub: if I’m a rater who rates OPI, WPT, and OPIc, how I am supposed to manage these different comment lengths? It’s not reasonable for them to know that comments in WPT can be 3.3x longer than comments in OPIc or that OPI comments can be 4x longer than those for WPT and like 13x longer than for OPIc. They’re just writing their rationales (some of them) or reporting issues. Is it possible to standardize the character counts? Or at least raise OPIc’s to 1000? (And your comments below confirms that it’s not a possibility. Sigh.)



Sizes of text boxes:

*Annie:* Yun Ju brought up the fact that currently the comment boxes for OPI and WPT are short little one line, half-width text boxes whereas the ones for OPIc and AAPPL are multi-line and offer more space (even though OPIc’s limit is only 300 characters).

We already know that standardizing the character limit for comments across products requires changes to the DB that greatly increase the effort. Yun Ju is asking, though, whether we think the size of the text boxes should be standardized, enlarging the ones for OPI and WPT. They will all be renamed to “Rater Comment.” Is this currently an issue for raters? What do you think? 

*Kim:* I expect it would be a welcomed change to raters to have a larger text box, particularly for OPI. For WPT, it’s hard to see in the screenshot if there’s enough real estate for a bigger field, but if there is, that would be good.

My only concern about increasing the text boxes is that this improvement may raise the question “why didn’t you standardize the text field length” when you made these cosmetic changes? But yes, I think the raters would appreciate the larger boxes. Please proceed.

30/Apr/25 7:45 AM;557058:26f98589-9525-42cb-b77e-007234f0eceb;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc]  The following is the estimate. Could you please decide which features do you want me to work on? Thanks! FYI [~accountid:5e94b2311086270c147d6db0]

column1: INTK-631: APM: Update Rater Site to warn raters if their comment is too long so that their ratings can flow as expected
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
impacts both US and Korea\-based tests

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
Note: Depending on the size of this effort and a few other details, we may decide to roll this into a CAPEX project. For now, though, I'm submitting this as OPEX work.

Currently, if a rater submits a comment in the Comment field that exceeds 1,000 characters, the system throws an error but doesn't provide any details as to the nature of the error. This occurred recently with a WPT and it was determined that on the test screen in Rating Admin the rating was displayed, yet the rating was not actually captured and the test remained in the Unrated queue. Manual intervention by IT was needed to shorten the comment and to push the rating into the systems so that the test could flow as normal. We need to provide raters with feedback to alert them to the issue so that they can correct it, submit their rating, and have the rating flow without manual intervention by APM and IT.

As a rater, I need to be aware that there is a character limit on the Rater Comments text field and also know how many characters my comment is so that I edit my comments to not exceed that limit. (i..e the field show show XXX/1000 characters to make them aware of the limit and able to see how close they are to it.)

As a rater, the system either needs to block me from entering more than 1000 characters OR some other visual queue is needed to alert them that they have exceeded the limit (the "XXXX/1000 characters" needs to change to red text, for example) so that they don't attempt to submit a rating with too many characters in that field OR if the field isn't limited to that many characters nor a visual notice is provided, the system needs to display a pop\-up message upon attempting to submit the rating that tells the rater that "Your rating has NOT been submitted. The Rater Comment field exceeds the character limit. Please shorten your comment and try again."







\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
Rater is alerted to correct the issue so that the submission doesn't go through if the character limit is too high. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
continued manual intervention needed

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
resources

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

column1: [AAPPL English Form A & B] In the PW component it is possible to block the "Next" buttons
column28:
*Description:*
The “Next” buttons are enabled once the user types something in the text box. However it is possible to block them if the user leaves the focus of the text box fast enough after typing something. This is a very edge case that is very likely to not occur.

*Steps to reproduce:* 
- Scenario 1
1) Go to the PW component for an English AAPPL
2) Put the focus on the text box
3) Type some keywords and almost instantly click outside of the text box

- Scenario 2
1) Go to the PW component for an English AAPPL
2) Put the focus on the text box
3) Hold a keyboard and while holding it remove the focus of the box

*Actual result:*

The button is not updated to be in a enabled status

*Expected result:*

The button is enabled once there is text in the text box.

column1: [AAPPL English Form A & B] If clicking the Finish button in the PW component while still pressing a key with the focus in the text box it prompts the user to an unsaved changes and a blank screen
column28:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# In an AAPPL test go to the PW component.
# Complete all the tasks up to the 6/6.
# In the 6/6 put the cursor in the text box.
# Press a key and hold it.
# While still holding the key, click the Finish button.

*Actual result:*

It has different actual results based on the Form A or B and the Browser
Form A:

* Chrome: A browser pop up appears with a message that says that there are unsaved changes, asking if the user wants to stay in the page or leave. If clicking “Stay”, the User just stays in a blank screen where cannot do anything else other than log out. After logging out and logging in again, special characters are displayed in the button elements. 
* Firefox: A browser pop up appears with a message that says that there are unsaved changes, asking if the user wants to stay in the page or leave. If clicking “Stay”, the User just stays in a blank screen where cannot do anything else other than log out. After logging out and logging in again, the user is able to continue without further problems, no special characters are displayed.
* Edge: *Same as in Chrome Form A*. A browser pop up appears with a message that says that there are unsaved changes, asking if the user wants to stay in the page or leave. If clicking “Stay”, the User just stays in a blank screen where cannot do anything else other than log out. After logging out and logging in again, special characters are displayed in the button elements.

Form B:

* Chrome: *Same as in Firefox form A*. A browser pop up appears with a message that says that there are unsaved changes, asking if the user wants to stay in the page or leave. If clicking “Stay”, the User just stays in a blank screen where cannot do anything else other than log out. After logging out and logging in again, the user is able to continue without further problems, no special characters are displayed.
* Firefox: nothing happens, the flow just continues. There’s no confirmation pop up though. 
* Edge: nothing happens, the flow just continues. There’s no confirmation pop up though. 

*Expected result:*

After clicking the “Finish” button the User receives a confirmation pop up and is redirected to the next screen,

column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
This impacts all customers, Korean\- and US\-based.

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Bug Fix: Something that used to work has stopped working and needs to be fixed.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
After sorting columns in OPIc Rating Admin Retest, Rate Pending, RCP, UR/NR Follow\-up, and Final Ratings Held queues, when a Rating Admin wishes to finalize a test rating and change the IM Delineation score, the system appears to accept the new IM score, but then automatically reverts back to the earlier default score. Rating Admins need to be able to use the sort functionality to efficiently and accurately work within these queues and need to be able to finalize tests with adjusted IM Delineation scores. 



\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
Admins will be able to sort columns in all the above\-referenced queues (Retest, Rate Pending, RCP, UR/NR Follow\-up, and Final Ratings Held) and then change the IM delineation scores by selecting the final rating (IM), which causes the system to highlight the test/row, then change the IM subscore, and then finalize/save, and the system will finalize with the updated IM Delineation score. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Multicampus Test Candidates

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
we risk releasing incorrect ratings to MC candidates

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
Resource availability

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

column1: As an admin for an individual account (B2B that makes their candidates pay) I want to see when the candidate has scheduled the test on the scheduled test page of the client site.
column28:
The scheduled test date for all remotely proctored tests should be displayed on the Tests Scheduled page of the LTI Client Site.  This information is displayed for B2B accounts so we want that logic to apply to individual accounts and the information to be put in the same place.
If the test is rescheduled and TMS updates then the client site should reflect the latest date/time.
Example: TMS client ID 24397 candidate appt ID 8773959
column164:

If the test is rescheduled and TMS updates then the client site should reflect the latest date/time.
Example: TMS client ID 24397 candidate appt ID 8773959

my candidate has scheduled an OPIc with Prometric and I log into the client site and proceed to the test scheduled page.  When I look up the candidate I can see the date and time they are planning to take the test.

This cookie is intended to be read by JavaScript.

Frontend frameworks (like Vue.js, Angular, etc.) read this token from the cookie and include it in an X-XSRF-TOKEN header for CSRF protection in AJAX requests.

 

Session cookies are set with HttpOnly Flag

column1: Cookie without “Secure” Flag - TDS all links UAT
column28:
h2. 1.     Issue: Cookie without “Secure” Flag

*Severity: Medium*

*URLs:* [https://uat-tms.languagetesting.com/|https://uat-tms.languagetesting.com/|smart-link]  [https://uat-tms.languagetesting.com/tms/|https://uat-tms.languagetesting.com/tms/|smart-link]  [*https://df4wlfr7yrczi.cloudfront.net/#/login*|https://df4wlfr7yrczi.cloudfront.net/%23/login] [*https://opic.lti-inc.net/*|https://opic.lti-inc.net/]

[*https://wpt.lti-inc.net/*|https://wpt.lti-inc.net/] [*https://actfllr.lti-inc.net/*|https://actfllr.lti-inc.net/] [*https://lrcat.lti-inc.net/*|https://lrcat.lti-inc.net/] [*https://proficiencyscreener.lti-inc.net/*|https://proficiencyscreener.lti-inc.net/] [https://aappl2.lti-inc.net/login|https://aappl2.lti-inc.net/login|smart-link]  [*https://opickorea.lti-inc.net*|https://opickorea.lti-inc.net/] [*https://wptkorea.lti-inc.net*|https://wptkorea.lti-inc.net/] [*https://opiclr.lti-inc.net*|https://opiclr.lti-inc.net/]

 

One of the application’s session cookie was found to be missing the ‘Secure’ flag. This could allow the session cookie to be transferred over an unencrypted HTTP connection. A malicious user with the ability to intercept the clear text communication between the user and the application server may be able to capture the session identifier and hijack that user’s account, an attack known as ‘session hijacking’.

If a cookie is set with the 'Secure' flag, then it will only ever be transmitted over an encrypted SSL/TLS connection. This means that if an attacker intercepts the traffic, they are unable to view the contents of the cookie in plaintext. This is especially important for any cookie that contains sensitive information, such as session identifiers.

This flaw can be exploited even if the application only operates over HTTPS. This is because the browser will send the cookie in the request, which by definition occurs prior to the services availability being established. An attacker can trick a client into making such a request, including the cookie, regardless of the existence of a HTTP service in reality.

!image-20250314-130702.png|width=524,height=301,alt="image-20250314-130702.png"!

 

 Recommendation:

 

# Any cookie that is set while the session is utilising HTTPS should be done so with the 'Secure' flag set, unless the cookie contains non-sensitive information only;

# It is good practice to add the 'Secure' token to all cookies regardless of contents; since it adds little overhead and removes the decision of how sensitive the cookies contents are.

 

 

h2. Web References:

·         OWASP - Secure Flag - [https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SecureFlag|https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SecureFlag]

·         [http://ASP.NET|http://ASP.NET|smart-link]  - [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/msp-n-|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/msp-n-p/ff648341(v%3Dpandp.10)] [p/ff648341(v=pandp.10)|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/msp-n-p/ff648341(v%3Dpandp.10)]
column261: 2025 Pen Testing Remediation

column1: Username Enumeration  - WPT Korea
column28:
h2. 1.     Issue: Username Enumeration Severity: Medium

*URLs:* [*https://wptkorea.lti-inc.net*|https://wptkorea.lti-inc.net/]

 

The application is vulnerable to username enumeration whereby the validity of a given email address can be confirmed or inferred by the application. This allows an attacker to enumerate valid usernames that exist within the system. 

This is often the starting point for further attacks such as password guessing or brute force attacks against a valid user account

!image-20250314-130459.png|width=383,height=657,alt="image-20250314-130459.png"!

*Figure 4 - Message displayed when entering an invalid username*



 As shown in the images above, the application's error messages reveal if an email address exists within the system or not. It is often difficult not to reveal the validity of a given username without affecting usability but there are ways to achieve a thorough defence against username enumeration.

 Recommendations:

# Ensure that error messages are generic enough to be useful to a legitimate user, but not verbose enough to leak sensitive information to an attacker;

# Ensure that application behaviour doesn’t change dependent on a valid user existing within the system. Common areas for username enumeration attacks include login forms, forgotten password forms and registration forms. In all cases, the application should not change its behaviour. This should include elements such as the HTTP response code, the size of the page returned, the time a page takes to be served or anything else which may help an attacker distinguish between a valid and invalid user within the system;

# Defences such as account lockout and strong password policies help mitigate the threat in the event that an attacker obtains a valid username.

 

 

h3. Web References:

·         GNU Citizen - Username Enumeration - [http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/username-|http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/username-enumeration-vulnerabilities/] [enumeration-vulnerabilities/|http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/username-enumeration-vulnerabilities/]

·         OWASP - Testing for Username Enumeration - [https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_user_enumeration_%28OWASP-AT-|https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_user_enumeration_%28OWASP-AT-002%29] [002%29|https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_user_enumeration_%28OWASP-AT-002%29]

·         Security Risk Advisors - Username Enumeration - [http://www.securityriskadvisors.com/blog/post/user-enumeration/|http://www.securityriskadvisors.com/blog/post/user-enumeration/|smart-link]

column1: Frameable Response Clickjacking - LPT/RPT/ALIRA UAT
column28:
Issue: Frameable Response Clickjacking
Severity: Medium
Hosts: [https://actfllr.lti-inc.net|https://actfllr.lti-inc.net]
It might be possible for a web page controlled by an attacker to load the content of this response within an iframe on the attacker's page. This may enable a "clickjacking" attack, in which the attacker's page overlays the target application's interface with a different interface provided by the attacker. By inducing victim users to perform actions such as mouse clicks and keystrokes, the attacker can cause them to unwittingly carry out actions within the application that is being targeted. This technique allows the attacker to circumvent defenses against cross-site request forgery, and may result in unauthorized actions. Note that this issue is being reported because the application's response does not set a suitable X-Frame-Options header in order to prevent framing attacks. Some applications attempt to prevent these attacks from within the HTML page itself, using "framebusting" code. However, this type of defense is normally ineffective and can usually be circumvented by a skilled attacker.

!image-20250314-125345.png|width=498,height=532,alt="image-20250314-125345.png"!

h3. Recommendation:

 

You should review the application functions that are accessible from within the response, and determine whether they can be used by application users to perform any sensitive actions within the application.

 

To effectively prevent framing attacks, the application should return a response header with the name X-Frame-Options and the value DENY to prevent framing altogether, or the value SAMEORIGIN to allow framing only by pages on the same origin as the response itself. To configure IIS to send the X-Frame-Options header, add this your site's Web.config file:

 

<system.webServer>

...

<httpProtocol>

<customHeaders>



 

 

 

<add name="X-Frame-Options" value="SAMEORIGIN" />

</customHeaders>

</httpProtocol>

...

</system.webServer>

 

h3. Web References:

·         OWASP - Clickjacking - [https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Clickjacking|https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Clickjacking]

·         OWASP – Clickjacking Defense Cheat Sheet - [https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Clickjacking_Defense_Cheat_Shee|https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Clickjacking_Defense_Cheat_Sheet.html] [t.html|https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Clickjacking_Defense_Cheat_Sheet.html]

MozillaDevNetwork-[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options|smart-link]
column247:
28/May/25 4:19 PM;557058:15ff54f8-dc88-4620-992a-b87b940522b8;Add the following to /etc/apache2/sitest-available/actfllr.lti-inc.net.conf

<IfModule mod_headers.c>

    Header always set X-Frame-Options "DENY"

</IfModule>

Restart apache2

Validate : curl -I [https://actfllrhtml.lti-inc.net|https://actfllrhtml.lti-inc.net]

Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
Currently, the system only routes tests where a Rater identifies the presence of an Alarming Comment if the rater is in R1 or R2 position, despite the requirements having requested that all tests, no matter the rating position, be routed to that queue when a rater identifies an Alarming Comment having been made.

Please correct this gap in the development by routing tests that are 3rd rated in any queue (likely TA Review, Review, Final Ratings Held queues) to the Urgent Review queue if any 3rd (or 4th) rater marks any testlet/task has having Alarming Comments.

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
Tests where R3 or R4 rates the test with an NR \- Alarming Comments code will flow to the Urgent Review queue. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
we miss the ability to act urgently, when required, because we don't benefit from the alerts set up when tests move to this queue, potentially delaying our report to the school/teacher.

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
resources

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

———————————————
This task was submitted through \*Tech/CAPEX/External Contract Intake and Approvals\*

.

*Proposed Solution:*  Make the Email address field optional (similar to Candidate ID) *ONLY* for SOBL and ALIRA tests under the Tests Scheduled Module in Client Site. This will require escalation and work from Vijay to address that. I will now escalate this ticket.

column1: CLONE - Rater reporting repeated issue with OPIc sound quality of recordings at the 30 second mark
column247:
21/Feb/25 1:10 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;[~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc], 50 OPIc test login credentials have been to Learnosity’s engineering team. They will be taking multiple tests on our prod environment.

These tests are under Vijay comm account so it shouldn’t interfere with Rating admin team’s work.
Thank you
-Rohan
column248:
20/Mar/25 5:39 PM;60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e;Hello [~accountid:60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc],

After our meeting today the following items have been discussed:

# Learnosity’s findings: The issue is happening at the time of audio recording, NOT when they combine the audio files into 1 piece.
# They are unable to replicate the same issue, according to them the short term solutions provided by them, to double the audio quality or increase the time limit of the sample question to 45 seconds, are the only two solutions for the moment, either of them are not guaranteed to prevent the issue, but to identify more data about the issue.
# LTI IT team met to discuss Learnosity’s comment, we have decided to gather up evidence for the time being to see how many tests are affected, so far around 20 OPIcs and 1 ILS have been reported in the span for 3.5 months.
# No further action needed from IT team at the time being.

I have attached the file of the Affected OPIcs, it includes details like the Browser, OS and devicetype that was used by the candidates for their tests.

Closing this case now.

Thank you
-Rohan

[^Affected OPIcs.xlsx]
column249:
24/Mar/25 10:11 AM;60c109f220d2dd00702a49fc;Thank you, [~accountid:60ef4bde413fc70069f90b4e]. This is helpful.

[~accountid:5e94b2311086270c147d6db0] of 17 tests that IT checked Google Analytics data for, 13 were taken on some version of Edge and 4 were taken on an unsupported device or browser (iPhone/Electron). 

While we work through these requirements, [https://app.asana.com/0/1201964277215674/1209457323419246/f|https://app.asana.com/0/1201964277215674/1209457323419246/f|smart-link] , it looks like with about 13 hours of work (+QA) we could have just the detection and pop-up warnings on the TDS for AAPPL and OPIc (since iPhone/Electron seem to be popping up as at least part of the issue). Do you think it’s worth moving forward with those changes in the short term? Or should APM just continue to collect data on these occurrences until a bigger decision is made about Edge as well? Please let me know your thoughts when you have a chance.
