column1: Page 1 not detecting when test rating is higher than response levels that are lower than the task
column28:
If a selected response level is lower than the task level and the selected test rating is higher than that response level, the form should warn the rater to review their response levels.

For example, if an L2 task is given a response level of 1, it would show that the examinee did not reach L2 for that task, and should not be rated at L2 or higher. 

!image-20250218-220803.png|width=1079,height=88,alt="image-20250218-220803.png"!

If the rater rates the test at L2,

!image-20250218-221004.png|width=1079,height=250,alt="image-20250218-221004.png"!

Then the following warning should appear

!image-20250218-220721.png|width=1007,height=53,alt="image-20250218-220721.png"!

column1: CLONE - TMS B2B account set up - ensure billed to client
column28:
When creating an account (New Client setup ) and the client type is Government, Commercial or Academic-Institute is selected LTI must bill the client.

# The default buttons for “is client Billable?” Should be set to yes and “is candidate billable?” No.  The current setup has them both set to No and No
## If the person does not change the configuration there is an error message that says “-Please select at least one Billable Option.”
# -The logic should be if the Client type is Government, Commercial, or Academic-Institute then the “is Client Billable?” must be- +*-yes-*+
## -The error message if anything other than Is client billable (yes) and Is candidate billable (no) should say “-+-Please select yes for Client is billable-+-”-

 

Point 2 has been discarded as we currently have B2B going B2C accounts where candidate billable is selected yes.

column1: INTK-580: OPS: AAPPL ILS volume bar within the test
column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Mark Dulsky

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[mdulsky@languagetesting.com|mailto:mdulsky@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
The AAPPL product is on the LTI test platform

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved customer/external user experience
Meeting a customer requirement

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Test Delivery Systems: AAPPL, ALIRA, BYU Reading and Listening (APPT), CAT, LPT/RPT, MC OPIc, OPIc, OPI, Telephone OPIc, WPT

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.
New Product, Feature, or Functionality: Request for something new that our platforms don't do currently but that will improve user experience.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
As an AAPPL Learner, when taking the ILS, I want to know if my microphone has stopped working while recording my answer in the prompt even though it passed the check prior to the test.
This check should be on every prompt and visually show when the microphone is not recording or there is too much background noise.  This will produce a popup that pauses the recording until it is fixed or when it is detected it gives the learner one additional chance by re\-recording the entire response.  Learners can continue to log out of the test and the system requires a microphone check when they log back in.

\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
As a learner taking the AAPPL ILS, my microphone fails (muted/not recording) on the second prompt. I am notified of the issue and given the opportunity to correct it.

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Clients
LTI Test Candidates

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Avant has a microphone check inside the Stamp test (see attachment) which impacts our ability to sell the AAPPL and we are getting critical feedback from USBE on this issue.

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
ACTFL will need to approve changes within the AAPPL test and documentation will need to be updated.

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
Yes

\*Please list/describe the documentation or client\-facing communication that will need to be updated or created.:\*
AAPPL account resources will need to be updated along with the video

column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
Allocation by % of Revenue (where both MC and LTI will benefit from the project)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
impacts both MC and US tests

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Cost reduction and/or Revenue Generation
Improved customer/external user experience
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
Is it possible for the system to distinguish tests that were fetched/captured by a rater vs those that are assigned to a rater by an Admin? If not, this would be a necessary first step ahead of the development needed for our request.

As a rating Admin, I need tests fetched/captured by a rater (not assigned to a rater by an Admin, though) to be released back into the queue for other raters to fetch/capture at several points during the day so that a test doesn't risk being late because a rater fetched it and walked away (and also so that an Admin doesn't have to take steps to manually unassign such tests).

If it's not a big deal, the ideal solution would be run hourly and would unassign any tests that had been fetched/captured for more than 60 minutes at the time the process runs. 

However, if something less frequent is needed, the requested frequency for this action to take place is outlined below by test type, in case it's needed. In all cases, when the process runs, it is unassigning any tests that have been captured for >60 minutes and returns them to the queue to be fetched by another rater. (Otherwise, it would be preferable for this process to take place across all test types simultaneously.)

AAPPL \- could be done twice daily (or more often)
OPI \- should be done at least twice daily, ideally 3\-4 times daily (or more often)
WPT \- could be done once daily (or more often)
OPIc \- should be done at least twice daily, ideally 3\-4 times daily (or more often)

If done just once daily, the process could run nightly.

If done twice daily, the process could run once each day and each night (roughly at noon and midnight, but IT's input and preference could likely be accommodated)

If done three times daily, the process could be done at approximately 8\-9am, 4\-5pm, and 12\-1am (but again, IT's input and preference could likely be accommodated)

If done four times daily, the process could be done at approximately 6am, noon, 6pm, and midnight (but again, IT's input and preferences could likely be accommodated)


\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
The system would leave alone any tests assigned to a rater by an Admin, but would unassign tests that were fetched/captured by a rater more than 60 minutes ago but not submitted at the next time the process runs. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Unassigning tests is inefficient for the Rating Admin team and would be better handled automatically.

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
The ability for the system to recognize the difference between a test that has been assigned to a rater vs one that a rater has fetched/captured... and resource availability. 

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

column228:
The Special Reason Client Deactivation site has been completed.  Upon logging in, users will see the following features:

# Client Selection:
## Drop Down menu listing all available clients.
# Data Grid:
## Client Name: 
###  Displays the name of the deactivated client.
## Reason:
### Shows the reason for deactivation, including reasons for any child accounts.
###  Long reasons are shortened for display purposes, but users can view the full text using the View/Edit action.
## Action Date:
### Date the deactivation took place. 
### Latest updates will be reflected in this column
## Action By: 
### Displays the user who performed the most recent action.
### Latest updates will be reflected in this column
## Actions: 
### View/Edit:
#### Allows us to see the client name as well as the entire reason for the client deactivation.

!image-20250506-185243.png|width=1355,height=903,alt="image-20250506-185243.png"!

!image-20250506-190047.png|width=1310,height=900,alt="image-20250506-190047.png"!

Validations:

# The client name cannot be updated in the form, only the reason
# Only valid clients can be selected, selection of invalid clients will return a handled exception.
# If the reason is empty, you cannot move forward with account deactivation

!image-20250506-190216.png|width=1365,height=915,alt="image-20250506-190216.png"!

#  A pop up will be prompted to confirm any actions performed by the user 

!image-20250506-190301.png|width=1248,height=875,alt="image-20250506-190301.png"!

5. Only privilege users will have the ability to ‘Save’ any changes 

!image-20250506-190631.png|width=1512,height=623,alt="image-20250506-190631.png"!

 6. As an added security measure, a session-level counter has been implemented to track submit actions performed by non-privileged users. If a non-privileged user attempts to submit the form multiple times, the LTI support team will be notified.

 7. For pagination, 20 records will be loaded per page, this value can change.

column28:
\*What is your name?:\*
Kim

\*What is your email address?:\*
\[\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]|mailto:\[[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]|mailto:[ksallee@languagetesting.com|mailto:ksallee@languagetesting.com]\]\]

\*Please select the cost allocation that should apply to this request.:\*
US 100% (LTI US covers the full cost)

\*Please provide details supporting the cost allocation that you have selected for this project.:\*
a US platform issue

\*What are the desired outcomes of this project? Please select all that apply.:\*
Improved internal LTI user experience
Process improvement/automation

\*Does this request require LTI internal IT development resources?:\*
Yes

\*Which system(s) will be impacted by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
Rater Related: Rater Site / Rating Admin Site

\*What kind of request is this? Please check the most representative option(s).:\*
Platform/Process Improvement: Requesting a change to existing functionalities that will make things better for users.

\*What kind of estimate does this project require?:\*
Internal estimate to determine required project resources and inform prioritization 

\*Thinking from the user's perspective, please list the requirements and specifications for the project. If possible, list the requirements in this way::\*
Currently, when an OPI test is missing audio, it moves into the Rate Pending queue and sits there along with dozens of other tests. It's highly inefficient for the Admin team as they cannot easily see that a test is missing its audio and these tests sometimes get assigned to (or fetched by) raters who can't do anything with the test, resulting in the Admin having to work to unassign the test, sometimes multiple times before the audio gets added.

The Admin team requests that these tests be moved into a different queue until such time as the audio file is added to the test. It could be a new queue (called something like "No Recording \- Hold" queue or potentially we could repurpose & rename the LTAC Review queue since it's not being used anymore). 

When the audio is added to the test, we would need the test to move automatically to the Rate Pending queue to be fetched by (or assigned to) a rater. It is not desirable for the Admin to have to regularly check all tests in this queue to determine if the audio file has been added. So, we are requesting that it not require rating admin intervention to move it to where it can be fetched/assigned.


\*Acceptance Criteria: When development is complete, what will you need to see in order to sign off on this project? We will provide you with verification that all of the criteria you list here are met once the project is complete. Please make a detailed list of the expectations.:\*
Tests without audio files would not appear in the Rate Pending queue and would, instead, appear in a new/repurposed queue now called "No Recording \- Hold". 

When the audio file is added, the test will move without Admin manual intervention to the Rate pending queue to finish its rating process. 

\*Who are the users who will be affected by this request? Please select all that apply.:\*
LTI Employees
Testers/Raters

\*Please explain any specific risks of non\-completion that have been identified or that should be considered. If there are no risks of non\-completion, please type N/A.:\*
Continued inefficiencies on the Rating Admin side of things, continued frustration for the raters 

\*Please explain any dependencies associated with this request.:\*
IT resources

\*Will this project result in the need to update or create customer\-facing documents or collateral?:\*
No

———————————————

column1: Add UR & NR to the overall rating selection options
column28:
If UR or NR is selected, the rater should be required to check either the alert LTI or alert ACTFL checkbox. If neither is already checked, the system should ask the rater whether to alert LTI or ACTFL and sets the appropriate checkbox. System requires one of the alert checkboxes to be checked before submitting. Page 2 is skipped when the rating is UR or NR since there are no descriptors for UR or NR.

This refers to the test rating (and not the individual task ratings. i.e.:

column1: Provide 2 submit options on page 2
column28:
Provide two options on page 2 for submitting the form:

Option 1: Submit rating and rationale

Option 2: This rationale needs further review by ACTFL.

Option 1 is the normal form submit

Option 2 should flag the rating for ACTFL review, and show a field to explain why further review is needed. Don’t show option 2 when ACTFL review is flagged on page 1.

column1: Set functional tasks to base rather than plus level
column28:
Functional SLDs are at the base rather than the plus level. i.e. for 1+, the functional SLDs should be either 1 or 2, not 1+.

Clarification: On page 2 of the form, the service level descriptors (SLD) have a level number listed after each one. In the functional category, you should not see any with a level that ends with a plus (+) sign

column1: OARS changes to prevent large data pulls
column28:
# All options under Select Test additionally require a date range selection of < 365 days
# If filters other than/in addition to Select Test are used, the date range is not required.
# There is no default in either date field and BOTH must be selected when required.
# Three error messages:
## When only the Select Test filter has a selection and a date range is not entered: "Please limit your search by selecting filter criteria or adding a date range of 365 days or less. You must either enter a date range or select at least one filter criteria in addition to the *Select Test* dropdown."
## When no start date is entered in the Dates field for a search that requires a date range: "Please enter a start date for your search in the *Dates* field. You may only search for a date range of 365 days or less."
## When no end date is entered in the Through field for a search that requires a date range and the start date entered is > 365 days in the past: "Please enter an end date for your search in the *Through* field that is less than 365 days from the start date entered in the *Dates* field."

Update wording:

# Please limit your search by selecting filter criteria or adding a date range of 365 days or less. You must either enter a date range or select at least one filter criteria in addition to the *Select Test* dropdown.

!image-20250129-220828.png|width=50%,alt="image-20250129-220828.png"!

# Please enter a start date for your search in the *Dates* field. You may only search for a date range of 365 days or less.

!image-20250129-221406.png|width=475,height=121,alt="image-20250129-221406.png"!



# Please enter an end date for your search in the *Through* field that is less than 365 days from the start date entered in the *Dates* field.



!image-20250129-221503.png|width=370,height=109,alt="image-20250129-221503.png"!
column228:

!image-20250130-134005.png|width=746,height=334,alt="image-20250130-134005.png"!

column1: CLONE - Request for IT to fix bug for Rating Certification feature in the Follow Up queue of a test record in TMS.
column164: Deployed to QA/UAT on {{now}}.
column228:
The current appointment has a rating certification of Commercial for LPT.

!image-20251017-210513.png|width=694,alt="image-20251017-210513.png"!

# If the user does not update the rating certification, the system will proceed with normal execution without applying any changes to the rating certification. Thus avoiding overhead. The system will react to changes made to this drop down.
# The system checks at the client level whether the client has access to the newly selected rating certification.
## If the client does not have access, a message will be displayed informing the user, and no further processing will occur.
## The rating certification will automatically revert to the client’s current valid certification.
!image-20251017-210549.png|width=646,alt="image-20251017-210549.png"!
## Any exceptions encountered during the execution related to the rating certification selection will prompt an appropriate error message to inform the user.
!image-20251017-210627.png|width=646,alt="image-20251017-210627.png"!
# If the selected rating certification is valid, the update will continue as expected.
## The new rating certification will be reflected on the FollowUpQueue page.
## It will also be updated in the payment information, provided that the client has not yet been billed for this appointment.
## !image-20251017-210718.png|width=646,alt="image-20251017-210718.png"!
!image-20251017-210723.png|width=492,alt="image-20251017-210723.png"!
